loans.name: Ramil

texts.en: Ramil N. is a 29-year-old butcher who sells fresh meat in his own small booth.  He lives in the southern part of Azerbaijan, Imishli region with his wife, one son and one daughter. He started his business in 2000, when he first began help his father. He learned very soon how to cut meat and how to choose healthy animals for meat.  Veal, beef and mutton are in very high demand all across Azerbaijan and people use meat in every day life. His meat booth used to bring him good income but as the economic situation in the country is unstable and prices for products rise every year.  Ramil's  income is not enough to cover family needs and Ramil has applied for 1200 USD to improve the conditions of his business, repair his place of work and to be able to purchase more animals for meat selling.

loans.use: Going to improve conditions of his business

loans.name: Amavi

texts.fr:
Amavi S. is a widow who was born on December 31, 1952 in Tado. A resident of the Djidjolé neighborhood, she is a dressmaker by profession and has five children in her care. Her small savings do not allow her to open her own studio, which has led to a loss in customers. She is asking for a loan of $400 to open a studio and buy sewing machines so that she can provide for her family.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Veuve Amavi S. est née le 31 décembre 1952 à Tado. Résidante dans le quartier djidjolé, elle est couturière de profession, et a 05 enfants à sa charge. Ses maigres économies ne lui permettent pas d’ouvrir son atelier ce qui lui fait perdre sa clientèle. Elle sollicite un crédit de $400 pour ouvrir un atelier, acheter des machines afin de pouvoir aux besoins de la famille.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her general food store

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Born in 1967, Mr Kossi A. is married and the father of four (4) children. A planter in the aforementioned town, he markets products derived from palm tree oil. His plantation of palm trees is aging and he is today in the process of selling a large portion to be cut down. Therefore, he feels a need to renew the plantation. He requests a loan of $500 to prepare the land and buy young palm tree plants. The completion of this project will allow him to secure his income so that he can provide the necessities for his family.

Translated from French by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1967, Monsieur A. Kossi est marié et père de quatre (4) enfants. Planteur dans ledit village, il commercialise les produits dérivés du palmier à huile. Sa plantation de palmiers est vieillissante et il est aujourd’hui en train de vendre une grande partie pour l’abattage. Ainsi, le besoin de renouvellement se fait sentir. Pour aménager le terrain et acheter de jeunes plants de palmiers, il sollicite un crédit de $500. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra de sécuriser son revenu afin de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy young palm tree plants

loans.name: Katogo B(I) Group

texts.en:
Kasifa is 28 years old and married with three children. She has a poultry business. With the extra business profits, she wants to buy for herself a plot of land.Sarah has a beauty parlor. Hanifa and Sarah both sell second hand clothes and want to use the loan to expand their businesses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry feed.

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en: Alberta B. is a 29 year-old single mother of 1.  Alberta has been selling women’s clothing for the past 9 years and she hopes this loan will increase her monthly income.  She is requesting a loan of $525 to buy clothing from seamstresses to sell to her clients.  Alberta is also a member of a lending group called “Anointing Group”, which consists of 10 members in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy clothing from seamstresses to sell to clients.

loans.name: Adriana Raquel

texts.es:
Adriana is a member of the women's communal bank of Santa Barbara, located in the district of Calleria in Ucayali. She is 45 years old and the mother of 2 children. With the first loan she received, Adriana decided to invest in a business selling food. Now she has a small shop and sells meals in the evenings. She opens her shop from 7am until 9pm. Her children and her children help her prepare and sell her meals in the evening.

With the new loan, which she will repay in 5 months, she will purchase general grocery items for her shop, such as rice, sugar, milk, ham, oil, sodas, vegetables, as well as office and school supplies. Adriana is very happy and content. Her business is growing and her sales are increasing thanks to the support of her children and her husband, and all the efforts to bring them a better quality of life and a good education.

La señora Adriana pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Santa Bárbara, ubicado en el Jr Lima No 138, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 45 años y es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es comerciante. Adriana con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertirlo en el negocio de venta de comida. En la actualidad ella cuenta con una bodega y un negocio de venta de comidas en las noches, abre su bodega a las 7am., hasta las 9pm, paralelo a ello con la ayuda de sus hijos y de su esposo se dedica a la preparación y venta de sus comidas en la noche.. Con este préstamo de S/. 1000 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, compro abarrotes para su bodega como: arroz, azúcar, leche, jabón, aceite, gaseosas, embutidos, pasamanería, verduras, útiles de oficina y escritorio, etc. Adriana esta muy feliz y contenta, su negocio esta creciendo sus ventas aumentan gracias al apoyo de sus hijos y de su esposo pues todo el esfuerzo que realiza es para darles una mejor vida y una mejor educación.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE STOCK FOR HER SMALL SHOP SUCH AS RICE, SUGAR, MILK, HAM, SODAS, AS WELL AS OFFICE AND SCHOOL SUPPLIES.

loans.name: Marsella 3 Group

texts.es:
Lidia P. Nuñez makes tamales, a tradition dish in Soyalo, Mexico. She sells them two or three times a week, taking them to the surrounding areas. Since she has been cooking since she was very young, but only started selling her goods three years ago. People say that her food tastes great. She's 25 years old and belongs to the group "Marsella 3" along with Flor de Maria Sebastiana G. S., who sells fruits and vegetables, and Juana H. Diaz, who also makes tamales. Each one plans to invest in their businesses and thus increase their earnings so they can continue growing and expanding them.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

LIDIA P. N. PREPARA TAMALES, COMIDA TRADICIONAL DE LA COMUNIDAD DE SOYALO. ELLA VENDE DOS O TRES VECES POR SEMANA Y LOS LLEVA A VENDER A LAS COLONIAS ALEDAÑAS. DESDE MUY PEQUEÑA APRENDIO A COCINAR, PERO DE SALIR A VENDER HACE TRES AÑOS. DICEN POR AHÍ QUE DOÑA LIDIA ¡ TIENE UN BUEN SAZON¡ . ELLA TIENE 25 AÑOS, DOS HIJOS Y PERTENECE AL GRUPO MARSELLA 3, JUNTO CON DOÑA FLOR DE MARIA SEBASTIANA G. S. (VENTA DE FRUTAS Y VERDURAS) Y JUANA H. DIAZ (PREPARA TAMALES). CADA UNA DE ELLAS INVERTIRAN EN SUS NEGOCIO Y ASI OBTENER GANACIAS QUE LES PERMITA SEGUIR CRECIENDO Y AMPLIANDO EL NEGOCIO.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of ingredients for tamales / INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MAIZ, HOJAS DE PLATANO Y ELOTE E INGREDIENTES.

loans.name: Mahamadou Awali

texts.fr:
Mr. Mahamadou Awali I. was born on September 13, 1971 in Lomé. He is married and the father of four (04) children. In 1994, he established his store selling building materials (I. Bros) in the neighborhood of Agoè Zongo. He received a first loan that allowed him to build a shed in the front of his store and to stock up. In order to revitalize his business, Mr. Mahamadou Awali I. is requesting a loan of 300.000FCFA to buy 12 drums of strong glue, 30 sheets of plywood, five bags of lime and a box of steel points. Thus, his store will be more attractive and he will gain a lot of clients.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur I. Mahamadou Awali est né le 13 septembre 1971 à Lomé. Il est marié et père de quatre (4) enfants. Depuis 1994, il a crée sa boutique de vente des matériaux de construction (ETS I. & FRERES) dans le quartier D’Agoè Zongo. Il avait obtenu un premier crédit qui lui a permis de faire un hangar devant sa boutique et de faire un approvisionnement. Dans le souci de redynamiser son activité, Monsieur I. Mahamadou Awali sollicite un crédit de 300.000FCFA pour acheter 12 bidons de colle forte, 30 contre plaquer, Cinq sachets de chaud et un carton de pointe d’acier. Ainsi sa boutique sera plus attrayante et il gagnera beaucoup de clients.

loans.use:
Purchase of building materials

Achat de matériaux de construction

loans.name: Lider

texts.es:
Señora  Lider S. T. is an associate of the Credit Group known as "Alisson".  She lives in the department and province of San Martin, District of Tarapoto. Her residence is situated on  jr Shapaja No. 640.  She is dedicated to the sale of all kinds of iron and other materials for construction, in a rented location on jr Shapaja block 4.  
 

Señora Lider started with the sale of supplies, but, seeing that she was not very profitable, her husband motivated her to change her business.  She took advantage of his economic activity; that is, the production of windows and doors of iron.  He did not have a better idea than selling the materials to use in the production of the same.  Therefore he could worry just about filling the orders of his customers, without a need to worry about the transfer of the materials.  The business has been growing considerably, thanks to the good deals he offers his clients and to the good service that he offers.  

With the loan of  1,300 soles, that will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy more iron and diverse accessories for the production of windows and doors.  

 
Señora Lider is 36 years old.  She lives with their husband and their daughter, who motivate her to work harder each day and to manage to meet their designated goals.  One of their goals is to secure their own location to have a fixed and sure place where she can be found at any moment.  

 Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.
La señora Lider S. T. es socia del Grupo de Crédito Mientras Tanto “Alisson” vive en el departamento y provincia de San Martín, Distrito de Tarapoto  su domicilio esta situado en el jr Shapaja No 640,  se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de fierros y otros materiales para la construcción, en un local alquilado en el jr shapaja  cuadra 4.
 

La señora Lider se inició con la venta de repuestos, pero viendo que no era muy rentable, el esposo la motivó a cambiar de negocio, ella aprovechó la actividad económica de él, que es la fabricación de ventanas y puertas de fierro,  no tuvo mejor idea que vender los materiales a usar en la fabricación de los mismos, pues así los clientes  solo harían sus pedidos, sin necesidad de preocuparse en el traslado de los materiales, el negocio se ha incrementado considerablemente  gracias  al buen trato al cliente y del buen servicio que brinda. 

Con el  préstamo  de S/. 1 300.00 que devolverá en un plazo de en 6 meses, comprará más fierros y accesorios diversos para la fabricación  de ventanas y puertas.

 
La señora Lider , tiene 36 años, vive con su esposo y su hija, quienes le impulsan a  esforzarse cada día más y lograr cumplir con sus metas trazadas, una de sus metas es contar con su propio local para tener un lugar seguro y fijo donde la puedan encontrar en cualquier momento.

loans.use: To buy iron and accessories for making windows and doors.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda was working in her mother's restaurant for three years, but during the business' slow season she decided to look for a side job. Now she serves as an in-home babysitter. She works from 7 in the morning until 7 at night. The loans she has received have let her help her mother with the restaurant, and she would do the same with the current one she is requesting. Nilda would like for the restaurant to have a soda fountain.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

Nilda trabajaba en el restaurante de su mamá por 3 años, pero debido a la temporada baja del negocio, ella decidió buscar un trabajo aparte y ahora se desempeña cuidando niños en una casa. Trabaja desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. Los préstamos que ha recibido le han servido para ayudar a su mamá en el negocio que ella tiene. A Nilda le gustaría tener una fuente de soda.

loans.use: Help with her mother's restaurant / Para ayudar a su mamá en el restaurante que ella tiene.

loans.name: Crystell

texts.es:
Mrs. Crystell belongs to the La Familia (The Family) Village Bank located in Javier Perez town on Guillermo Sisley Street in the Calleria district of Ucayali, Peru. She is 22 years old and the mother of one small daughter. Her husband is a skilled laborer. With the first $100 loan Crystell received from Manuela Ramos, she invested in the sale of food.

Now, Crystell has a motorbike which her husband drives while she sells regional fruits from the patio of her home; additionally, on Sundays she sells ceviche, a local delicacy.

With this $675 loan which she will repay in 4 months, she will invest in the maintenance of her motorbike and in the purchase of fruit.

Crystell is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos bank since it has allowed her to become more independent and earn a greater income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Crystell, pertenece al Banco Comunal La Familia, ubicado en AA. HH. Javier Pérez, Jr. Guillermo Sisley Mz.A Lt.25 del Distrito de Calleria, del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 22 años es madre de una pequeña niña. Y su esposo es obrero. Crystell con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 soles decidió invertir en venta de comida. En la actualidad Crystell cuenta con un motokar, el cual es manejado por su esposo, paralelamente se dedica a la venta de frutas regionales en el patio de su casa y los días domingos vende su ceviche (comida típica). Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, invertirá en el mantenimiento de su motokar y compra de frutas. Crystell, esta muy agradecida con el Banco de Manuela Ramos ya que de tal manera ha podido independizarse y así mismo puede dar un ingreso mas a su familia.

loans.use: Motorbike maintenance and purchase of fruits

loans.name: Khekh Niakk1 Group

texts.fr: khekh niakk 1 est un groupe de cinq femmes qui habitent au quartier Diakhao.Elles s'activent dans le commerce de tissus teints depuis longtemps.
texts.en:
Khekh Niakk 1 is a group of five women who live in the Diakhao quarter. They have been active in the commerce of dyed fabrics for a long time.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of dyed fabrics

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey N., age 46, is a widow who lives with six of her ten children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. 

Since 2004, she has had a business making candles to earn a living. She is able to make $10 each day. She is aided by two of her children, one who works in construction and another who is a garment factory worker. Besides making candles, she also works in a recycling business. 

Srey N. would like to take out a loan of $1000 to help her candle-making and recycling businesses.

loans.use: To help her candle-making and recycling businesses

loans.name: Ega

texts.es:
Ega pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Al Progreso del distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash.

Tiene 34 años de edad y tiene un sólo hijo con su conviviente. Su mayor anhelo es conseguir un trabajo estable, aunque menciona que hasta ahora ha vivido tranquila con  su pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza, los cuales se los llevan a a su casa, en la Av. Graciani s/n, Yungay. Ella debe ofrecer y repartir sus productos aún cuando su mayor dificultad en el negocio es que a veces no le pagan puntualmente o simplemente olvidan su deuda, pero se siente tranquila porque siempre está ganando premios en productos y de esa manera ella al venderlos puede comprar algunas cosas para su familia.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará productos de belleza en promoción para tenerlos en reserva y pueda venderlos a mayor precio, así mismo pretende lograr muchos premios con la adquisición de éstos.

Ega sonríe a la vida aún cuando menciona que su esposo trabaja temporalmente y ella apoya a la casa mediante su negocio.
texts.en:
Ega belongs to the "Women of Progress" Communal Bank of the district and province of Yungay, department of Ancash. She is 34 years old and has only one son with her partner. Her greatest hope is to obtain stable work, although she mentions that, up to now, she has lived peacefully with her small beauty products sale business, which she carries out in her house on Graciani Ave., Yungay. She must offer and distribute her products even when her greatest difficulty in the business is that at times her clients do not pay promptly or simply forget their debt to her. But she feels calm because she is always winning prizes in products and upon selling them she can buy some things for her family. With this loan of 1,000 soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy promotional beauty products to have in reserve so she can sell them at a greater price. In this way she intends to win many prizes with the acquisition of these products. Ega smiles at life even when she mentions that her husband does temporary work and she supports the house by means of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products for sale

loans.name: Venyll

texts.en:
Venyll J., a 31-year old mother, owns a flower shop in Polomolok, South Cotabato. Her husband, who is working in a food chain store, has also been helping her run the business. As a mother, she dreamed to give the best to his son who is still studying. She decided joining other wives in CEVI credit program because she believes her participation could help her realize her dreams.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy additional flowers for her business expansion and improvement  of her shop. She stressed that she needs a much better place to display all her flowers.  “This is to attract more customers and augment my sales”, she added.

“By joining CEVI, I have access to credit assistance, training and insurance coverage they provide to all their clients”, she said. “I also had the chance to talk with other entrepreneurs how they manage their businesses”, she added.

loans.use: To buy additional flowers for sale and for improvement of her shop

loans.name: Tafale

texts.en: Tafale Tamato, 27, is married and has two children.  She has many years experience in the plantation business. She sells to the general public and villagers two days per week. Tafale has had two previous loans with SPBD, which are her only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.  She plans to purchase Gromoxone, sting, chemicals, and bush knives for her plantation business.

loans.use: Purchase Gromoxone, sting, chemicals, and bush knives for plantation business

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is engaged in the hog raising business, which has been her way of helping her husband Ruben, a farmer, in earning income for the daily needs of their family. The couple has two children: Robejane – 5 years old and Jenny Rose – 2 years old. They have poor living conditions in the village and they both cultivate rice and corn as their main source of income.

She is now asking financial assistance amounting to PHP 4,000 that she will use to purchase feeds for her hogs. She is hoping that in the coming months she will be able to add at least one or two hogs for her business to grow. Joan said that through the lenders who provide her with financial support and with her hard work and faith in God, nothing is impossible in achieving her dreams. Her investment in the business will also be of great help in sending her children to school in the coming year.

loans.use: Purchase feeds for her hogs

loans.name: Maris Yamileth

texts.es:
La Sra. Maris tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera, ella se dedica a confeccionar prendas, camisas, faldas, pantalones, trajes etc. es una Sra. muy responsabel y amable, ella pasa muchas horas al dia costurando para poder terminar sus trabajos que tiene pendientes para poder entregarlos a sus clientes y cuando tiene tiempos libres en las tardes vende cremas, lipsticks, carteras, shampoos, desodorantes, gel de baño.  ella en estos momentos necesita un credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia y telas ya que tiene muchos trabajos pendientes y necesita comprar dicha materia prima para poder terminarlos. 
Maris tiene dos hijos de los cuales dependen de ella, su meta a corto plazo es ver a sus hijos graduados ya que uno de ellos este año ingresa al colegio.
texts.en:
Maris is 31 years old, and is a single mother. She sells garments, shirts, skirts, pants, suits etc. She is a very responsible and friendly lady, and spends many hours each day sewing so that she can finish the jobs that she has pending, to give them to her clients. When she has spare time in the afternoons she sells creams, lipsticks, handbags, shampoos, deodorants and bath gels. In this moment she requires a loan to buy more merchandise and threads as she now has many pending jobs and needs to buy this material to be able to finish them. Maris has 2 children that depend on her. Her short term goal is to see her children graduate, now that one of them this year will enter school.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cloth, threads, sponges

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: El señor Francisco Javier Z. C. tiene la edad de 45 años habita en la comunidad el Edén ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa la cual le ayuda con las cosas del hogar y en los cultivos, ellos tienen a su cargo tres hijos dos jóvenes que estudian su secundaria y un  pequeñito de cuatros años, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida ya que su casa esta construida de madera y quiere que en un futuro se le apoye para construir su vivienda , el desde hace treinta años se dedica a la agricultura la mayor dificultad que se le ha presentado es la falta de financiamiento ya que sus cultivos carecen de fertilizantes e insumos , el inicio con sus propios esfuerzos para poder mantener  a su familia , el quiere financiamiento para la compra de insumos y poder vender a mejor precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Francisco Javier Z. C. is 45 years old. He lives in the community of Edén in the Ticuantepe municipality with his wife, who helps him in the house and on the farm. Together, they care for their three children, two children in secondary school and a four-year-old boy. Their plans for the family are to improve their quality of life and their house, which is made of wood. In the future, they hope to be able to build a better home.

Since the age of 30, Francisco has worked in agriculture. The biggest challenge that he has faced is not having enough money to purchase the fertilizers and other supplies that his crops need. He began farming on his own in order to support his family. He wants a loan so he can purchase necessary supplies and obtain better prices for his products at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase agricultural supplies for crop production

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth J. S. is 29 years old was widowed 4 years ago. She now lives with her mother in a small village called Paraxquin, which is about 32 km from Tecpan Guatemala. Since she was very young, Janeth has worked with her mother helping to manage their crops and raising their cow in the best way possible. Working together like this has been their way of life for over 20 years. They recently started making and selling bread and plan to invest part of their loan to purchase flour in order to make more bread, which they will sell in their village. During the months leading up to Easter, bread sales increase significantly and the women think it would be a good idea to take advantage of this for their business. Ms. J. says that she must make the most of the strength that she has now at a younger age so that when she gets older she can sustain herself and live with dignity. Her efforts today she is always thinking about the future.

*********************************************************************************
Translated from Spanish by Andrea Bouch, Kiva Fellow.
*********************************************************************************

La señorita Janeth J. S., de 29 años de edad viven con su Madre viuda desde hace cuatro años, ellas viven en la Aldea Paraxquin; desde pequeña trabaja con su mamá, administrando sus cultivos, tienen una vaca, trabajan juntas en su crianza, buscando la mejor manera para cuidarla, la aldea queda a 32 kilometros de distancia del municipio de Tecpán Guatemala, desde hace 20 años trabajan de esta manera unidas para su forma de vida, y hace poco de dedican a la elaboración de pan quieren invertir, una parte en compra de Harina, para hornear, y distribuir en su aldea pan que en esta época es una tradición en Guatemala el consumo de pan, por lo que piensan que es un buen comienzo iniciar este negocio, la señorita J. que por ser joven es un momento para aprovechar su fuerza, para cuando sea de edad avanzada, pueda sostenerse con dignidad y con su esfuerzo ella piensa en su futuro.

loans.use: Materials for making bread and helping to grow crops and animals

loans.name: Ianesi

texts.en: Ianesi S., 33, is married with two children.  She has one year of experience in the German Buns business. She sells to the villagers five days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 320 Tala.  SPBD loans are Ianesi’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, frying pan, coconuts

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali M. is a 53 year old farmer who breeds sheep in the small village of Saatli located in the southern part of Azerbaijan. Ali is married and lives with his parents in one house. Ali started his business in 1985. He chose this type of business because it is very beneficial and brings permanent income to his family.

Ali applied for a 1500 USD loan to purchase 15 sheep at the price of 100 USD each.

loans.use: To purchase 15 sheep to expand his business

loans.name: Magreth

texts.en:
Magreth has been a bites (bread-like rolls) seller in the Kihesa neighborhood of Iringa for 10 years. She belongs to the Msikitini group loan. Every day, she works at her business for eight hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania, a Kiva partner, so that she can buy more wheat flour, cooking oil and sugar for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Magreth is married and has a 16 year old. She also cares for one additional dependent.

loans.use: To buy more wheat flour, cooking oil and sugar

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica L. is from Camp Phillips, Agusan Canyon. She is 33 years old. Monica is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Monica owns and operates a food stall. Her main source of income comes from selling a variety of food products in the local community. Monica has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Monica joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Monica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI to expand her business. Monica is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to expand the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Monica from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue from the business to support the education of children.

-------------------- About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Expanding her business.

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.en:
Feliciano is 57 years old and is a widower. He runs a small lunch catering business from his small farmhouse right outside of town in Urcos, Perú, a location called “Sacred Valley of the Incas”. He currently has contracts with local businesses and individuals to prepare and deliver eighty lunches a day around the main square. A typical lunch costs around $1 and includes soup, a meat dish and a soft drink.

Feliciano has been running his business for two years. With the loan he hopes to add more customers and he eventually hopes to be able to open a restaurant.

Feliciano is part of a communal bank called Qori Orcco that has been working with Arariwa for many years. Each month the members receive financial education from a loan officer, and they also participate in a savings program with Arariwa to help build up their capital. Feliciano and his group are committed to paying their loans according to their repayment schedules.

loans.use: To increase food production to add more clients

loans.name: Zuara

texts.en: Zuara is 45, married and has three children who are all still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Zuara is a trader who sells cereals such as maize. She sells at the market square and also supplies food vendors in her community. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy maize in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Hurshedjon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Тагойев Хуршедчон Муродалиевич – родился 1985 году в районе Гиссар. После учебы в Вузе он устроился на работу в МВД РТ инспектором. Он с детство мечтал иметь собственное авто. Услышав об условиях нашей организации, захотел участвовать. Хуршедчон хочет получить займ в сумме 4400 сомони сроком на 12 месяцев и купить себе автомобиль.

loans.use: Покупка автомобиля

loans.name: Sarm

texts.en:
Sarm S., age 45, is married and has a school-aged child. He lives with his wife and his child in Phnom Penh City. To make a living, he operates his own business as a taxi driver, and he also drives his car for a private company, earning approximately US $15 per day. This amount of income is the primary source of income of the family. His wife is midwife at her home, earning US $2 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, S. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, S. is seeking to increase his income. He is asking for a loan of US $500 to have his car repaired. By doing so, he hopes he will be able to attract more customers to consume his transportation services and generate more income to raise a good standard of living for his family.

loans.use: repair the carf

loans.name: Eliovina

texts.es:
La señora Eliovina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 50 años y es madre de 03 hijos, todos ya independientes.

Lleva 01 año dedicándose a este tipo de actividad, brindando servicios de movilidad urbana en su motokar. Para trabajarlo, su esposo se encarga de trasladarse por diferentes lugares de la Ciudad. Poco a poco fue ahorrando y con ese dinero fue comprando repuestos, para mejorar el servicio a los moradores de la comunidad.

 Con este préstamo de S/. 1,800.00,  comprará repuestos y aceites como: lubricantes, bocamasas, bujías; para así brindar un mejor servicio y atender mucho mejor al cliente.
Hoy en día es una mujer independiente, y es ella y su esposo quienes toman las decisiones y administran su negocio.

Eliovina nos cuenta: Que esta muy agredecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, y el pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres le ha ayudado a conocer mejor sus derechos y juntas  hacer que estas sean respetadas.

loans.use: Comprará repuestos y lubricantes.

loans.name: Benita Ángela

texts.es:
La señora Benita Ángela M. de 58 años de edad trabaja en la compra venta de frutas y verduras. Ella compra las cosechas en la ciudad de Masaya y las lleva a Esteli. Aprovechando el viaje nos dice que siempre trae productos para vender, como papa, frijoles.

Inició su negocio a partir de la venta de una propiedad que poseía, y una amiga la motivo en invertir de esta forma. Lo hiso y no se arrepiente puesto que es un negocio muy bueno. Agradece los créditos que se le han dado puesto que le han permitido mantener su negocio en pié y tener la facilidad de adquirir accesorios para la comodidad en su hogar.

Su mayor anhelo es apoyar a su hija en poner un salón de belleza, ya que le gusta mucho esta profesión y se está especializando en ella.
texts.en:
Mrs. Benita is 58 years old. She works buying and selling fruits and vegetables. She buys the harvests in the city of Masaya and takes them to Esteli. She takes advantage of the trip to bring products to sell such as potatoes, beans, etc. She began her business after selling a property that she owned. Her girlfriend motivated her to invest in this business. She did this and she hasn’t regretted this, as it has been a good business. She is thankful to the banks that have allowed her to maintain her active business and have the means to acquire the extras needed for a comfortable home. Her main desire is to support her daughter in starting a beauty salon because she likes this profession and is specializing in this area.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in her business

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es:
El señor Sabino T. está solicitando un préstamo para colocar el vitropiso en toda la casa ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material ya que el se encargara de realizar la mejor en horario adicional a su empleo.
Don Sabino trabaja en una compañía de trasportes en el departamento de mensajería, entregando documentos en diferentes partes de la ciudad, este es el ingreso que obtiene y con el cual pagara el préstamo ya que su esposa la señora Laura Soto se encargara de los gastos familiares con el ingreso que obtiene de su empleo, limpiando casa en la vecina ciudad.
Cuando fuimos a tomar la foto al domicilio del señor Sabino el no se encontraba en su casa y quien nos atendió fue la señora Laura Soto quien es la persona que aparece en la foto.
texts.en:
Mr. Sabino T. is requesting a loan to place "vitropiso", tiles on all the floors of his house as he does not have the necessary money to buy the material at this moment. He himself will make the improvement after his regular work hours. Don Sabino works at a transportation company in the messenger department in charge of documents from different parts of town. This is his income source and he will use it to repay the loan as his wife, Mrs. Laura Soto is responsible for the family expenses with the income from her job cleaning houses in the neighboring town. When we visited his home to take the photo, Mr. Sabino was not present, his wife Laura Soto is the person in the photograph.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tiles for floors.

loans.name: Walther

texts.en:
Our client is Walther. He is part of a communal bank consisting of 19 members in Cruz Pata, a town 45 minutes from Cusco. The group is called Sacro. He is from Huancayo and lives in Cruz Pata. He is 48 years old and is married with 5 daughters.

He has a bakery where he makes baked good and sweet treats like cakes, apple pies, etc. He sells goods to stores and to tourists. He has many familiar customers who come continually to buy from him. He will use this loan to buy flour and other materials needed for his bakery.

Walther appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to make the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy flour and other raw materials needed for his bakery

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady D. est age de 21 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle fait du commerce de parfums et de tissus. Les revenus générés contribueront à améliorer les conditions de vie et de santé de sa famille.
texts.en:
Khady D. is 21 years old, married, and the mother of four. She has a business involving perfumes and fabrics. The revenues generated will help to improve her family’s healthcare and living situation.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To do commerce in cloth and perfumes

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 38-year-old widow with two children, ages 16 and 20. She has a boutique in Machakos, a busy market town near Nairobi. She sells a mix of mutumba (used clothing) and new materials. She's been in business for ten years. She describes herself as hardworking, innovative, and faithful.

She requested this loan for 50,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu to add more stock to her shop. Her hope is to expand her business in the future and become economically stable.

loans.use: Add clothing stock

loans.name: Donna

texts.es:
Donna es una socia trabajadora y activa, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 29 años, es madre de un hijo menor de edad y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es chofer de motocar.
Donna se dedica a la venta de comida criolla todos los dìas por las mañanas desde su casa y forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Rosas” desde hace un año y medio. 
El primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 300.00 nuevos soles los que utilizò en la compra de carbón, plátanos y frutas para luego venderlos a sus conocidos.
En la actualidad necesita un crédito de 1000.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà productos como aceite, fideos, arroz, azúcar, etc. para la preparación de sus comidas. 
La meta de Donna es tener un restaurante propio en su casa y aumentar sus clientes.
texts.en:
Donna is a very hard working and active member of her village bank. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the region of Ucayali. She is 29 years old, the mother of one young son, and her husband works as a chauffeur. Donna sells sells criolla food every morning from her home. She is a member of the village bank "Las Rosas" (The Roses") and has been for the past year and a half. The first loan she took out was for 300 nuevos soles and she used it to buy charcoal, plantains, and fruit to sells to her neighbors. Now she needs a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to buy products like oil, pasta, rice, and sugar to prepare her foods. Donna's goal is to own her own restaurant in her house and increase her clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying foodstuffs to perpare food to sell

loans.name: Furgencia Eulalia

texts.es: Doña Furgencia vive a un kilometro de la colonia los Laureles donde cada día se va aumentando la población, es madre soltera de dos niños menores de edad quienes estudian la primaria en la escuela divino redentor, a pesar que no tiene la ayuda del padre de sus hijos ella ha tratado que no les falte nada, trabaja para el MINED como docente desde hace 8 años,está solicitando su 6to credito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda terminando de construirla, es una  profesora humilde, responsable, honesta, trabajadora y muy querida por sus compañeros de trabajo y su comunidad, actualmente esta estudiando su primer año de licenciatura en educacion en la universidad URACCAN. su sueño es ir mejorando la vivienda para asi tener mejor comodidad y vivir en un ambiente agradable, seguir estudiando para llegar a ser un excelente profesional, estabilidad laboral y salud.
texts.en:
Furgencia lives one kilometer from the Los Laureles neighborhood, where everyday you can see the population increasing. She is the single mother of two minor children. They are in the primary grades at the Divino Redentor School. In spite of not having the help of the father of her children, she has tried to make sure they do not need anything. She has worked as an elementary school teacher for MINED (Ministry of Education) for eight years. She is asking for her sixth loan to improve her house and finish building it. She is an unassuming, responsible, honest, and hard-working teacher. She is much loved by her work colleagues and her community. She is currently in her first year of studying for her education license at the URACCAN University. That way she will improve her house little by little. Her dreams are to keep on improving her house to be more comfortable and to live in a pleasant atmosphere, to keep studying to become an excellent professional, and to have stable work and health.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish building her house

loans.name: Pedrita

texts.en:
Pedrita C. is from the village of Sagay, Camiguin province. She is 55 years old, is separated from her spouse and has four adult children. To make a living, Pedrita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling different varieties of bananas to the local community. Pedrita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Pedrita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan Pedrita has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mungu Tubaliki Group

texts.en:
Antonia K. is 52 years old, is widowed and has six children. Since 1986 she has been managing her own butcher shop from where she sells meat and chicken. Additionally she expanded the business to feed and grow her own chickens. Antonia works fifteen hours a day and currently earns 750,000 Tanzanian shillings a month (approx. 560 USD).

This will be Antonia’s tenth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans she grew her chicken business and she hopes to obtain this loan to open a small greengrocery. 

Antonia will share this loan with her loan group comprised of fourteen other men and women from her community. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

In the photo, Antonia is seated in the center of the first row and is wearing a white T-shirt and white pants.

loans.use: To start a greengrocery

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
El comité Virgen del Carmen, se encuentra ubicado en el Barrio  km 8 Monday de Ciudad del Este, fue conformado a través de la Sra. Mirian Avalos. Integran este comité 15 señoras activas y emprendedoras.
El crédito lo destinaron a la compra de  ropas,bebidas,embutidos,carne vacuna  y de cerdo, pollo, aceite, arroz, fideos, productos lácteos, cosméticos, bijouterias, joyas de plata, condimentos, frutas y verduras.
La señora Petrona F. quien tiene una despensa donde tiene una despensa con todos los productos de la canasta básica familiar, la despensa es atendida por toda la familia y ayuda bastante para los gastos de la casa. 
Este crédito solidario le posibilita a  cada una de las señoras tener  un ingreso diario y un trabajo independiente.
texts.en:
The Virgen del Carmen committee, in the Kilometer 8 Monday neighborhood of Ciudad del Este, was organized by Sra. Mirian Avalos. The committee has 15 members, all active, entrepeneurial women. The loan will be used to buy clothing, beverages, canned meats, beef and pork, chicken, cooking oil, rice, pasta, dairy products, cosmetics, costume jewelry, silver jewelry, condiments, fruits and vegetables, products that the women will resell. Sra. Petrona F. owns a small shop where she sells the products that are basic fare for local families. The entire family helps to run the shop and revenues from the business pay most of their everyday expenses. This loan improves the chances that each of these women will have a regular income and be able to work for themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni L. is currently in the business of selling local alcoholic beverages at the market and is requesting a loan to stock materials to use to make more alcohol to sell.  Poni is 20 years old and is married to a husband who is a businessman. She has 3 children and two of her children go to school. One is in baby class and another one is in primary one (1).  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a bar and restaurant.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock materials to use to make more alcohol to sell

loans.name: Ma. Selda

texts.en:
Along with her husband who is a fisherman and their daughter (19 years old), 44 year- old Ma. Selda S. lives near the seashore of Barangay (village) Tubog in the municipality of Hamtic, province of Antique.

A fishing business is Selda’s main source of income for the cash flow of her family especially for supporting the college education of their child. She hopes that this business will grow further to be able to support the growing financial needs of her child until she graduates.

Two of her children have their own families now and Selda is happy for that despite the fact that they were not able to graduate from college. She was financially incapacitated at that time to support their education; that’s why she can’t blame her children for their educational achievement. Nevertheless, they can manage their own lives now with their loving and supportive spouses.

Presently, Selda’s business is growing and she has been able to acquire more customers. However, she oftentimes encounters a problem in meeting their demands. With that, she and her husband agreed to request a much larger loan which they will use to purchase their own motor fishing boat.

The boat will be managed by her husband; therefore, aside from buying fish to sell from other fishermen in their village, she will have more fish to sell every time her husband goes fishing. They will also be in control of their business because her husband can go fishing as many time as he wants in a week.

loans.use: To purchase a motor fishing boat.

loans.name: Genie

texts.en: Genie B. is from Barangay Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 44 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Genie owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Genie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Genie is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her sixth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Making and selling cassava flour

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: In Andoung Samretth village in Takeo province, there is a person named Mrs. Mom K.. She was born in 1962. She is a farmer who owns a two-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Sophean K., owns a plow machine. Now her problem is that her husband’s wheel plow machine is broken. So to improve her husband’s business, Mrs. Mom K. is requesting a loan to buy a pair of wheel plow machines. With the rest of the loan, she wants to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticide. She is a mother of a child who is studying in the local public school. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy a pair of wheel plow machines

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo R., 23, is married and resides with her husband and young child in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for clay and ceramic products. She and her husband appear in the photograph at CREDIT's office.

R. and her husband sell ice for a gross income of about USD 23 per day. She is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase more ice to sell. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

In the future, R. would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy more ice to sell

loans.name: Lila

texts.es:
Lila es fiscal del Banco Comunal Las Brisas y lo que mas le gusta son los prestamos fáciles. Lila es soltera y tiene 1 hijo, Lila vende abarrotes, golosinas que reparte a diferentes tiendas al por mayor sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima, además Lila trabaja en un empresa como vendedora. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y volver a estudiar su carrera de psicología.

Lila necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles que será invertido en la compra de golosinas variadas.
texts.en:
Lila is the Procedures Officer of the Communal Bank of Las Brisas; her favorite part about group membership is how easy it is to take out a loan. Lila is unmarried and has one child, Lila sells groceries and candies that she delivers to different stores, mostly within Lima. Additionally, Lila works in a company as a sales woman. Her dream is to grow her business and go back to studying psychology. Lila needs a loan of 1000 soles which will be invested purchasing various candies.

Translated from Spanish by Halea Meese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of candies

loans.name: Byabasita Tukwatanise Group, Ibanda

texts.en:
In Byabasita, Ibanda, business can blossom if one summons up those two, always-neglected, business winning factors: planning and hard work. He has been a wise planner and as a result, 42-year-old N. Willy is basking in the glow of his ten-year-old commercial agriculture business.

Willy has been banking on this business to cater for all his family’s needs. That is a clear testimony that hard work pays. He also mentions good customer handling skills as a requisite factor that should not be glossed over if one is to fully succeed. This he says creates good rapport with his clients.

Willy has mostly been selling maize, beans, cassava and millet. His dream is to expand his business further with the acquisition of this loan. He also wants to see to it that all his children are all in good schools. With this loan, he wants to buy more crops like coffee that he will later resell, but he also wants to expand his trading activities beyond Ibanda town.

loans.use: To buy more lucrative crops to sell like coffee

loans.name: Roselida Akwero

texts.en: Roselida Akwero A. is 45 years old, married and a proud mother of seven children. She operates a hotel (restaurant) situated in Malanga where she lives. She normally buys commodities on a daily basis from Nambale. Previously, she practiced agriculture. Due to her quest to boost her standard of living, she started the hotel(restaurant) business to increase her income. Actually, she marveled at the returns from the business, but her aspiration to diversify the enterprise was cut short due to inadequate capital. For this reason, after having been given insights by members who had benefited from the initiative, she joined K-MET to get loan funding worth Ksh 10,000 to boost her business and enable her to achieve her life goal of a better standard of living.

loans.use: To boost business by increasing stock

loans.name: El Hadj

texts.fr: Né en 1974, Monsieur El Hadj S. est un maçon très connu dans la ville de Thiès. Il gagne beaucoup de marché de par ses connaissances et son travail jugé de sérieux par ses clients. Il souhaitait un prêt de 125 000 FCFA  pour acheter des planches de coffrage afin d'augmenter son stock insuffisant de planches. Enfin, Monsieur El Hadj S. est marié et compte sur son métier pour régler tous ses besoins et ceux de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1974, Mr. El Hadj S. is a very well-known mason in the town of Thiès. He wins many contracts because of his experience and the seriousness he displays in his work, according to customers. He is requesting a loan of 125,000 FCFA to buy formwork planking to increase his insufficient stock of planks. Finally, Mr. El Hadj S. is married and relies on his job to cover all of his needs and those of his family.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase construction materials

loans.name: Cherisa

texts.en: Cherisa M. is from the village of Calamagui, San Pablo. She is 42 years old. Cherisa is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Cherisa sells vegetables in the local community. Cherisa has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Cherisa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cherisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Cherisa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Cherisa from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Monsieur Ibrahima N. est âgé de 34 ans .Il est marié et habite a Dalifort. Il gère une  petite cantine de divers produits tels que cosmétiques, thé, sucre etc. C’est une activité qu’il a choisi par amour mais aussi par nécessité car il doit trouver les moyens de gagner sa vie. Il est membre de la caisse de Dalifort depuis 06 mois. Il sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour renforcer son stock de produits en vue de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. Ce financement lui permettra d’accroitre son fond de commerce et  de mieux  prendre en charge ses quelques besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Mr. Ibrahima N., 34, is married and lives in Dalifort. He runs a small store selling a variety of products such as cosmetics, tea, sugar, etc. He chose this line of business both out of love and out of necessity, since he has to find a way to earn a living. He has been a member of the Dalifort savings institution for 6 months. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to increase his stock so as to meet customer demand. The loan will allow him to increase his working capital and better meet his few personal needs.

Translated from French by Sarah Puchner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Cuong

texts.en:
Cuong T. N. is 47 years old with two children who are attending high school. She is a cook, serving lunch to pupils of Dong Anh High School.

Cuong has been a member of SEDA for four years and used her loans to pay school fees. Consequently, her children are obtaining a good education.

Currently, one of Cuong’s children is going to go to university and so she wants to obtain a loan of 7,194,000 VND to buy some necessary equipment for him.

loans.use: To buy some educational equipment for her son

loans.name: Josefa Herlinda

texts.es:
Josefa Herlinda C. T.
Josefa es de 50 años de edad, Soltera, es comerciante, actualmente se dedica a la confección, en dicha actividad tiene 9 años de experiencia, solicita su primer crédito para la compra de materia prima  de esa manera surtir sus productos lo cual es una inversión rentable y así mejorar sus ingresos económicos, según referencias la persona solicitante es responsable y trabajadora en el cual podrá realizar sus pagos correspondientes.
texts.en:
Josefa Herlinda C. T.
Josefa is 50 years old and single. She is a merchant. At present, she is a seamstress. She has been doing this activity for 9 years. She is asking for her first loan to purchase raw materials to diversify her products. This is a profitable investment and in this way she will improve her income. According to references, the applicant is a responsible and hardworking woman who will be able to make her payments.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy W. N. is forty one years old and married. Her husband is employed by The Kenya Power and Lighting Company. They have three children aged eighteen, fourteen and ten years old.

Her business is located at an open air market known as Gikomba in Nairobi. She has been selling materials to passersby and the local tailors who use the materials for making clothes. She has been in this business for the last five years now. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is fluctuating market prices hence selling her products at low prices. She also faces a lot of competition from the local people. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well.

She is using her loan of 50,000 KES to buy more materials to expand her business and meet the demand of her customers. She hopes to grow her business and be able to import materials for reselling. She also sees herself building rental houses in the future. She describes herself as a hardworking and happy lady.

loans.use: Materials

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 19-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She lives with her parents. This young woman works as an assistant in a doctor clinic. Her work is very important because with its income, she is able to satisfy her life needs and help her parents pay for her university fees. As with the majority of Lebanese students, her story illustrates the day-to-day challenges involved in working while at the same time pursuing an education. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay for her courses at the university. She is studying biochemistry and this is her first year. In the future, she is planning to start her career in a laboratory to gain experience and be able to help her parents with her income.

loans.use: to pay for her courses at the university

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a farmer from Nyamira town in Western Kenya where she has been practicing mixed farming for the last 5 years. Her farm produces milk, maize, beans and sorghum which she sells to the local market.  She also earns income from her shop which she operates in the same region. 

She is 33 years old and married with 3 school-aged children who all attend school.

She has requested this loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help pay school fees for her children. In the future, she would like to acquire at least 5 dairy cows to improve her milk production.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Jameela's Group

texts.en:
Jameela, age 38 (pictured holding the Asasah Passbook), engages in embroidery work in order to financially support her family. She is very skillful in her work and keeps abreast of the latest trends and fashions, which helps her to stay current with her clients' demands. She and her husband, M. J., have four sons, the elder three of whom are enrolled in school. The family lives in a two-room brick house in Kamoki, a small industrial city in Pakistan. 

Jameela's husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He provides transport services to his customers. He also provides pick-up and drop-off facilities to children attending different schools. 

Life is very difficult for the family as it takes a great effort from both Jameela and her husband to manage the household expenses. They work very hard to pay the children’s school fees. Jameela's greatest aspiration is to see them complete their education and become successful in life. 
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah on behalf of her husband, who wants to repair his rickshaw because its engine is creating problems and doesn’t allow him to work for the hours required to earn a good profit from the business. The fully repaired rickshaw will allow him to work for longer hours and gain more income. 

She is a new loan user of Asasah and is confident that it will be a profitable experience for her family.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw used for transportation services

loans.name: Justo German

texts.es: EL SEÑOR JUSTO DE  52 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES UN HOMBRE CASADO, SU ESPOSA SE DEDICA A SU HOGAR Y A CUIDAR A SUS HIJOS QUE ESTAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR, ELLOS TIENE 15, 14 Y 6 AÑOS DE EDAD. EL SEÑOR JUSTO SE INICIO TRABAJANDO EN UN FUNDO AGRICOLA EN DONDE ERA JORNALERO, EMPEZO SU NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE ABARROTES DE PRIMERA NECESIDAD CON UN PEQUEÑO CAPITAL PRODUCTO DE LOS AHORROS DE SU LABOR COMO JORNALERO, EN LA ACTUALIDAD EL SEÑOR JUSTO CUENTA CON UN LOCAL EN DONDE SIGUE DEDICANDOSE A LA VENTA DE ABARROTES, EL ATIENDE EL NEGOCIO DE MANERA ATENTA Y AMABLE A SUS CLIENTES. NECESITA EL PRESTAMO PARA CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y ADQUIRIR MERCADERIA PARA SU NEGOCIO
texts.en: Sr. Justo, who is 52 years old, is a married man whose wife dedicates herself to their home and to taking care of their children.  They have three school-aged children who are 15, 14 and 6 years old.  Sr. Justo began working in a plantation where he was a day laborer.  He started his business selling essential groceries with the small amount of capital he had from his day laborer savings.  Currently, Sr. Justo has a small store where he continues to make his living selling groceries.  He runs a courteous business and is friendly with his customers.  He needs the loan for working capital and to acquire merchandise for his store.

loans.use: He needs the loan for working capital and to acquire merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Diego Mauricio

texts.es:
Diego de 31 años, es un hombre trabajador que siempre le ha gustado con esfuerzo conseguir sus propios ingresos. El trabajaba como albañil pero con sus ahorros decidió comprar víveres para poder una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. 

Viviendo en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo ha comprado bebidas, granos, aceites entre otros estos tres años para vender a los clientes. Trabaja desde las 07h00am atendiendo a sus clientes hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. Trabaja con ayuda de su hermano vendiendo en la tienda arroz, enlatados, bebidas etc.    

Con el préstamo quiere comprar víveres para su tienda como arroz, azúcar, bebidas, enlatados. En el futuro quiere ampliar el negocio y así satisfacer las necesidades del cliente.
texts.en:
Diego, 31, is a hard working man who has always liked to earn his own income through his own efforts.  He used to work as a bricklayer but used his savings to buy groceries and set up a small grocery store in the front part of his house.

Living in an urban zone, called Guasmo, he has bought soft drinks, grains and cooking oils, among others, these past three years to sell to customers.  He works from 7am until 9pm every day.  His brother helps him to sell rice, canned goods, beverages, etc.

He wants to use the loan to buy foodstuffs for his store like: rice, sugar, beverages and canned goods.  In the future he’s like to expand the business thus meeting customer needs.

loans.use: For rice and sugar.

loans.name: Sergelenbaatar

texts.en:
Sergelenbaatar O. is 26 years old and lives with his parents and sibling in Hovd Province of Mongolia.  He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent.  All of his family members have their own businesses.  

Sergelenbaatar operates a car repair and service business out of his own work place.  He began his own business in 2009 by operating a car wash service.  During the short period of operation, he has enlarged his business and operates a car repair service and was able to build his own work place in 2010. 

For the near future, he plans to solve a building heat problem so that he can provide car repairing and washing services in all seasons.  He is requesting a 1,300,000 MNT loan in order to install heat and electricity in his working place.

loans.use: To install heat and electricity so that he can provide car repairing and washing services in all seasons.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “BANCO DEL DESARROLLO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carmen Rosa; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como recepcionista de un hotel, ella trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo la socia quiere ahorrar para que siga estudiando, la socia quiere mejorar en su centro de trabajo. La socia solicita el préstamo uso personal.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank “Banco del Desarrollo” (Bank of Development), which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She is 32 years old and single. Carmen Rosa divides her time between her daily activities and her job as a hotel receptionist. She works from 5am to 8pm and through her work she is able to save money so that she can continue studying. Carmen Rosa wants to improve in her line of work. She is requesting this loan for personal use.

Carmen Rosa is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: Personal use

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn A., from the village of San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur, is 46 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a business raising ducks for sale. Engaged in her business for over three years, she earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Evelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 6000 PHP from GDMPC that was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future, she is now requesting her third loan for 5000 PHP to purchase breeding livestock. Evelyn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Johana Isabel

texts.es:
Johanna casada,  tiene a su niña en la primaria, mujer emprendedora tiene su propio negocio en el cual vende cosméticos y variedades.  Como planes mejora su nivel de vida, inicio al ver que requería de una entrada de dinero extra y con fondos propios.
Agradece a la financiera por su apoyo ya que con el préstamo que solicitad será invertido en la compra de cremas, perfumes, pintura de labios, cejas, rostro entre otro productos. Aumentado sus inventarío y así sus ganancia.
texts.en:
Johanna is married and has a daughter in elementary school.  She’s an enterprising woman with her own cosmetics and notions business.  In order to improve her life she started with her own funds when she saw that she needed an extra source of income.

She is grateful to the financial institution for the support the loan she’s asking for will be.  It will be used to buy creams, perfumes, lipsticks, eyebrow pencils, rouge, among other products, to increase her inventory and thus her profits.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses has a poultry farm in Murang'a town in central Kenya. He has been in the farming business for 12 years now and employs one farmhand. He sells his eggs locally. He mainly depends on the income from his farm for the basic needs of his family.

Moses is 34 years old and married with four school-aged children who all attend school.

He has requested a loan of 70,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo for poultry farming. The extra income from the sale of eggs will help improve his family's livelihood. He says that the high cost of poultry feed and diseases have been his greatest challenges. He hopes to increase his egg production in the next five years.

loans.use: Poultry farming.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a 51 year-old married woman with 7 children. Her oldest child is 28 years old. Her husband is a farmer.

Elena is a farmer as well. She helps her husband till their land in Banga, South Cotabato. They grow rice and corn crops to sell to their community.

Elena requested a loan so she could purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs she needs for their farm. Elena works hard to build a stable business. She also wishes for her children to be successful in their fields.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Peterson

texts.en:
Peterson is 36 years old and married with two children, ages 10 and 16 who both attend school.  He has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years in his hometown in Nkubu in eastern Kenya.  He sells his milk and tea to a local dairy farm and tea factory respectively.  He also operates a salon and timber business.

He has made a loan request for 90,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to construct a storage facility for animal feeds and to also upgrade his zero grazing unit.  The extra income from this loan will enable him improve his family's livelihood and pay school fees for his children.  His biggest challenge has been the high cost of animal feeds and the fluctuating prices of milk.  He intends to acquire 6 pure bred dairy cows in the next five years that will improve his milk production.

He comments that Juhudi has made him realize his full potential in dairy farming.

loans.use: To construct a storage facility for animal feeds and upgrade his zero grazing unit.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia M. is from Sta. Rosa, Gamu, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 41 years old. Lucrecia is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Lucrecia owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Lucrecia has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Lucrecia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucrecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional groceries to sell. Lucrecia is requesting a new loan of 42000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional groceries to sell. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Lucrecia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Maria Soledad

texts.es:
María  tiene 19 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo.  Reside junto a su esposo en la ciudad Ferreñafe, zona  bastante comercial que pertenece al departamento de  Lambayeque, se encuentra situada un zona rural a de media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
Se dedica a trabajar vendiendo cosméticos por catálogo, ella vende estos productos entre sus vecinos y amistades, diariamente se esfuerza por captar más clientes ya que mientras más pedidos realice la empresa que le provee de productos le otorga mayores ingresos. El negocio le ayuda a solventar sus gastos personales y a apoyar a su  esposo  en el sostenimiento de la economía de su hogar.
Es su deseo  de María poder mejorar su casa, y ampliar su negocio para que pueda brindarle a su familia comodidad,  seguridad y una mejor calidad de vida.  Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
Maria es una madre bastante entregada a su familia y que siempre vela por su bienestar y desarrollo. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Maria is 19 years old, married and has one child. She lives with her husband in the city of Ferreñafe, a commercial zone that belongs to the Lambayeque Department, which is in a rural zone about a half hour away from Chiclayo City.
She sells cosmetics through a catalogue. She sells these prodeucts to her neighbors and friends. Each day she works to increase her client base as with more orders she makes more money. This business helps her with personal expenses and helps her husband with the economic maintenance of their house. 
Maria wishes to improve her house and grow her business so that her family will be comfortable, secure and have a better quality of life. With this in mind, she is requesting a loan of 1000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Maria is always concerned for the health and development of her family. The people that know her think of her with much esteem and affection.

loans.use: to improve her house and grow her business.

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es:
María de 47 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución). Esta casada y su conyugue es maestro albañil tienen hijos mayores de edad. Tiene un puesto de comida.

Comenzó su actividad hace un tiempo atrás abriendo en su casa vendiendo comida. Labora diariamente con ayuda de sus hijos . Le afecta en su negocio la delincuencia ya que por sus sector esta peligroso. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar sillas mesas varia mercadería para su negocio y así e incrementar su capital para poder terminar de construir su vivienda. Y tener una vida mas saludable con sus familia.
texts.en:
María, 47, lives in La Primavera de Duran (an outlying urban area that originally was irregular with several hills, streams and lagoons that still remain as evidence of ecology in erosion.)  She is married and her spouse is a Master Bricklayer.  They have adult children.  She has a food stand.
