She started her activity some time ago opening a food stand at home.  She works daily with help from her children.  Her business is affected by the delinquency because her neighborhood is dangerous.  

With help from the loan she wants to buy tables, chairs and various merchandise to increase her capital and be able to finish building her house and have a more healthful life with her family.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs and various merchandise.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: La Señora Lourdes es socia antigua de nuestra Institución y a demostrado ser puntual y responsable con sus créditos, ella es casada y tiene 3 hijas que se encuentran en edad escolar, dos de ellas se encuentran en la Universidad Estatal y el menor tiene 4 años y todos dependen de ella, sin embargo su esposo le ayuda con los gastos familiares y otros gastos  ya que el trabaja en la en la universidad en el sector de archivos, sin embargo ella tiene un almacén en su propio domicilio y es el único de su zona y solicitó el crédito para aumentar su capital y para la compra de más estantes para mostrar y guardar su mercaderia.
texts.en:
Lourdes has been a member of the organisation for a long while, and she has proven to be responsible and on time with her loans. She is married and has three daughters who are of school age. Two of them study at the State University and the youngest one is 4 years old. They all are dependant on her. However, her husband helps her with household expenses and other costs as he works in the archive department at the University. 

She owns a grocery store which is located in her home. She is requesting a loan to raise capital  and buy more shelves to display and store her goods.

loans.use: to raise capital  and buy more shelves to display and store her goods.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles, aged 39, is single and does a motorcycle transportation business. He has been doing this for two years and earns a monthly income of KES11,900.

This is his second loan term from KADET LTD. and has successfully managed to pay his previous loan. He will use the loan funds to service his motorcycle for efficiency. Charles intends to buy another motorbike and hopes to own a fleet of commercial vehicles in the future.

loans.use: to service the motorcycle.

loans.name: Dolores Del Socorro

texts.es: La Señora Dolores Del Socorro se dedica a la venta de ropa en sus 9 años, siempre ha sabido trabajar y mantenerse muy independiente, el negocio fue iniciativa propia ella con mucho empeño y sacrificio ha logrado salir adelante, pues su Madre le ha enseñado a ganarse la vida de la manera más humilde. La inversión del préstamo será para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes, y ropa interior.
texts.en: Señora Dolores Del Socorro has been selling clothes for 9 years, she has always known how to work and to to keep herself independent.  The business was her own initiative, and with much effort and sacrifice she has managed to get ahead, because her mother taught her to live her life in the most humble way. The investment of the loan will be for the purchase of pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, and underwear.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, and underwear.

loans.name: Rhory

texts.en:
Rhory is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with two children. 

Rhory has a shop that sells frozen foods like dressed chickens & hot dogs. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional stocks of frozen foods like dressed chickens.

Rhory is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Rhory hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy additional frozen foods like dressed chickens

loans.name: Odonchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Odonchimeg, 35, is a hard-working mother who is trying to educate her children. She lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia with her husband, 39, and two children who are 18 and 16 years old. She has been running a business selling building materials in the market. 

Her daughter Ankhzul graduated secondary school last year and she will become a student at the university as soon. But there is a problem with her daughter’s school payment. Therefore, Odonchimeg is taking a loan to pay her daughter's university costs.  “Most important thing is the education of my kids,” she said.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's university

loans.name: Benkadi Minanan 2 Group

texts.fr:
Le  groupe BENKADI MINANAN 2 est constitué de six femmes mariées ayant en  moyenne 53 ans, 6 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles élargies  à Kafla, un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative  de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes du groupe collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
SARAN, la deuxième personne assise à droite, espère acheter avec son prêt les intrants, les petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,75 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues sur place au marché du village, au niveau du marché de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée de consommateurs et de revendeurs. SARAN envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 85 000F CFA en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
Group Benkadi Minanan 2 is composed of six married women who are on average 53 years old with six children. Most of them live in traditional extended families in Kafla, one of the villages of the rural township of Banco in Dioila prefecture, Koulikoro region (Mali's second administrative region).
The women of this group are collaborating with micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The species they cultivate include rice and groundnuts. They are on their first collaboration with the organization.
Saran, the second person sitting from the right, is hoping to buy agricultural intrants and light agricultural equipment with her loan, as well as pay for plowing and weeding expenses to maintain about 2 acres of rice and groundnuts.
After the harvest, productions are sold locally at the village market as well as in markets in Banco and N’Golobougou, to a clientele composed of consumers and retailers. Saran is planning on an average profit of about 85,000 FCFA at the end of the cycle.

loans.use: to play for plowing, agricultural intrants, weeding and light agricultural equipment.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is 35 years old married with 7 children aged between two and 14 who lives in his own house in Hoima, Uganda. He has been in the produce business for five years, starting with capital of 600,000 and now has 2,000,000 UGX as his working capital. His hardship is price flactuation and his dream is owning a big food store. Francis needs the loan to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.use: To buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Gulputa

texts.en:
Gulputa a 51-year-old woman who lives with her children in Agsu. She established her business selling provisions such as eggs, soap, shampoo, and candy.

Gulputa began her business because she needed a reliable source of income to support her family. Her eldest son greatly helps her. She would like to take out this loan in amount of 1000 Azerbaijan new manat (AZN) to purchase more inventory to increase her income. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married with three school-age children. She is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. Josephine is a farmer and specializes in corn production to earn a living. Josephine has been in this business for three years. Josephine has requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos to purchase fertilizer. 

Josephine has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the near future, she hopes to make her business successful.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Arnord

texts.en:
Arnold is 33 years old, married, and blessed with four school-aged children.  

He has been raising hogs for three years. He earns about PHP 6,000 for each pig he is able to sell. He is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed, vitamins and medicines for his hogs to ensure good nutrition. A hog that has had good nutrition can be offered at a higher price when it's ready for sale. 

With the help of this loan, he would like to strengthen his pig selling business and earn enough money to secure his family's future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and medicines for his hogs.

loans.name: Gulzamon

texts.ru: Гулзамон жительница района Кубодиен. Она замужем. Ей 51 год. У нее шестеро детей.  Ее сын находится в Российской Федерации на заработках. Сама она уже пять лет как занимается торговлей. На сегодняшний день она арендует помещение, где открыла продуктовый магазин. Она берет кредит для увеличения ассортимента товара. Она хочет купить продукты питания и приобрести мужскую и детскую одежду для торговли.
texts.en: Gulzamon lives in the Qubodiyon district.  She is 51 years old, married and has six children.  Her son is working in the Russian Federation.  Gulzamon has been involved in sales for five years.  Today, she leases a space, where she opened a food store.  She is requesting this loan to expand the assortment of products.  Gulzamon wants to buy food products and buy men's and children's clothing to sell.

loans.use: to buy food products and men's and children's clothing

loans.name: Bertha Marisol

texts.es: En Quezalguaque municipio de León, donde la actividad agrícola es parte de la actividad diaria de los habitantes de este sector, vive Bertha, de 37 años, la encontramos acomodando  a los cerdos de su finca, que son parte de las tareas propias de la mujer agrícola de esa zona, ella es madre de 2 adolecentes de 12 y 14 años de edad, ambos están en la secundaria. Ella inicio con capital propio, comprando cerdos para criarlos y venderlos, al mismo tiempo trabajando en una tortillería, poco a poco fue especializándose en lo que es crianza y venta de cerdos, es por medio de esta actividad que mantiene a su hogar ya que ella es madre y padre para sus hijos. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar cerdos de crianza, para vender, ella desea convertirse una distribuidora  de cerdos mayoristas conocida en su comunidad, darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Bertha, age 37, lives in Quezalguaque, in the municipality of León, where agricultural activity is a daily part of life for residents. She can be found tending after the pigs on her farm, which is all part of a day's work for women farmers in this area. She is the mother of two teenagers, ages 12 and 14, both of whom are in school. 

She began with her own startup funds, buying pigs to raise and sell, while at the same time working in a tortilla shop. Little by little, she has become an expert at raising and selling pigs, which is how she sustains her home, as she serves in the role of both mother and father for her children. 

She needs this loan to buy young pigs to sell and aims to build herself into a well-known purveyor of mature pigs in her community. In this way, she hopes to provide a better quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Tashinga Group

texts.en:
Netsai is a 50-year-old married woman with four children. Two of her children are in school. She also looks after her grandchild, who is 12 years old and still in school.

She is in the business of tailoring and also chicken rearing in the Mkoba suburb in Gweru. Netsai is also a cross-border trader who goes to Namibia twice a month to sell products like seat covers, chair-backs, bedspreads, and toilet seats, which she manufactures herself. She also receives other income from her spouse's salary.

The challenges that she faces in chicken rearing are theft and the high mortality rate of chicks. As a cross-border trader, she is also affected by high import duty and transport costs to and from Namibia. If her business is well funded, she would like to expand her business by opening a shop where she would manufacture her products.

loans.use: to buy materials to manufacture seat covers, ladies skirts, toilet seats, and bedspreads for sale.

loans.name: Fanusa

texts.en:
Fanusa is a 52-year-old woman who sells different food products and has 6 years of experience in this field. Fanusa sells food products such as tea, beverages, sausages, cookies, etc. 

Her monthly income is 230 AZN. Her business is successful because she is very friendly and polite. The demand in the products she sells is very high and she would like to purchase more items to increase her sales. She applied for a 1800 AZN loan to purchase more merchandise. This will be her 4th loan and she has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise.

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.es: Enriqueta, de 32 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Raúl, su esposo desde hace 17 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos todos ellos menores de edad a los que cuidan en una casa alquilada en la ciudad de Chilca. Gracias a su habilidad, puede salir adelante. Su principal oficio es la venta de comida china en una pequeña carpa que instaló en el mercado de la ciudad. Ahí obtiene buenas ganancias, pues en las mañanas aprovecha en vender queso, asimismo en temporadas de festividad se las ingenia para vender accesorios de ocasión “trabajo en todo”, afirma. Además su esposo e hijo mayor, son taxistas, con ello lleva un dinero extra al hogar. Ahora desea aprovechar la campaña navideña para obtener mayores ingresos y así juntar dinero para comprar su casa propia. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “el vencedor” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo que recibe; pues le permite progresar en su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues su asociación lo conforman personas responsables y solidarias. Enriqueta de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de luces, inciensos, flores aromáticas para vender en navidad.
texts.en: Enriqueta, age 32, is a hard-working woman. She lives with Raul, her husband of 17 years. Together they have four young children and live in a rented home in Chilca. Thanks to her skill, she has been able to get ahead. Her main job is selling Chinese food in a small stall which she established in a market in the city. She makes a good income, and in the mornings she sells cheese. During the holiday season, she works creatively to sell seasonal items. "I take every opportunity to work", she confirms. Her husband and oldest son work as taxi drivers, and bring in extra money for the household. Now, she wants to take advantage of the Christmas season to make more money in order to build their own home. She belongs to the "El Vencedor" ["The Victor"] communal bank, and this is her first loan with MFP. She is grateful for the support that she will receive; this will allow her to move forward with her business. She promises to be punctual in paying her quotas. Her communal bank is made up of responsible and united people. Upon receiving your support, Enriqueta will invest in the purchase of lights, incense, and scented flowers to sell this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy incense, scented flowers and Christmas lights.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Thoeurn

texts.en: Thoeurn, 32, is married and resides with her husband and a child in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She is a housewife. Her husband, Heng, is a construction worker. Due to the difficulty in traveling to work, Thoeurn is requesting a loan of $1000 U.S. dollars (USD) to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. In the future, she would like to renew her house and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras De Tahuantinsuyo Group

texts.es:
El Sr. Marcos Antonio tiene 47 años, es casado y tiene dos hijos, él pertenece al grupo "Las Emjprendedoras de Tahuantinsuyo" formado por 8 integrantes quienes lo eligieron como presidente del grupo.
El Sr. marcos Antonio se dedica a la administración de una cabina de internet de su propiedad y por las noches a su negocio de venta de broasters, inició su negocio con ahorros que juntó de su trabajo realizado en Japon.
El prestamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de insumos como papa, pollo, cremas, descartables destinado a la venta de salchipapas, broaster y sanguches.
texts.en:
Marcos Antonio is 47 years old, married, and has two children.  He belongs to the communal bank "Las Emprendedoras de Tahuantinsuyo."  This group has 8 members, and they chose him to be president of the group.

Marcos Antonio works in his own internet cafe business, and at night he has a business selling roasted chicken.  He started his business with money that he saved up from work that he did in Japan.

He will invest this loan in the purchase of supplies such as potatoes, chicken, cream, and disposable containers that he will use in his business selling salchipapas (fried chicken and potatoes), roasted chicken and sandwiches.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for his roasted chicken business

loans.name: Serah

texts.en: Serah is 38 years old and married with three children. She sells used clothes to earn a living and has been in the business for five years. She describes her business environment as favorable and her customers as available. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to educate her children and develop her business. She hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Ninguma

texts.en:
Ninguma is a married woman with one child who is enrolled in school. Her husband is a farmer who contributes to the provisions of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.
 
Ninguma has operated a clothes selling business for the past six years. Her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of lack of enough capital to expand her business. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the KSHS 40,000, she wants to purchase more stock of clothes and a sewing machine for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loan facilities to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and a sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Ascencion

texts.es: El señor Ascencion, es una persona de 47 años de edad de estado civil casado, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, vive en su casa propia, cuenta con cuatro dependientes económicos a cargo los cuales son sus hijos; la actividad económica a la que se dedica es la producción agrícola; produce papa, haba, arveja y quinua en sus propios terrenos que cuentan con riego, las cuales se hallan situadas en la comunidad de Kañacota del municipio de Tíraque distante aproximadamente a unos 77 Km. desde la ciudad de Cochabamba. Y finalmente el cliente y su esposa manifiestan tener ganas de seguir incrementando su producción agrícola y para tal efecto se ven en la necesidad de solicitar capital de inversión para la compra de abono de gallinaza y semilla de papa certificada que son  insumos elementales para obtener un mejor rendimiento de este cultivo y del forma obtener mayores ingresos económicos que vayan a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y en un tiempo corto de los nietos que vayan a tener.
texts.en:
Asencion is a 47 year old man. He is married and only reached up to primary school. He lives in his own house and has four children who are economically dependent on him. He makes a living in agriculture; he produces potatoes, fava beans, peas and quinoa on his own land. His land is irrigated by flood water which are found in the Kanacota community of the Tiraque municipality, which is about 77 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba. 

The client and his wife say that they would like to continue increasing their agricultural production and see the need to request investment capital to buy hen fertilizer and potato seeds. These are supplies that are needed to obtain a better harvest for his crops and in this way obtain greater earnings which will go toward improving his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer (hen droppings) and potato seeds.

loans.name: Sotera Yamileth

texts.en:
My name is Yamileth, I live in the city of Danli and I sell craftworks and cosmetics as a street merchant, working on commission. The earnings I make from my sales help me with family expenses and with the studies of my three brothers, since our mother passed away some years ago, leaving me to care for them. My brothers help me sell my items as it is our only form of income for now.

Loan Use: Purchase of handicrafts and cosmetics

Me llamo Yamileth, vivo en la ciudad de Danli y me dedico a la venta de artesanias y cosmeticos de manera ambulante y por encargo, los ingresos que percibo de mis ventas me ayudan con el gasto familiar y con los estudios de mis 3 hermanos ya que hace algunos años nuestra madre murio y yo me hice cargo de ellos. Mis hermanos me ayudan a vender ya que es nuestro unico ingreso en este momento.

loans.use: Compra de Artesanias, cosmeticos

loans.name: Eyvaz

texts.en: Eyvaz H. owns an upholstery shop in the town of Khachmaz located in the Northeastern part of Azerbaijan. Eyvaz wants to invest in new hardware that will enable him to perform complex work more efficiently.

loans.use: To purchase new upholstery hardware

loans.name: Imoa

texts.en: 62-year old Imao relies on the profits from her small shop to support her family of ten.  Imao’s children and grandchildren live with her. All profits from the store are either reinvested in the store or pay for the family’s expenses.  Acting as breadwinner for this large family, she is unable to save for her own future.  Imoa is trying to find a cheaper means of buying her inventory, thereby improving her profit margin.  She will use a loan to buy supplies in bulk from a wholesaler in the capital.  This small growth in the profit margin will benefit Imoa, her children and her grandchildren.

loans.use: to re-stock her shop

loans.name: Ziver

texts.en: Ziver A. lives in Beylagan, Azerbaijan. She sells women clothinig in the Beylagan city bazaar. She has rented a small booth there. Ziver is married and she has three children. Her husband helps her in her business. Ziver has been a client of Normicro Beylagan Branch since 2005. She has borrowed two loans, which total $1,000, from 2005-2006. She used these loans to buy more kinds of goods. Now she needs $1,000 to buy more products to sell.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her clothing stand.

loans.name: Rumilda

texts.es:
Rumilda Colman de Gamarra is 46 years old. She is married to Pantaleón Gamarra, who works in horticulture, and they have 6 children.

Rumilda came from a very poor family and had to work from the time she was very young. She helped her parents with her income.

Rumilda currently sells merchandise such as nylon stockings, cosmetics, cleaning supplies, etc. On the weekends she helps her husband with his horticulture (he raises vegetables). She says that she dreams of opening a small store in her home and a small plant nursery. This way she could spend more time at home and wouldn’t have to sell in the street. She could spend more time with her children and better supervise their education.

She is requesting the loan to be able to increase her stock of merchandise and thereby increase her income. Demand has increased lately and she needs a greater variety of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rumilda Colman de Gamarra tiene 46 años, esta casado con Pantaleón Gamarra que se dedica a la horticultura y tienen 6 hijos. Rumilda desde muy joven tuvo la necesidad de salir a la calle a trabajar, ya que provenia de una familia muy humilde con dichos ingresos ayudaba a sus padres Doña Rumilda actualmente se dedica a la venta de mercerías tales como medias, cosmeticos, articulo de limpieza etc. Los fin de semana ella ayuda a su espoco con su trabajo de horticultura (cultivo de hortalizas), ella nos cuenta que en el futuro sueña con poner en su casa un pequeño negocio de ventas de mercerias y un pequeño vivero para de esta forma poder quedar mas en su casa y ya no tener que salir a la calle, asi ella podrá compartir mas tiempo con sus hijos siguiendo de mas de cerca la educacion de los mismos. Solicita el crédito para aumentar su stock de mercaderías y asi poder aumentar sus ingresos, ya que en estos tiempos la demanda ha aumentado y necesita mas variedad de mercaderias.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as shoes, children's clothing, face creams, etc.

loans.name: Ascencio

texts.es:
Ascencio lives in his own home with his wife and two children in the Las Lomas section of La Paz. He is employed as a carpenter, but he builds furniture from his home (for the kitchen, office, etc.) in his spare time to supplement his income. He has fulfilled his previous loan commitment, and looks for additional funds for the purchase of raw materials. With his previous loan, he was able to buy some tools and his goal is to establish his own workshop in the future.

His work and credit history make him an excellent loan candidate.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Ascencio vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos en la calle mantilla de la zona de las Lomas de la ciudad de La Paz y trabaja como empleado de carpintería pero a su vez en su casa elabora muebles de cocina, barnizado de escritorios y otros para mejorar sus ingresos, El señor ya es cliente de Kiva, terminó de cancelar el crédito, y ahora vuelve a solicitar para compra de materia prima. Con el crédito anterior pudo comprar herramientas y su objetivo es poner un taller en un futuro no muy lejano El antecedente histórico con Impro lo califica como muy buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to build furniture.

loans.name: Kanlé

texts.fr:
Born August 14, 1936, Ms. Kanlé K. lives in Djidjolé, where she has founded a school. She is married to a retired journalist and takes care of one child. This year the number of students in her school increased, but there are not enough classrooms for all of them. She is requesting a loan of $1000 to build classrooms in order to provide her students with a good learning environment.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 14 août 1936 Madame Kanlé K. est fondatrice d’école et réside à Djidjolé. Elle est mariée à un journaliste en retraite et a à sa charge un enfant. Cette année son effectif a augmenté et les salles de classe sont insuffisantes. Elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour la construction des salles de classes afin d’offrir une bonne condition d’étude à ses élèves.

loans.use: Building classrooms

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
Mr. Teófilo is 36 years old and married to Mrs. Yeda Agüero. He has a five year-old daughter and lives in a neighborhood close to the city center. He dedicates himself to the purchase and sales of general electronics and domestic electronic items like televisions, freezers, boom boxes, blenders, sandwich makers, etc.

He sells his items for cash or on credit. The business is located in the Luque market, where he has many customers. With the loan that he is requesting he would like to increase his inventory by acquiring radios, clocks, calculators, televisions and other things.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

El señor Teófilo tiene 36 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Yeda Agüero, tiene una hija de 5 años de edad, vive en un barrio cercano al centro de la ciudad, se dedica a la compra-venta de artículos electrónicos en general, y electrodomésticos como televisores, congeladores, minicomponentes, licuadoras, sandwicheras, etc.

Sus ventas la realiza ya sea al contado o a crédito, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado de Luque, y nos cuenta que tiene bastante clientela. Con préstamo que solicita desea aumentar su inventario, adquiriendo radios, relojes, calculadoras, televisores y otros.

loans.use: Purchase of radios, clocks, calculators, televisions and other things

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: N. Kong married in 1982 and has three sons and two daughters. She started selling vegetables in 2000. Her husband is a construction worker, while their oldest son is a garment worker and the others are studying in the local school. She and her husband were not able to finish primary school because of the war. However, they are very kind, friendly and honest. The family lives in Koh Oknhathei by the Mekong River. Kong is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the fifth time, this time in the amount of $800, to buy more vegetables such as onions, cauliflower, bitter gourds, and beans. She also plans to add some meat and fish to sell.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables

loans.name: Jimiama

texts.en: Jimiama B. is married and has 2 children.  She sells food, vegetables and other commodities at the Cape Coast University science market.  She is requesting $525 to buy food items and vegetables.  Jimiama is also a member of a lending group called “Anointing Group”, which consists of 10 members in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy food items and vegetables.

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
Rosa belongs to the Juan Zaplana Belliza Communal Bank, located at Jr Copaiba Mz A Lt 3 in Callería, a town in the Ucayali province of Peru. She is 49 years old, has six children and is married to a salesman.

With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos, Rosa invested in a business and now has her own general store. She gets up at 6:00 a.m. to prepare breakfast for her husband and children and then works in the store until 9:00 p.m.

With this loan of $900, which she plans to repay within six months, she will buy items to sell including rice, eggs, milk, cooking oil and sugar.

Rosa is very happy because with a lot of effort and hard work she has helped her family overcome the challenges they faced.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal Juan Zaplana Belliza, ubicado en el Jr Copaiba Mz A Lt 3 del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 49 años y es madre D. 6 hijos, su esposo es comerciante. Rosa con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300.00 deciD. invertirlo en una bodega. En la actualidad ella cuenta con una bodega, se levanta a las 6am, para preparar el desayuno D. sus hijos y D. su esposo, luego se dedica a la atención D. su bodega hasta las 9pm. Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,500 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará: arroz, huevo, leche, aceite, azúcar, etc. Rosa esta muy satisfecha, porque con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado salir adelante con su familia y ha superado los problemas que se le presentaban.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell in general store

loans.name: Yenis

texts.es:
Yenis is divorced and has two children: a 4-year-old daughter and a 4-month-old baby. Since her work wasn't enough to cover her children's needs, she search for another way to earn additional income. 4 years ago when she became unemployed she started to sell footwear and little by little developed a good clientèle and earned more income.

She is requesting a loan of $575, which she will repay in 6 months, to buy display cases for her merchandise. With your help Yenis will be able to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Yenis actualmente esta divorciada y tiene dos hijos una niña de 4 años y un bebe de 4 meses, como con su trabajo no completaba para los gastos de sus pequeñas buscaba la posibilidad de generar otros ingresos. hace 4 años al quedarse desempleada empezó a vender calzado y poco a poco ha hecho una buena cartera de clientes y ha logrado mejor sus ingresos.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar exhibidores para la mercancía que tiene. Con tu ayuda Yenis saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase display cases

loans.name: Koffi Sénam

texts.fr:
Mr. Koffi Sénam A. was born June 25, 1976 in Mission Tové in the department of Zio. He is married and the father of one child. His main activity is the sale of cleaning products in the neighborhood of Agoè. He is a traveling salesman; he walks from house to house and from neighborhood to neighborhood. His cleaning products are among others: soaps, bleach, detergents etc… He fully repaid his first loan, and he is requesting a second loan to buy 10 boxes of soap, 10 boxes of bleach and 10 boxes of detergent.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur A. Koffi Sénam est né le 25 juin 1976 à Mission Tové dans la préfecture de Zio. Il est marié et père d’un enfant. Il a pour activité principale la vente des produits d’entretien dans le quartier d’Agoè. Il est un revendeur ambulant et se promène de maison à maison et de quartier en quartier. Dans ses produits d’entretien, on peut citer les savons, l’eau de javel, les détergents, etc. Le second crédit qu’il sollicite après remboursement total du premier lui permettra d’acheter 10 cartons de savon, 10 cartons de Javel et 10 cartons de détergent.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of cleaning products

loans.name: Rap

texts.en:
Mrs. Rap L., 42, grows crops from her home to sell, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband, Chea Choun, 35, is a motorcycle taxi driver. He earns approximately $3 per day. They live with their three children in Sophy Village, Siem Reap Province. All of their children are young and attend primary school. 

Mrs. Rap L. is requesting a loan of $250 to help purchase a new motorcycle for her husband’s motorcycle taxi business. The new motorcycle will help to expand the business and increase income by attracting more patrons.

loans.use: To help purchase a new motorcycle for her husband’s motorcycle taxi business

loans.name: Macedonia

texts.en:
Macedonia is a divorced, 51-year-old mother of six children. Macedonia works with a public institution that plants a variety of trees. In the next few months she will retire and hopes to work in other businesses. Macedonia sells firewood in her house with the help of her younger daughter. She gets her firewood from producers and delivers it to order for different households.

Macedonia needs a loan of 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (US$ 375) to invest in more firewood. Macedonia is a member of Las Entusiastas Village Bank.

Macedonia’s dream is to buy a car to transport her firewood from producers, to have other businesses, and that her children have an established occupation.

loans.use: to invest in more firewood for re-sale

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique M. S. is in the process of applying for home improvement assistance through a Mexican government program called Conavi. Conavi assists very low-income families by providing a small housing improvement subsidy that supplements a housing loan.

This Kiva loan can thus have a big impact, since it is supplemented by additional funds that this low-income family will use to improve their housing circumstances.

"My name is Enrique M. S.. I am married and I have a daughter. I am dedicated to carpentry and I already have some clients. The work that I do for them is done here in my home, and although the space is very small, my family and I have tried to make ourselves comfortable. But now I feel that indeed I need to make an effort to add a little more space to my home since my daughter is growing."

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

“Mi nombre es ENRIQUE M. S. soy casado y tengo una hija, me dedico a la carpintería tengo ya algunos clientes y los trabajo los hago ahí en mi casa, aunque el espacio es muy pequeño hemos tratado de acomodarnos, pero ahora siento que si necesito hacer un esfuerzo por ampliar un poco mas ya que también mi hija esta creciendo”.

loans.use: Add a room.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: El señor Luis Alberto vive en domicilio propio, que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Villa Copacabana que es una zona de las más tradicionales de la ciudad de La Paz, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos de sanidad. El señor Luis Alberto, se dedica al rubro del transporte publico, tiene un humilde taxi que le proporciona el sustento diario. Esta actividad la realiza en toda la ciudad de La Paz desde hace 15 años. El crédito será destinado para el  mantenimiento de su vehiculo, el cual no lo hacía hace ya varios años, es así que comprará amortiguadores, llantas, hará un cambio de anillas, etc.; trabaja con Emprender desde hace 5 años.
texts.en:
Luis Ablerto lives in his own home and it is located in the Villa Copacabana region, one of the most traditional regions of the city of La Paz. This region is equipped with the basic sanitary necessities. Luis Alberto works in public transport, running a small taxi bac that provides him with a daily income. He has been driving his taxi in the city of La Paz for 15 years. The funds from this loan will be destined to the maintenance and upkeep of his car, which has not been serviced for many years. He needs to replace the shocks, tires, and engine work etc. He has been a member of Emprender for 5 years.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of his vehicle

loans.name: Soy

texts.en:
Mrs. Soy N. was born in 1957 and lives in San Daek Village in the Kampong Cham Province. She has two hectares to cultivate rice to earn a living for her family. Her husband, Mr. Uy Nim, is a duck breeder. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it so his wife decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks and food to feed them.

The couple has five children, four of whom are employed in a garment factory and one who is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy more ducks and food for them.

loans.name: Bose

texts.en: Bose O. is 35 years old and she is a widow with 4 children. She is a registered nurse and she has a clinic attached to her house. She has created a small hall that contains three sick beds where she admits sick patients and another part is a labour room. At the back of her house she built a small poultry farm of about 90 birds. She is requesting  the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more medicine to sell and also to purchase more birds for her poultry business. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support and LAPO Microfinance for their business training.

loans.use: To purchase medicine and add poultry

loans.name: Intizar

texts.en: Intizar Q. is 40 years old, married, and has two children whom she supports by selling textiles for curtains and sewing them for orders. Having worked in this business for almost two years, Intizar has good taste and is trusted by her clients to choose various textiles for many different kinds of occasions. Most of her clientele are young ladies preparing for marriage who purchase curtains for dowry. Intizar's commercial success recently allowed her to enlarge her current place of work, and her overall income is now enough to send her son to university. In order to further develop her business, Intizar is requesting a loan of 1200 USD, which she will use to purchase an even wider array of curtains for resale.

loans.use: Enlarge place of work via purchase of more curtain textiles

loans.name: Vil

texts.en: Mrs. Vil L. is a villager in Tram Roneap village in Kampong Speu province. She is a farmer who cultivates rice on a plot of land to earn a living. She is a 57-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is a construction worker while the other is employed in a garment factory. Although they try to work hard, they still earn little income to support the family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Vil L. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business. She hopes to increase her income by selling the cow later.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a breeding business.

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.en:
Ceferina R., 60 years old, is married to Rogelio R., a farmer. The couple resides in a small flood-prone village of Yeban Sur.  They have five children Jovelyn – 37, a teacher; Nestor, 36, a soldier; Janette, 33, a teacher, Gregorio, 29, an agriculture graduate and Mark Gil, 19, who is currently third year College. She is happy seeing all her children achieving a better future through better education. However, Ceferina is concerned of her husband, who is currently sick, and she needs to have extra income for his medications.
 
Ceferina is requesting a loan amounting to PHP5,000 which she will use to re-open her village store business. Their current source of income is their passenger tricycle which earns for them an average monthly income of PHP3,000. The loan that she will avail will be used to buy goods for sale -- such as bottled and canned goods, detergent soaps, coffee, sugar, milk -- to open her village store.

loans.use: to be used in re-opening her village store

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
la Sra, Maura L. tiene 47 años de edad y vive en la comunidad de Laure abajo del municipio de San Lorenzo desde hace 46 años y se encuentra en union libre.
actualmente tiene dos hijos a su cargo de los cuales una de ellas estudia en la escuales de la aldea de donde ellos residen.
La Sra, L. se dedica a la venta de golosinas como ser tacos, enchiladas, tortillas con quesillo en las mañanas y luego en las tardes tiene su chiclera en la cual vende varios productos como ser galletas, refrescos, chicles, confites, gelatinas etc. con esta actividad ella ha logrado sostener a su familia y por ende mejorar un poco sus condiciones de vida, pero ahora ha decidido ampliar su negocio a traves de ropa usada, por tal razon ella necesita el credito para poder comprar fardos de ropa usada traida de Estados Unidos, ella ha realizado un estudio de que esta ropa se vende muy bien y ve factible poner un negocio de este tipo en su comunidad. para ella vender sus golosinas tiene que ir a varios lugares como ser campos de futbol, casas de la comunidad, mientras que con la venta de ropa lo haria en su casa de habitacion y asi podria atender la chiclera y tambien cuidar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maura L. is 47 years old and has lived in the Laure community, below the San Lorenzo municipality, for the past 46 years. Currently, she has two children in her care, one attending the schools of the town where they live. Mrs. L. dedicates herself to the sale of snacks such as tacos, enchiladas, and tortillas with cheese in the mornings. In the afternoons, she sells various products such as cookies, soft drinks, gum, candies, etc. With these activities she has managed to support her family, and improve their standard of living little by little. However, she has now decided to expand her business through used clothing. This is the reason she needs the loan, so she can buy used clothing brought from the United States. She has realized a study that this clothing will sell very well, and she sees the possibility in opening this type of business in her community. To sell her snacks, she has to travel to soccer fields and individual homes, whereas she could run the clothing business out of her home and that way tend to her snack shop and care for her children simultaneously.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase goods such as beverages, corn, cabbage, tomatoes, pastas, meats, wood, tortillas, salt,  churros, cookies.

loans.name: Cenelia Maria

texts.es: Cenelia  es una joven madre que  tiene una bebita de 3 años, está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 4rto crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda como es construccion de la cocina ya que no tiene, trabaja como docente del Nerpe Rafaela Herrera desde hace 6 años con dos plazas,  Cenelia actualmente esta cursando su 3 er  año en la universidad URACCAN, a pesar que es madre soltera ayuda a sus padres con los gastos familiares, es una joven con alto espititud de superacion profesional, responsable, honesta, trabajadora, vive en colonia la Fonseca a 30 km  de Nueva Guinea, su sueño es  construir su cocina para mejor comodidad para su familia, seguir  estudiando y tener estabilidad laboral, ya que son familias muy humildes de escasos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Cenelia is a young mother who has a small baby aged three, she is asking for financing from her fourth loan in order to invest the money in improving her home, by constructing a kitchen (she doesn't currently have one). She has worked for the last six years as a teacher in Nerpe Rafaela Herrera, but with two jobs Cenelia is also currently studying in the third year of University at URACCAN. Despite being a single mother she helps her parents with the family expenses. She is a young woman with a high sense of professionalism, responsible, honest and hard-working. She lives in the suburb la Fonseca, 30 km from New Guinea. Her dream is to construct a kitchen to make her family more comfortable, to continue studying and to have secure employment, as her family are very humble and have few economic resources.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Kitchen construction

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is married to Macario R.. He works as a rice and corn classifier for a buyer. She is forty-two years old and engaged in the hog-raising business. She wants to take out a loan of $125 to maintain her business. She will utilize the loan to buy a bag of feed for her hogs. She hopes that somehow she will able to expand into other businesses such as vending in order to generate more income to support her family.

The couple has four children: Nowee - twenty-three years old; Michael - twenty years old; Maricris - seventeen years old, now in his fourth year of high school, and their youngest, Macario - twelve years old, a mentally disabled child. Maribel's family lives in a harmonious relationship in their rural area of Minanga Proper in Angadanan, Isablea.

loans.use: Feed for her hogs

loans.name: Aitu

texts.en: Aitu P., 36, is married with 4 children.  She has many years of experience in the banana plantation business. She sells to the general public 6 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 700 Tala (about US $231).  SPBD loans are Aitu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: Farming supplies

loans.name: Dani

texts.en: Dani, a 33-year-old married man with one child living in Saida, southern Lebanon, has been working as a chef for eight years and has owned his own kitchen since 2003. Today, Dani is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase new tools for his kitchen.

loans.use: To purchase new tools.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
"I used to be a laborer who worked all day to pay his bills. Now, I manage a small rice farm. I use my harvest to feed and clothe my children, and want grow my farm and provide my children a good future," says George M., a 33-year-old father of two.

He has applied for this loan to buy fertilizers and herbicides. "With my loan, I will be able to improve my harvest and income as well," he said.

CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage also.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en:
Emelie V. is from the town of Camp Phillips, Bukidnon. She is 37 years old. Emelie is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Emelie owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. She also sells a variety of snack products and candies. Emelie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emelie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emelie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & for working capital. Emelie is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Emelie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
La señora Bernardina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Poderosas D. Santa Rosa”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Azangaro, Provincia D. Azangaro, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 52 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, es madre D. 02 hijos y tiene estudios D. primaria completa,  vive en el Barrio Revolución.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 02 años,  su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la compra D. ropa. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra D. ropas D. adultos y D. todas las tallas.

Su deseo es seguir trabajando y así solventar los gastos familiares.

A ella le gustan los ahorros, los encuentros del Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Bernardina is a member of the Community Bank "Las Poderosas D. Santa Rosa", located in the district and province of Azangaro, in Puno. She is 52 years old, she is married, and she is mother of 2 children. She completed primary school. She lives in Barrio Revolucion.

She has been with Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) for the past 2 years. Her first loan of S/.500 nuevos soles was invested in the purchase of items of clothing.

She requires a loan of S/.500 nuevos soles. The funds will be used to purchase clothing for adults in various sizes.

Her wish is to keep working and to cover the family's expenses.

She loves being able to save money, and she enjoys the Community Bank meetings.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing for adults in various sizes.

loans.name: Mari

texts.en: Mari is forty years old. She is married and has six children who are all still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Mari is a trader. She deals in cereals, such as maize. She sells at the market square and also supplies to food vendors in her community. She buys bags of maize from the nearby communities. Mari has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy maize in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize.

loans.name: Doris Patricia

texts.es:
La Sra. Doris S. cuenta con un negocio de salon de belleza que opera bajo el nombre de "BEAUTIFUL IMAGE" tiene 7 años de tener su negocio, ella cuenta con muchos clientes fijos ya que Doris hace un buen trabajo en los cortes de pelo y tintes. los servicios que sus clientes prefieren es el lavado y sacado de cabello, tintes, rayitos. su negocio tiene un amuy bonita apariencia y cuenta con todas las herramientas para poder brindar un servicio de calidad. el negocio esta ubicado en la colonia Arturo Quezada de la ciudad capital, tambien en su negocio ella vende shampoos, cremas, acondicionadores, esmaltes para uña y una gran variedad de productos para belleza.
doris abre su negocio desde las 8:30 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde. ella es una persona cristiana y asiste a la iglesia por las tardes, ella tiene la ayuda de la hija en el negocio, su hija hace los trabajos de pedicure y manicure.
Doris es casada, tiene una hija y un hijo. tambien tiene un nieto.
ella necesita el dinero para la compra de mercaderia al por mayor, ya que sus clientes le piden estos productos.
ella es muy amable y simpatica, su mayor sueño es llegar a tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Ms. Doris S. owns a beauty salon called "BEAUTIFUL IMAGE." She has been in business for 7 years and has many faithful customers because of her skills in cutting and dying hair. She washes, dries, dyes, and highlights hair. Her salon is very appealing, and she has all the tools she needs to provide high quality services.

Her business is located in the Arturo Quezada housing development in the capital city. She also sells shampoos, conditioners, lotions, nail polish, and a great selection of other beauty products.

Doris operates her business from 8:30 in the morning to 6:00 in the evening. She is a Christian woman who attends church in the evening. She gets help from her daughter, who provides manicures and pedicures.

Doris is a married mother with a daughter and son. She also has a grandson. She needs this loan in order to purchase the merchandise that her customers ask for at wholesale prices.

She is very kind a likable. Her biggest wish is to someday own her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase hair dyes, shampoos, hair treatments, lingerie, and fragrances

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en:
Vorn K., age 42, is married and has seven children. She lives with her husband and children in Takeo province. To make a living, she is engaged in a business of producing a cow and buffalo ties, earning approximately US $3 per day. Her husband has to travel to the city to work as a construction builder, earning an income of US $3 per day which is the primary source of income for the family. The family is also assisted by three of the children who are currently employed in a local garment factory with the income of US $3 each.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, K. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, K. is seeking to increase her income. She is asking for a loan of US $1200 to purchase a motorbike to transport her animal ties to sell at the other villages in the province. By doing so, she hopes she will be able to generate more income and save more money to raise a good standard of living.

loans.use: motorbike purchase

loans.name: Ludith

texts.es:
La señora Ludith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 42 años y 03 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella. 

Ludith, lleva 05 años dedicándose a la costura de ropas interiores, poco a poco fue ahorrando su dinero y teniendo la habilidad de la costura no dudo en implementar su propio taller de confección, ubicado en su misma casa.

Nos cuenta que le va muy en sus ventas, trabaja con pedidos de sus clientes anticipadamente.

En la actualidad continua con sus confecciones de ropas interiores y tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acude a su casa para realizar sus trabajos y pedidos, es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con la amabilidad que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 3000.00, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Ludith, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.

loans.use: Comprará materiales de costura.

loans.name: Unidas Por Fe Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Unidas Por Fe, es originario de la comarca Valle de la laguna, ubicada en zonas cercanas a la laguna de apoyo. Es su cuarto ciclo crediticio y están muy satisfechas de sus logros alcanzados.

Justa Pastora Sanchez es la coordinadora del grupo, tiene 46 años de edad y su negocio es la compra  venta de escobas artesanales (de trigo) y Esponjas de baño (artesanales). Trabaja en esto desde hace 22 años e inicio el negocio a raíz de que su prima, quien trabaja también en esto le motivara a iniciar con su propio capital la venta de estos artículos.

Se compran por temporada y se almacenan para vender en el transcurso del año, es por esto que requiere su crédito para comprar grandes cantidades y almacenarlos y venderlos poco a poco.  Así saca las cuotas poco a poco y de esta manera mira sus ganancias distribuidas en el transcurso  del mes.

Guillermina trabaja distribuye especias en las diferentes pulperías y negocios de la comarca y Digna realiza cereales a base de maíz y tortillas.

loans.use: Compra de Productos

loans.name: Paula Benita

texts.es: Paula Benita G. R. is 39 years old and has three children. The older two are married and the youngest, at 21 years old, is finishing her studies. Doña G. R. has run a clothing store for fifteen years, offering different styles of clothing and accessories to her clientele. She plans to use this loan to purchase clothing for men, women and children from contacts she has in the nearby cities of Managua and Chinandega. Doña G. R. says that although she has to deal with customers who are reluctant to pay, her mother, who also ran a clothing store, taught her how to run a successful business. She dreams of home improvements and living a little more comfortably.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Regino Francisco

texts.es:
En el mercado el bisne del departamento de Chinandega, el señor Regino Francisco O. se dedica a la actividad del sector transporte en su triciclo transportando personas de una localidad a otra a un precio modico y de esta manera se gana la vida para llevar el sustento a su hogar.

El problema que él atraviesa hoy en día es que su triciclo se ha dañado y requiere cambio de llantas y neumático y por este motivo solicita crédito en Ceprodel para comprar las llantas y el neumático y seguir en su actividad.
texts.en:
At the Bisne Market in the department of Chinandega, Sr. Regino Francisco O. works in the transportation sector. In order to provide for his family, he offers to transport people from one location to another in his tricycle for a reasonable price.

Regino’s tricycle was damaged, so he is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL so that he can replace the tires and bicycle rims. This will enable him to continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires & rims for his tricycle

loans.name: Eudosia

texts.es:
La señora Eudosia es socia del Banco Comunal “Juchuy Niño” ubicado en el  distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 34 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 04 hijos, vive en la comunidad de Ccotos, estudio educación primaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde la fundación del Banco Comunal, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra-venta de pescado.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar mallas y gasolina para su lancha, para realizar la pesca artesanal que luego lo comercializa directo con los acopiadores.
La señora también se dedica a la venta de salchipapas y pollipapas (comida al paso).

Su mayor deseo es comprarse una casa en Juliaca y hacer de sus hijos unos profesionales.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros y las facilidades en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Sra Eudosia is a member of the Communal Bank “Juchuy Niño” located in the District of Capachica, Puno Province, Department of Puno. She is 34 years old, married, and has 4 children. Eudosia lives in the community of Ccotos and completed her elementary school education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos since the time her Communal Bank was founded. Her first loan was in the amount of 300 soles and was used to increase her business capital for buying and selling fish.

Eudosia is requesting a new loan of 2000 soles to purchase fishing nets and fuel for her motorboat. This will enable her to keep fishing so that she can sell her catch directly to the distributors. In addition, she also sells “salchipapas” and “pollipapas” (forms of fast food). Her greatest dream is to buy a house in Juliaca and see her children become professionals. Eudosia enjoys her savings and the simplicity of the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fishing nets & fuel for her motorboat

loans.name: Ikechukwu

texts.en: Ikechukwu is 27 years old and single without children. He sells phone accessories at retail prices to his customers. He sells for long hours so he can support himself and his aging parents. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more phone accessories to  sell. This is the high season for business and he hopes to meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to own a phone company in the future. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more phone accessories to sell.

loans.name: Aunofo

texts.en:
Aunofo is 36 and married with 3 children (ages 3-8).  She owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  She has 5 years of experience in this business.    Aunofo needs a loan of WST $1300 to expand from plantation to vegetable garden.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Aunofo joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Aunofo's 3rd loan with SPBD. 

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. 

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to expand from plantation to vegetable garden

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie T. is 19 and single with 1 child.  She owns a business venture, selling fried foods in the local community.  Marie has 3 years of experience in this business.  Marie needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Marie joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Marie's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Marie T. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.8 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Alinyikira Development Group, Mukono

texts.en:
N. Robinah is 46 years old and married with seven children between the ages of 7 and 25, and she also takes care of four siblings. 

Robinah has operated a poultry farm in Kasangalabi for three years where she keeps both broilers for meat and layers for eggs. The layers eventually are used for meat. 

This is the second time that Robinah has sought a loan from Pearl Microfinance. She is happy to say that the first loan helped her in expanding her farm. With this loan she will be able to buy more chicken feed for her farm and also a ledger for keeping track of her layers.

loans.use: To buy more chicken feed and a ledger for keeping track of her layers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food items in bulk

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es: Doña Eusebia R., de 38 años de edad, originaria de Tecpán Guatemala, tiene 20 años de casada y tiene 6 hijos, en especial un varón con discapaciadad, y los demas son mujeres, viven a 3 kilometros del municipio, se dedican al destace y venta de pollo, y como complemento tiene a la venta sandalias, este negocio es atendido por la familia. El crédito lo solicita para comprar mas pollo y sandalias y asi poder ampliar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Doña Eusebia R., age 38, is a native of Tecpán Guatemala. She has been married for 20 years and has 6 children, including a young man who is disabled, and the rest are women. They live about 3 kilometers from the city. They are dedicated to raising and selling chickens, and as a complement they sell sandals. This business is attended by the family. The loan requested is to buy more chickens and sandals and in this way to be able to expand their profits.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy more chickens and sandals for resale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 31-year-old married mother of two, aged seven and one year. The seven-year-old attends school. Mary's husband is a carpenter.

Mary sells shoes and charcoal, a business she has been running for the last three years. Previously, she was selling clothes to earn a living. She has requested Kes 20,000 to add to her stock of shoes and charcoal.

Mary dreams of owning a boutique in future. She describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To add to her stock of shoes and charcoal

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es:
La Señora Zulma, soltera  de 41 años de edad, es comerciante y  tiene un hijo de 7 años  llamado Lucas quien se encuentra cursando   el segundo grado de la  Educación Básica.
 Comenta que empezó trabajando  hace más de 5 años, y que con la venta de animales   consiguió  el capital para la compra de sus mercaderías (ropas de todo tipo). 
Actualmente cuenta con variedad de mercaderías y con más de 300 clientes con quien trabaja día a día  para sacar adelante a toda su familia.  
Vende todo tipo de prendas de vestir como ser: pantalones, remeras, polleras, jeans, etc. y sus ventas las realiza en forma ambulante, casa por casa.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de más mercaderías (prendas de vestir en Gral.) ya que actualmente cuenta con un gran número de pedidos y desea cumplir con toda su clientela.
texts.en:
Señora Zulma is a 41 year old, single merchant with one seven year old son named Lucas who is moving through second grade in his basic education. She tells us that she started working more than 5 years ago by selling animals. Then she got enough capital to purchase clothing of all kinds. Now, she sells a variety of products to more than 300 clients. She works daily to help her family move ahead. She sells all types of outfits and clothing which can include pants, t-shirts, skirts, jeans, etc. She pedals her products from door to door. She is asking for a loan so that she can buy more clothes since she has many orders outstanding and she would like to fill them all.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants, t-shirts, skirts, jeans etc.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel G. is from the village of Argayoso, Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 46 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Maricel owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2010, Maricel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Maricel plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children’s education. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Afaayo  Development Group, Mukono

texts.en:
Z. Elisha is a 37-year-old happy-go-lucky married father of four. To provide for his family’s welfare, he does laundry at people’s homes and also tends people’s compounds in and around the environs of Kyaliwajala in Mukono. For the last seven years he has been doing this.

Despite the societal scorn this type of job carries, Elisha has glossed over the stereotypes and gotten himself a niche. In his fast growing operating area, his elbow-grease work is getting a flood-tide of approval and exposure from his increasing clientele.

In the run-up to the dawn of last year, Elisha’s profit-making prospects improved as a result of the enormous appreciation for his work. In a month, he says he makes 400,000 shillings. With this loan, a determined Elisa says he wants to buy new laundry cleaning equipment and also a mowing machine.

loans.use: To purchase new laundry cleaning equipment and a new mowing machine

loans.name: Renuka

texts.en:
Renuka  is a 32-year-old married woman living with her husband and two daughters. She has one 6-year-old and one 2-year-old. Her husband assists with her business and they are very close and work well together.

Renuka has a sewing shop where she sews dresses for local customers and villagers. Five years ago, she started this business.

Renuka has requested a 20,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to buy raw materials for her sewing shop to help her business. She is grateful for BRAC Sri Lanka because of the support it provides to her.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Lina Fe

texts.en: Lina Fe S. is from Barangay Paniki, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 47 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Lina Fe owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling cosmetics in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Lina Fe joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lina Fe is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her third from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam S. is 35 years old and lives in Andoung Samretth village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 2.5 hectares (6.25 acres) of land she uses to cultivate rice for a living. Beside being a farmer, she is also a vegetable and meal seller who owns a small store to support her business. With these two businesses she can earn a small income to support her family.

In order to support her farm crop and her grocery business, Mrs. Sam S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and rice seed to support her farming and more vegetables and meal for her store.

Mrs. Sam S. is a widow with two children who both attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer and pesticide for her farm plus vegetables and meal for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy assorted merchandise like: bags, umbrellas, knapsacks, slippers and shoes.

loans.name: Jokudu

texts.en:
Jokudu M. sells ice cream and bread at the market and is requesting a loan to stock baking flour to start baking local Sudanese bread to sell.  

Jokudu is 39 years old, married to a teacher, and has three children who all go to school.  In the future, she hopes to open a restaurant if any extra profits are realized from her business.

loans.use: to stock baking flour

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more fufu, rice and oil to sell

loans.name: Sroy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sroy H. (her daughters are in the photo), is 34 years old and her husband, Mr. Lavi Ly, is 37 years old. They live in a small village along National Road Number Five about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1998 and have four children--two sons and two daughters. All of them are in school.  

Sroy sells cake at the local school. Her husband is a construction worker. In addition, the couple is hired by their villagers to produce Khmer noodles. They do not have their own transportation for commuting which costs them a lot of money. 

Therefore, Sroy is applying for her first loan of US$ 600 to purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena A. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 42 years old. Lorena is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Lorena owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Lorena has been engaged in her business for over 3 years.

Lorena joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorena has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Lorena is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Sau's Group

texts.en:
Sau T. N. is 52 years old with three children — two of them in high school. She has a shop that sells many kind of eggs — hen, ducks, and goose eggs. Her  business is good. Everyday, she makes 100,000 VND profit. With our credit program since 2004, she is a good group leader. Currently, she wants a loan of 4,142,000 VND to buy more eggs to meet customer demand.

Tang T. N. is 54 years old with one child. She runs a small grocery shop. She wants a loan of  6,322,000 VND to invest in her shop.

Xa T. N. is 56 years old with one daughter. She is raising 200 hens and wants a loan of 6,322,000 VND to buy more feed and improve her hen house.

loans.use: to buy more eggs to meet demand

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, de 27 años, convive con Amarildo, de 28 años, producto de su amor nació Miguel de 8 años, al cual cuidan y educan en una casa alquilada, en la localidad de Patay. Hace ya 8 años que se dedica a la siembra de arveja, papa y hortalizas; el cual los vende en el mercado central de su localidad; para que sus productos alcancen mayor demanda ella los trabaja y cuida con dedicación junto a su esposo; todas las mañanas desde muy temprano sale en busca de plantaciones de gladiolos, los compra y los vende en la capital, el negocio es favorable por ello viaja una vez por semana a la capital.  Dentro de unos meses cosechará una gran cantidad de hortalizas, con ello podrá adquirir mayor capital y sembrará arvejas, con lo cual aumentará sus ahorros para comprar su casa propia. Es el séptimo crédito con MFP y está segura que podrá salir adelante con la ayuda de su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará semillas de arveja, abono y medicinas para el cultivo de arveja que sembrará y cuidará durante cuatro meses.
texts.en:
Sonia, age 27, lives with 28 year old Amarildo.  They have an eight year old son that they are caring for and educating in a rented house in Patay.

For eight years she has been planting peas, potatoes, and vegetables.  She sells them at the central market in her area.  In order for her products to be in greater demand, she and her husband work and take care of them with dedication. She leaves very early every morning looking for gladiola fields.  She buys gladiolas, and she sells them in the capital.  The business is profitable, so she travels to the capital once a week.

In a few months time she will harvest a large quantity of vegetables.  Then she will be able to get more capital, and she will plant peas.  This will increase her savings to buy her own house.

This is her seventh loan with MFP.  She is certain that she will be will be able to get ahead with the help of her communal bank.  She will use the requested loan to buy pea seeds, fertilizer, and products to treat disease for the peas that she will plant and take care of for four months.

loans.use: To buy pea seeds and sacks of fertilizer
