loans.name: Ntungamo Tukore Twetungure A, Kihihi Group

texts.en:
Hard working, dependable and die-hard agriculturalist Alice K., 53, has been maintaining a banana plantation alongside her teaching profession for more than 10 years in her home area of Kyabuyorwe, Kihihi. She fetches an average amount of 200,000 Ugandan shillings per month from banana sales, though not enough to sustain her extended family.

Alice has persevered to keep the enterprise growing, and her aim for taking up this loan is to enable her to buy mulches and manure for the plantation as she looks at an expansion plan for transporting her products to bigger markets. This will help her increase productivity as well as earn more revenue, live a more sustaining life and educate all her children.

loans.use: To purchase mulches for the plantation

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet N. lives in the Kalerwe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has 3 children, all of whom are in school.  Juliet has a business operating a retail shop.  She has been in this business for 4 years, and she works 7 days out of every week.  Juliet sells her products from home selling at retail.     

Juliet has requested for a loan 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, cooking oil and boxes of soap.   The main business challenge(s) for Juliet   include transportation and rainy season.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling at wholesale only and also buy another plot of land.    

Juliet lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and has piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, cooking oil, and boxes of soap

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bread, beans, seasoning, cooking oil, pepper, salt, etc

loans.name: Silva

texts.en:
Silva N., age 38, sells shoes in Tala market. She is married to Timothy G., who is a driver, and together they have two children:  Brian, age 11, in class seven, and Vivian, age 4, in class four. Silva has been in business for 7 years and her monthly income is 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). She was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of Tala office. With a loan of 20,000 KES, she will increase her stock of shoes. If the loan boosts the business, Silva will open another shop for selling clothes so as to increase her profits.

Silva describes herself as hardworking and in the future she dreams of owning a company for clothes and shoes. This will enable her to give quality education to her children.

loans.use: To increase her stock of shoes for sale

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
La Señora. María R. es socia del banco comunal La Estancia, vive en la comunidad de la Estancia que pertenece al cantón Paute, este cantón se caracteriza por  la belleza natural de sus paisajes, es de clima templado, en sus tierras se cultivan las mas hermosas flores, su gente tiene un corazón muy calido y amable.

Doña María se dedica hace varios años a la cría de animales como son cerdos, cuyes y pollos a los cuales los vende en su propia comunidad, actividad que aprendió gracias a sus padres y le ayudado a sacar en adelante a su familia.
 
La Señora. María tiene 40 años,  vive en unión libre  y tiene 4 hijos de 20, 17, 7 y 2 años de edad, su primera hija pasa en la casa y ayuda en los quehaceres, su segundo hijo trabaja pero solo para sus gastos personales, su tercer hijo estudia en una escuela del sector. Su esposo es de profesión chofer, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 4 años y le gusta porque los créditos le benefician en su trabajo. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes. Su meta es  sacar  adelante sus hijos para que tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Mrs. María R. is a member of the La Estancia communal bank.  She lives in La Estancia which is in Paute canton.  This canton is characterized by the natural beauty of its scenery.  It has a mild climate and beautiful flowers are grown in its fields.  Its people are very warmhearted and gracious.

For several years María has raised animals like pigs, guinea pigs and chickens that she sells in her own community, an activity she learned from her parents and that has helped her support her family.

She is 40 years old and lives in a common law union.  She has four children who are 20, 17, 7 and 2 years of age.  Her oldest daughter stays home and helps with the household chores.  Her second son works but just to meet his personal expenses.  Her third son goes to the local school.  Her husband is a driver by profession.  Their work as a couple has resulted in their being able to build their own house.

She has been a member of the communal bank for 4 years.  She likes it because the loans are beneficial to her work.  The money from the loan will be used to buy guinea pigs.  Her goal is to move her children ahead so that they will have a better future.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Luz Adilia

texts.es: Luz Adilia se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Siempre está preocupada por sacar adelante a su familia. Es una señora que tiene todo el entusiasmo de salir adelante y mejorar las condiciones de su familia, sus clientes llegan a su vivienda a comprar las buenas tortillas que ofrece. Se siente feliz por tener un medio de vida que le genere ganancias. Este crédito es para la compra de  leña, maíz y cal que son los productos claves para sus tortillas.
texts.en: Luz Adilia makes tortillas. She has had this business for more than five years. She is always worried about her family's progress. She is a woman who is very enthusiastic about making progress and improving her family's living conditions; her customers come to her house to buy the good tortillas that she sells. She is happy to have this lifestyle that brings in revenue. This loan is to buy firewood, corn, and lime, which are the key ingredients for her tortillas.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 35 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Tiontala préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce d’habillements, grains, condiments, fruits etc.                                                                                    
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur premier prêt solidaire avec Soro Yiriwaso.                                                                          
ROKIA S. s’approvisionnera en grains de céréales chez les revendeurs de Massigui et environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place et au marché pendant les jours de foires, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de consommateurs.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 24 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi group are all married women, averaging 35 years of age, with three children. They live in traditional extended families in the village of Tiontala, Dioila Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (the 2nd administrative region of Mali).

They know each other through family ties. They sell clothing, cereals, condiments, fruits etc. The members of the Benkadi group are on the first solidarity loan with Soro Yiriwaso. Rokia Sanagare buys her stock of cereals from resellers in Massigui and nearby markets. She sells out of her home and at the market on market days, retails for cash and on credit, mainly to direct consumers.
She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 24,000 West African Francs, which will be used to repay the loan, with the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: Purchasing cereals

loans.name: Marcia Del Socorro

texts.es: Marcia Del Socorro tiene su pulpería. Hace más de 2 años que  tiene este negocio. Esta no es la primera vez que solicita créditos pues ha sido una persona muy dinámica. La comercialización de granos básicos y productos de consumo del hogar son necesarios para el hogar, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y por el esfuerzo que realiza diariamente, es así que ha podido sacar adelante a su hijo para proporcionarle lo más necesario. El crédito es para la compra de carnes, golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergentes  y granos básicos.
texts.en: Marcia Del Socorro has a general store, which she’s had for more than 2 years.  This is not the first time she has requested a loan, as she is a very dynamic person.  Sales of basic need and consumer products are necessary for the home.  She is a very hard-working person who puts forth a great effort each day.  This is how she’s been able to help her son get ahead and provide for him.  The loan is for the purchase of meats, snacks, refreshments, bread, detergents, and grains.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok H. (pictured above) is 30 years old, and her husband, Mr. Thy Neang, who is 27 years old, live about seven kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2001 and have one daughter who is in school. 

Sok is a garment factory worker. Her husband is a drinking water deliveryman. He buys drinking water and then delivers it to customers who have businesses that require drinking water. He bought a van for transporting the water, but he does not have enough money to buy more drinking water to sell.

Sok requests a loan to pay for purchasing more drinking water to resell.

loans.use: To purchase a van for her husband to carry drinking water for resale.

loans.name: Marta Inés

texts.es:
Desde los 14 años de edad, Marta Inés Z. V. aprendió a coser al lado de su madre, desde entonces se ha dedicado a este oficio que le ha permitido ganarse la vida. Fue hace algunos años, con la esperanza de labrarse un buen porvenir, cuando desde su pueblo natal, Concordia emprendió viaje hacia Medellín-Colombia, ciudad donde esperaba superarse y mejorar su calidad de vida. 

Desde entonces, empezó a mejorar su trabajo y a ofrecer sus servicios a sus vecinos y conocidos y fue así como fue perfeccionando su trabajo. Actualmente, Marta Inés necesita de un préstamo para comprar una máquina de coser familiar que le permitirá realizar varias tareas y agilizar su trabajo para cumplir con mayor prontitud con sus pedidos.

En un futuro Marta Inés sueña con ampliar su negocio hasta convertirse en una empresaria de verdad como ella misma lo afirma.
texts.en:
When she was 14 years old, Marta Inés Z. V. learned to sew at her mother's side.  Ever since, she has worked in this profession and it has allowed her to earn a living.  Some years ago, with the hope of building a good future for herself, she left her home village of Concordia and travelled to Medellín-Colombia, a city where she hoped she could improve herself and her quality of life.

Since that time, she has improved her work and she now offers her services to her neighbors and acquaintances.  In this way, she has perfected her work.  Currently, Marta Inés needs a loan so that she can buy a sewing machine that will allow her to do a number of tasks and make her work easier so that she can fill her orders more quickly.

In the future, Marta Inés dreams of expanding her business and becoming 'a real businesswoman' as she puts it.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Mrs. Sophal Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of sixteen people who have selected Mrs. Sophal to be a village bank president. All members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family's standard of living. 

Mrs. Sophal, born in 1967, is a farmer who owns a 5-hectare plot of land where she can grow rice.  She sells part of her rice yield, and with the rest she supports her family.  Mr. Pheun is a duck breeder who can earn some money from selling duck eggs.  He also owns a threshing machine for renting to farmers.  Mrs. Sophal wants to buy a harvest machine to start a new business, but her savings is not sufficient to support this.  Mrs. Sophal is seeking a loan to buy a harvest machine for renting to farmers. She is a mother of three children, one of whom helps with his father’s business, while the others attend local public school.

loans.use: to buy a harvest machine

loans.name: Kiprono

texts.en:
Kiprono, 37, is married with four children between the ages of 1 and 8. Two of the children are currently attending school. He is a dairy farmer from the town of Litein in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been in the farming business for ten years and employs one farmhand. He solely depends on the income from his farm to provide for the basic needs of his family.

He has requested a loan of 60,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a motorcycle for transporting his milk to the market. He says that the motorcycle will enable him to reach a wider market for his milk, which will increase his income. His primary challenges in farming have been a poor road network and lack of enough animal feeds. He plans to construct a zero grazing unit in the next five years.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to transport milk to the market

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy T. D. is 45 years old with two children who are at vocational school. 

Being a farmer, she focuses on growing rice and vegetables to meet her family food demands. Besides, she breeds 200 chickens for eggs. Her business is quite good and it creates a considerable income for her to pay for her family expenses and school fees. 

Since joining our credit program in 2003, she has had a good history of repayment. Now she wants to have a loan of 8,066,000 VND to buy food for her chickens and to improve their house.

loans.use: to buy food for chickens and improve  their house

loans.name: Taghreed

texts.en:
Taghreed G. is the mother of three children, and her husband works at a governmental institution during the day. Taghreed is well-known for her delicious sweets among her friends and neighbors; that’s what gave her the motivation to start her business 10 years ago.

Taghreed felt the need of having a small business to be able to help her husband with their monthly income, so they bought all the equipment that she needs to be able to make her sweets and sell them. During these 10 years she has been able to have a wide customer base by only word of mouth.

Now Taghreed has applied for this loan to buy a van to use for distribution, so she can reach more areas to sell her sweets.

loans.use: To buy a van to use for distribution.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José Luis es un hombre soltero de 21 años de edad, vive en la casa de sus padres que cuenta con todos los servicios (agua, luz y desagüe),es una zopna urbana ubicada en la provinciade Chiclayo.  Ciudad que se caracteriza porque su actividad principal es el  comercio al por mayor y menor y el turismo.
Jose Luis se dedica a la venta de carne de aves (pollo, gallina, patos, etc.), desde hace 2 años, la venta lo realiza en el mercado Modelo de Chiclayo,tiene un negocio muy próspero, en el cual cada día va incrementando más sus ganancias, lo que le permitirá tener una mejor calidad de vida.
A solicitado José Luis un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para la compra de un refrigerador para guardar sus productos y no se deterioren, lo cual le permitirá atender mayor cantidad de clientes y así podra aumentar sus ventas, para seguir ayudando a sus padres en los gastos de casa.
José Luis es un jovén responsable y trabajador conocido en el mercado por ser una persona alegre y con ganas de seguir superarndose en la vida constantemente.
texts.en:
José Luis, 21, is single and lives in his parents’ house that has all basic utilities (water, electricity and sewage) in an urban area located in Chiclayo Province.  This city is notable because its main activity is wholesale and retail commerce and tourism.

José Luis has sold different meats from fowl (duck, chicken, turkey, etc) for the last two years.  His sales take place in Chiclayo’s Modelo Market.  He has a very prosperous business where profits have been increasing daily which makes it possible for him to have a better quality of life.

José Luis has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to buy a refrigerator to store his products so that they won’t spoil.  This will make it possible for him to tend to a larger number of customers and thus increase sales to continue helping his parents with household expenses.

José Luis is a responsible, hard working young man who is known in the market for being a cheerful person with a strong desire to continue to constantly improve in life.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to store his products.

loans.name: Naana

texts.en:
Naana is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a farmer. Naana buys fresh fish from the market and comes home to fry them for resale to people living in the village of Kwaprow, near Abura. 

Naana uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Naana plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Sinara

texts.en:
Sinara is 27 years old, and his wife, Sokrus, is 29.  The couple, pictured above, have been married for four years and have a young son who is one-and-a-half years old. The family lives in a village along National Road 10, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sinara hopes to expand his house so it would be better for family members to live in. Hence he is asking for a loan in the amount of $800.

loans.use: To expand the house where he lives.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson , aged 39, is married and he and his wife have two children.  He has been farming on his piece of land for the past five years.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET staff,and he is applying for his first loan which he plans to use to purchase farm supplies. 

He hopes to use the profit to educate his children and expand his farming . He dreams of prospering in farming to provide a better life to his children.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Reyna Marlene

texts.es: La Señora Reyna Marlene tiene su negocio que es la venta de cosméticos y ropa, ella tiene 36 años y es casada. Ella realiza sus actividades diarias del hogar antes de salir a vender a ofrecer sus diferentes productos, Reyna trabaja desde las 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 8 la noche por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar sus ingresos. Ella solicita el préstamo para comprar polvos, cremas, perfumes, pantalones, camisas y trajes. Por lo que se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Señora Reyna Marlene runs a business selling cosmetics and clothing. She is 36 years old and married. She completes her household chores before leaving for work each day at 8am. She finishes work at 8pm and is always seeking ways to increase her income.

Reyna is looking for a loan to buy face powder, lotions, perfumes, pants, shirts and dresses. She promises to pay back the loan according the established schedule of repayments.

loans.use: to buy face powder, lotions, perfumes, pants, shirts and dresses

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
This is Rebecca, 53, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Carlo, an operator, and has two children, who are already working and settled down with their own families. Rebecca and her husband manage their own household while operating their business. At this time, Rebecca is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rebecca operates a variety store which, in the Philippines, is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5 worth of cooking oil or an egg. Rebecca earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. In addition to her variety store, Rebecca oversees operations of their jeepney transportation business – a type of public transportation in the Philippines. Her store is located adjacent to her house and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Rebecca earns a minimum of PHP 1,680 every day.

To help her continue her business operations, Rebecca is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Rebecca hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes her grandchild to finish schooling. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery products and inventory items

loans.name: Félix

texts.fr: Félix est âgé de 37 ans et vit au Bénin. Félix ne vit plus avec sa femme, mais vit seul avec ses deux enfants tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Félix assure seul les diverses charges de la maison. Félix a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au secondaire. Pour assurer ses besoins et ceux de sa famille, Félix a appris le métier de couture. Félix exerce cette activité passionnément depuis dix ans. De façon secondaire, Félix vend des produits congelés et des cartes de recharges téléphoniques. Félix achète ses produits dans l'une des villes du Bénin. En vue de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Félix sollicite pour la deuxième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Félix, 37, lives in Bénin. He no longer lives with his wife but lives alone with his two children, both enrolled in school and both his responsibility. He supports his family alone. 

 Félix attended school up to the secondary level. To support himself and his family, he learned to be a tailor. He has been enthusiastically involved in this work for 10 years. Secondarily, he sells frozen foods and telephone recharge cards. He buys his products in a city in Bénin. Wishing to better satisfy his customers, he is requesting a loan from ALIDé for the second time.

loans.use: to buy cloth to make outfits.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin believed that patience and hard work in farming would enable him reach his goals someday. He is a 54-year-old father of five and a farmer for almost 35 years now, managing a 1.5 hectare rice field in their village. 

From farming he usually earns an average net income of PHP 30,000 every harvest season (wet and dry seasons). He wants to improve his production to increase his income so he can satisfy the needs of his family and also to somehow find way of renovating their house where they could live comfortably. 

He is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides, and to pay the labor cost for the uprooting and transplanting of the rice crop. He hopes to continue to make improvements on his way of farming for a better yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides, and to pay the labor cost for the uprooting and transplanting of the rice crop.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha de 49 años de edad, viuda, tiene 3 hijos, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Martha es una mujer muy trabajadora que desde muy joven viene realizando labores agrícolas,  las cuales le enseñaron sus padres. Hace un año atrás dejo este oficio para dedicarse al cuidado de niños en un wawa wasi (guardería) de su comunidad, este trabajo pertenece a un programa del gobierno que brinda atención a personas que tienen bebes y no pueden laborar normalmente porque no tienen quien atienda a sus pequeños  hijos. Así, Martha presta sus servicios en el cuidado de bebes, porque tiene mucha paciencia y dedicación a ellos. Se siente feliz realizando este trabajo que a cambio le permite alcanzar un sueldo para poder solventar los gastos de la casa. En un futuro próximo ella desea abrir una tienda de abarrotes. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el que ella ratifica su compromiso el de cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles comprará materiales educativos para enseñarles a los niños que cuida en su guardería.
texts.en:
Martha is 49 years old and widowed. She has 3 children, and they live in their own house located in the district of Pichari. Martha is a very hard-working woman who has done agricultural work since she was very young; she learned this work from her parents. One year ago, she left this profession to dedicate herself to caring for children in a "wawa wasi" (child care center) in her community. This work is part of a government program which provides care for the benefit of people who have babies and cannot normally work because they do not have anyone to care for their small children. Thus, Martha provides her services caring for babies, because she is very patient and dedicated to them. She feels happy doing this work, which in turn allows her to earn a salary so she can cover her household expenses. In the near future, she would like to open a grocery store. This is her second loan with  MFP, and Martha once again pledges to make her payments on time. 

This is her second loan, and she stands by her commitment to make her payments on time. Martha is happy to belong to her communal bank, because all of the members are punctual. With the 1,500 Peruvian new soles, she will buy materials to help care for children in the child care center.

loans.use: to buy materials for the child care center.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha, de 48 años, es una mujer alegre, dinámica y muy trabajadora, esta felizmente casada y vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de 12, 9 y 6 años respectivamente. El trabajo de Martha consiste en la compra al por mayor de plátano y a la venta al menudeo, además ella vende refresco en el mercado Bellavista de la ciudad. Este trabajo lo hace ya desde hace un año y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, además se siente una mujer independiente. Sin embargo necesita invertir bastante dinero porque el precio de los insumos tienen un precio alto, debido a la temporada de lluvia y la creciente del río Ucayali desbarranco la mayoría de senbrios y perjudico gran parte de los agricultores. Ahora espera fortalecer su negocio, además piensa que puede poner una carpintería para que pueda trabajar ahí su esposo. Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene y desea continuar con su trabajo, por eso espera el apoyo de ustedes. Con el monto solicitado, comprará herramientas para implementar una carpintería ya que esta decidida a iniciar esta actividad a lado de su esposo.
texts.en:
Martha is 48 years old. She is a happy, dynamic and very hard working woman. She is happily married and lives in her own house along with her husband and their three children who are 12, 9 and 6 years old, respectively. Martha's work consists of buying banana at wholesale and selling it at retail. Additionally, she sells refreshments in the Bellavista city market. She has done this work for a year and she counts on the help of her husband. Also, she feels like an independent woman.Nevertheless, she needs to invest some money because the price of inputs has a high price due to the rainy season and
the rising Ucayali river ruined the crops and farmers lost a great deal. Now she hopes to strengthen her business. She's also thinking of starting a carpentry business so that her husband can work. This is the second loan that she's taken and she wishes to continue with her work and so she hopes for your support. With the amount requested, she will buy tools to start the carpentry shop since she has decided to start that activity at her husband's side.

loans.use: to purchase tools to start a carpentry business.

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
This is Edelyn, 35, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Francisco, a porter, and is a mother to her children. Together with her husband and children, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Edelyn sells RTW clothes, towels, and blankets to her customers. A customer's order is bought in cash by her and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. She also sells water by the container to those in the community who don’t have access to it. She also earns additional income on her room rentals. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 2,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 16,000-PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more stock of personal merchandise to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Edelyn dreams of being able to give all her children a good future and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have a growing network of customers. She faithfully meets up with her fellowship co-members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise and products needed in her business

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is 23 years old and single.  

To earn a living, he sells clothes. He has employed two people in his business. He was previously operating a retail shop.  

Through Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access business loans and get financial education. He hopes to have a well-established business in the future for more income generation.  

He has requested 40,000 KES to buy more clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia's main source of income comes from selling fish in the local community. She is 52 years old, widowed and has 7 adult children. She is from the village of Rang-ay, Cabatuan, Isabela. Lucia has been in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 800 PHP a day for these activities.

Lucia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Lucia is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase different kinds of fish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of fish to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.ru:
Виктория замужем, имеет одну дочь. Вот уже 14 лет, как она занимается своим бизнесом - продает женскую одежду на одном из рынков города Запорожье. У Виктории хорошее торговое место. Она предлагает качественный товар по доступным ценам, что привлекает новых и удерживает постоянных покупателей. Ее клиенты - женщины 45-55 лет. Мало кто на рынке работает с этой возрастной группой, поэтому у Виктории мало конкурентов и бизнес идет хорошо.

Виктория просит предоставить ей кредит на закупку зимних теплых курток. Она планирует получить дополнительную прибыль и улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en: Victoria is married and has one daughter.  She has been involved in her own business for 14 years and sells women's clothing at one of the markets of the town of Zaporozhye.  Victoria has a good retail location.  She offers quality merchandise at affordable prices, which attracts new customers and retains loyal ones.  Her clients are 45-55 year-old women.  Hardly anyone at the market works with this age group, and this is why Victoria has little competition, and her business is going well.  Victoria is requesting a loan for the purchase of warm winter jackets.  She plans to make additional profits and improve her family's livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase winter jackets

loans.name: Orlando Jose

texts.es: Orlando José es operario de maquinas en la zona franca. El tiene cierto tiempo de trabajar en este lugar. El tiene muchas metas pero una de ellas es terminar de acondicionar su vivienda. El motivo del crédito que está realizando es para comprar materiales de construcción como antera, piedrín, cerámica, cemento entre otros. El no había podido realizar las mejoras necesarias porque no tenía los ingresos necesarios,  pero con la ayuda de este crédito podrá obtener lo que necesita.
texts.en: Orlando José is a machine operator in the shipping port zone. He has worked there for some time now. He has many goals, and one of them is finishing work on his home. The aim of the loan he is taking out is to buy construction materials such as stone, gravel, ceramic tile and cement, among others. He has not been able to carry out the necessary improvements because he did not have the income he needed, but with the help of this loan, he will be able to obtain what he needs.

loans.use: to buy stone, gravel, ceramic tile, cement, and other supplies.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David has been in the clothing sales business in Ndunyu Njeru for the last 10 years.  He is 37 years old, married to Mary and they have three school-going children.

David was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more clothing stock for his business. In the future, David hopes to expand his business and become one of the leading clothing dealers in the area.

loans.use: To buy more stock for resale

loans.name: Yulis

texts.es: Yulis de 25 años de edad vive en Soledad con su esposo y su hijo de 3 años de edad; allí tiene una sala de belleza donde ofrece servicios de peluquería  y también tiene una miscelánea en la que vende accesorios, cosméticos productos de belleza etc. Para el montaje de su negocio, aprendió en una academia servicios de belleza, posteriormente se desempeñó como ayudante en un salón de belleza y cuando estuvo preparada, se independizó y emprendió ella misma su propia aventura de negocios,   aprovechando gradualmente  la clientela para ofrecer además de productos de belleza, otras mercancías, que sus clientes necesitaban y le pedían.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará una silla, un lava cabezas para peluquería y mercancía encargada, como ropa y cosméticos, para uso de sus clientes en el final de año que se acerca con mucho dinero rotando,.
texts.en:
Yulis, 25, lives in Soledad with her husband and 3-year-old son.  She has a beauty salon there where she offers barber shop services; she also has a variety store where she sells accessories, cosmetics, beauty products, etc.  

To open the business she took courses at a beauty school and later worked as an assistant in a beauty salon.  When she felt she was prepared, she became independent and launched her own adventure in business gradually availing herself of her customers to also sell beauty products and other merchandise that they requested or needed.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy a salon chair, a hair wash sink and merchandise she has pending orders for like clothes and cosmetics for her customers’ use during the end of year when there is much money in circulation.

loans.use: to buy a salon chair, a hair wash basin and merchandise she has on order.

loans.name: Yeni Maria

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica departamento de León,la señoraYeni es madre soltera ycomerciante en el ramo de venta de ropa de toda categoría y tallas. Es una señora emprendedora, con 1 hijo  en edad escolar al que tiene el deber de mantener sus estudios;En cuanto a su labor ella  tiene 21 años de ejercerla con éxito.

Desde que inició su negocio,Yeni se esforzó por mejorar y emprender otra actividad como es la compra de un carro para taxi local en Telica, y  hoy poder mantener su nucleo familiar.

Una de las necesidades es de comprar productos para su actividad como es la compra de blusas de  mujer,  gel, camisetas blancas para hombre, camisetas finas de hombre ycamisetas blancas juvenil.
Espere que su crédito le sea otorgado satisfactoriamente para continuar con su labor en su comunidad.
texts.en:
In the town of Telica, in the division of León, Yeni is a single mother and merchant in the trade of selling clothing in all types and sizes. She is an entrepreneurial woman, with 1 school-aged son who has the will to continue his studies. As for her work, she has 21 years of practicing it with success.
From the time she started her business, Yeni strove to improve and undertake other activities like the purchase of a car to serve as a local taxi in Telica, and now to be able to maintain her familial nucleus.
One of the needs is to buy products for her business like the purchase of women’s blouses, gel, white t-shirts for men, fine shirts for men, and children’s white t-shirts. She hopes that her loan will be satisfactorily granted in order to continue with her work in her community.

loans.use: to buy clothing of different sizes and styles such as women's blouses, gel, white t-shirts for men, fine shirts for men, matches, and youth white t-shirts.

loans.name: Loeurt

texts.en:
Loeurt is 47 years old and married. She resides with her husband and five children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area which is well known for its historical tourism sites (ancient temples such as Angkor Wat, Bayon, Banteay Srey, etc.). She distils alcohol and raises pigs at home. Her husband is a fisherman. Additionally, he is a rice farmer and raises seven buffaloes. 

Loeurt is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a plow for personal use and rental. In the future, she would like to purchase more land to grow rice in the dry season, build a new house, and support her children's studies until they get bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a plow for personal use and rental

loans.name: Sopey Xaleyi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe de solidarité Sopey Xaleyi a été crée le 12 Mai 2010, Il est composé de 14 femmes issue de la même localité. Elles exercent la même activité la transformation d'huile d'arachide. Ndèye (Debout à droite de la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 51 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants. Elle fait la transformation de l'huile d'arachide. Avec son prêt reçu, elle va augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement acheter un mouton et des arachides pour revendre. Ses bénéfices lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans prise en charge des besoins de la famille et d'augmenter son épargne.
texts.en: The Sopey Xaleyi solidarity group was created on May 12, 2010. It consists of 14 women who are all from the same area.  They are all in the business of processing peanut oil.  Ndeye (standing at the right of the photo) is the manager of the group.  She is 51 years old.  She is married and mother of 10 children.  She processes peanut oil.  With her loan, she will increase her inventory and buy a sheep and peanuts for resale.  Her profits will allow her to support her husband by taking care of the family expenses and to build her savings.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en: Evelyne is 23 years old and married with two children aged 1 and 5. She owns a grocery store and sells onions, tomatoes, potatoes and cabbages to earn a living, she has been in the business for 4 years and has employed one person. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income. She hopes to expand her business into wholesale in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy onions, tomatoes, potatoes, and cabbages.

loans.use: To buy onions, tomatoes, potatoes and cabbages

loans.name: Antero

texts.en:
ENGLISH

Mr. Antero Medellin has to work hard to supply the needs of his family. He practices different activities: he rents a taxicab several hours by day, and he sells clothes, cheese and cookies in some fleet markets. He is married and has three children. His wife supports him and helps him to sell clothes and cookies.

He is requesting a loan for $475 USD, to pay back in 6-12 months. He needs to supply clothes for the next season and raw materials for cookies, because in autumn time there is a large increase in demand for both.

ESPAÑOL

Ante la necesidad de sacar adelante a su familia el Señor Antero M. realiza diversas actividades como fuente de ingreso, entre las cuales podemos mencionar que renta un taxi varias horas al día, y vende ropa y galletas en algunos mercados rodantes en donde le permiten ofrecer sus productos. El esta casado y tiene tres hijos, para la venta de ropa y galletas le ayudan su esposa y su hija.

Esta requiriendo un crédito por $475 USD a pagar en 6-12 meses, para comprar ropa para la próxima temporada, además de poder surtir de materias primas para la elaboración de galletas, para aprovechar que con el otoño la gente solicita mas sus galletas.

loans.use: clothes and raw materials

loans.name: Tailelei

texts.en: Tailelei runs a shop and delivers home-made chips (banana, taro). The shop is open 7 days a week and if it’s a good week the shop earns 200 tala (US$70). After making her loan payments and purchasing goods for her for her canteen, she has her real earning of 120 tala (US$40) weekly. Hard work and willingness to overcome problems and learning from past mistakes has made Talalelei’s business a fruitful one as the years go by.

loans.use: Purchase frying pan, gas stove, 10 sacks of taro, bananas, canned fish, soda

loans.name: Sailua

texts.en: Sailau is a married woman with five children. Her husband is a teacher in their district  primary school. Her husband’s salary was the only income for their family but wasn’t enough to cover their expenses.  Therefore, Sailau joined SPBD to find a means of supplementing the family finances.  She used two small loans to launch her small village store.  Her business is now successful with about USD 200 in sales each week.  This income is crucial to them being able to pay for all of her children’s school fees. She is anxious to expand her shop and is seeking additional loan funds to do so.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand his kiosk and buy more stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in different type of seafood

loans.name: Parvana

texts.en: Parvana Q. is a 41-year-old farmer who raises pomegranates in the southern village Qaranur in the Saatli region of Azerbijan. She lives with her husband and two daughters. She has eleven years of experience in raising pomegranates. She sells pomegranates to the local bazaar traders for pomegranate juice. Pomegranates juice is in very high demand all across Azerbaijan because it has many vitamins and is very healthy. Selling pomegranates is the only one source in her family, Parvana's husband is unemployed. Parvana works very hard because there is high competition in this field. She is going to develop her business and has applied for a loan of 900 USD.

loans.use: Going to develop her business

loans.name: Chikuwa Group

texts.es:
The clients of the ComUnity (the term used by Friendship Bridge for their communal banks) Chikuwa have an astute and patient attitude, a combination that helps them to be the great business women that they currently are. The clients of ComUnity Chikuwa are models of micro-entrepreneurial women.

Several members of the group started selling huipiles (traditional Guatamalan dresses) and shoes in the streets of San Juan la Laguna, Sololá. However, with their current loan many of them have become successful business owners. For example, Susan U. now has ten artisans working for her during the high season such as Christmas. Clara P. is a micro-entrepreneur who began with a small business raising animals and who is now buying 100 chickens per month in order to fatten them and resell them 21 days later. Cecilia U. decided to move into an unexplored field for many micro-entrepreneurs. She has a honey bee business. In addition, she has a windmill that she rents for grinding corn (an essential component for the preparation of corn tortillas).

The loans will be used in different ways. Many women are going to buy thread in order to make huipiles and embroidery. Clara P. is going to use her loan to purchase more chickens, while María M. is going to buy another windmill. María Y. is going to invest her money in her diner. She needs a loan in order to purchase glasses, plates, benches and tables.

María M.’s dream is that her business will prosper so that she will be able to open a hammock store and sell hanging beds in natural colors typical of the region. Elena C. dreams of opening a successful knitting store. In that way she would be able to purchase more work from her providers and thereby have a positive impact on their lives. These business women are very important for Friendship Bridge and Guatemala. They only need some initial help in order to move forward, and you could be the one to give them that aid.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Las clientas de la ComUnidad (término que Friendship Bridge usa para nombrar a un banco comunal) Chikuwa tienen una actitud astuta y paciente, una combinación que las ayuda a ser las grandes empresarias que actualmente son. Las clientas la ComUnidad Chikuwa son ejemplares micro empreasarias.

Varias clientas empezaron vendiendo huipiles (trajes tradicionales de Guatemala) y zapatos en las calles de San Juan la Laguna, Sololá. Sin embargo, con el préstamo recibido ahora muchas de ellas se han vuelto clientas exitosas. Por ejemplo, Susana U. ya tiene diez artesanas trabajando para ella durante las temporadas altas, como Navidad. Clara P., es una empresaria que empezó con un pequeño negocio de crianza de animales y ahora está comprando 100 pollos al mes para engordarlos y revenderlos 21 días después. Cecilia U., decidió incursionar en un campo inexplorado por muchas microempresarias. Ella tiene un negocio de miel de abejas. Además, tienen un molino el cual lo alquila para moler el maíz (componente esencial para la preparación de tortillas de maíz).

Los préstamos van a ser utilizado de distintas maneras. Muchas señoras van a comprar hilos para tejer huipiles y para bordados. Clara P., va a usar su préstamo para comprar más pollos, mientras que María M. va a comprar otro molino. María Y. va ha invertir su crédito en su comedor. Ella necesita el crédito para comprar vasos, platos, bancos y mesas.

El sueño de María M. es que su negocio prospere para que así ella pueda abrir una tienda de hamacas y cubre camas teñidas a base de tintes naturales típicos de la región. Elena C. sueña con abrir una tienda de tejidos exitosa. Como consecuencia ella podría pedir más tejidos a sus proveedoras y causar un impacto importante en la vida de ellas. Estás empresarias son muy importantes para Friendship Bridge y Guatemala, ellas sólo necesitan un apoyo inicial para que puedan destacar, y ese apoyo lo puedes brindar tú.

loans.use: To purchase raw material for making traditional dresses.  Resale of traditional clothing.  Raising of animals.  Expansion of a diner.  The purchase of a windmill for corn.

loans.name: Estela Alexander

texts.es:
Estela Alexander Guzman D. Cubias resides in Ciudad Arce. Her husband works in a clothing factory but the money that he makes is very little to proviD. for the family since they have three small children. Due to this, Estela helps him by selling basic grains such as beans, corn, etc. from the house and also is seeking an alternative income with the commercialization of clothing in small quantities. The requested loan is to buy more basic grains and clothes with the goal of beginning to sell more and generate more income that will help her to realize her dream that she wishes for so badly, which is to proviD. her children with all the necessary things so that they grow up happy in a healthy environment with the best conditions of life.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer.

Estela Alexánder Gúzman D. Cubias, resiD. en Ciudad Arce, su esposo trabaja en una fábrica D. ropa, pero el dinero que gana es muy poco para sostener a la familia ya que tienen 3 hijos pequeños, debido a ello Estela le ayuda vendiendo en la casa granos básicos como frijol, maíz, etc. tambien a buscado como alternativa D. ingresos la comercialización D. ropa en pequeñas cantidades, el prestamo solicitado es para comprar más granos básicos y ropa con el afán D. empezar a vender por mayoreo y generar con ello más ingresos que le ayuden a realizar el sueño que tanto anela que es brindarle a sus hijos todo lo necesario para que crezcan felices en un ambiente sano y con mejores condiciones D. vida..

loans.use: To buy basic grains such as beans, corn and also clothes

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Yeng

texts.en: Mrs. Yeng, 46, has seven children, four boys and two girls. She was married in 1985. She and her husband, Keom Hoeurn, are farmers. They grow papaya, corn and tomatoes, while their two daughters work in the garment factory and the sons are studying. They live in Koh Auknhathey by the Mekong River. Neither finished primary school; however, they are friendly and very polite. She and her husband are requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the sixth time, this time in the amount of $1,000 to pay the land rental fee and buy seed and fertilizer.

loans.use: To pay the land rental fee and buy seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Emigdio

texts.en:
Emigdio S. is a 55-year-old husband and father of two. One of his sons is in college, while the other was able to graduate from college and is now successful in the working world. Emigdio did not have the opportunity that he has given his sons, so without a higher degree, he began his own business.

His business is selling bedding, sheets, blankets, and quilts, along with hammocks. The hammock is a typical product of this area. Emigdio will invest the loan in more products for his store, because he knows that variety of products will make his business more competitive.

loans.use: To buy sheets, blankets, quilts, and other bedding.

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Mrs. Maura is 53 years old and lives in Villa Reconciliacion with some of her 5 children (all of them independent adults). She supports herself, thankfully, due to profits from her general store that she's run for the past 9 years. Besides general food staples, she sells personal products, clothing, costmetics and jewelry. This provides her with enough to get by ( besides what she receives from her children). She is now requesting a loan to purchase costmetics and jewelry to supplement her store's inventory and meet the requests of her clients, which in the past she has been unable to meet.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Maura tiene 53 años vive en Villa Reconciliación y actualmente vive sola con algunos de sus 5 hijos ya todos adultos e independientes. Se mantiene gracias a una Pulpería que monto hace 9 años en la que además de granos básicos y productos higiénicos vende también ropa, cosméticos y joyas, con esto se sustenta así como del apoyo que recibe de sus hijos. Solicita un crédito para comprar cosméticos y joyas, la cual tiene con escasez de inventario y sus clientes demandan productos que no ha podido adquirir, este crédito la ayudara a subir sus ventas y satisfacer las demandas y necesidades de sus clientes.

loans.use: To purchase products to supplement the inventory of her general store. (Comprar insumos para abastecer su pulpería)

loans.name: Marqueza 3 Group

texts.es:
Josefa G. Espinosa is 22 years old, has three children and belongs to the “Marqueza 3” group along with Delma P. M., who sells plasticware, and Yeri De Jesus M. P., who sells perfumes and cosmetics. Josefa has dedicated herself to selling plasticware for the past two years, offering her customers cups, plates and other plastic items in different colors and sizes. She acquires her supplies in the town of Tuxtla Gutierrez, located two hours from her home. She installed her business in her home and she has thus been able not to neglect household chores and help pay the bills. With the loan, she will purchase more plasticware in order to offer her clients new products.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

JOSEFA G. ESPINOSA TIENE 22 AÑOS, TRES HIJOS Y PERTENECE AL GRUPO SOLIDARIO LLAMADO MARQUEZA 3 JUNTO CON DOÑA DELMA P. M. (VENTA DE TRASTES DE PLASTICO) Y DOÑA YERI DE JESUS M. P. (VENTA DE COSMETICOS Y PERFUMES). DOÑA JOSEFA SE DEDICA DESDE HACE DOS AÑOS A LA VENTA DE TRASTES DE PLASCTICO, OFRECE A SU CLIENTELA VASOS, PLATOS, Y PLASTICOS EN DIFERENTES FORMAS, TAMAÑOS Y COLORES. SU MERCANCIA LO ADQUIERE EN TUXTLA GUTIERREZ UBICADO A DOS HORAS DE SU LOCALIDAD. SU NEGOCIO LO TIENE INSTALADO EN SU CASA Y DE ESTA FORMA NO DESATIENDE SU HOGAR Y OPOYA CON EL GASTO FAMILIAR. CON SU PRESTAMO INVERTIRA EN LA COMPRA DE MAS TRASTES PARA OFRECER A SUS CLIENTES NUEVOS PRODUCTOS.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of plasticware / INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE TRASTES DE PLASTICO

loans.name: Salomey

texts.fr:
Salomey K. is 51 years old, married, and the mother of six children; two of them are in school, one is married and expecting a child, and two are apprentices. School and apprenticeship fees increase each year, and Salomey is responsible for the household expenses of her children. To earn money, she runs a business in her house preparing and selling dried red chili peppers. She wishes to use this loan to buy more fresh peppers to dry and also to help pay the two men who help her prepare them. With the profits she will earn from her sales, she will be able to cover her family's needs.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame Salomey K. est âgée de 51 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. 2 des enfants sont à l’école, 1 est épousée et enceinte et 2 sont les apprentis. Les frais scolaires et les frais d’apprentissage augmentent chaque année et Salomey est responsable des charges du foyer pour ses enfants. Pour gagner de l’argent, elle opère un commerce à sa maison de préparer et vendre les piments rouges séchés. Elle souhaite avec ce crédit d’acheter plus des piments fraîches pour secher et aussi de lui aider à payer les 2 hommes qui l’aident en leur preparation. Avec les profits qu’elle va dégager de ses ventes elle sera capable de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy fresh chili peppers to dry

loans.name: Luy

texts.en:
Luy L., 33, is a mother of one young child and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She has a business selling groceries in the local market and normally earns around $2 profit each day. Her husband owns a big stand in a market, selling a variety of fishes, typically making $25 a day in revenue. Fresh fish, tasty and affordable, is a favorite food among Cambodian people.

Mrs. Luy would like to apply for a loan to invest into her husband's business and to renovate their house. She hopes her husband will be able to expand his business and earn more income for their family. She also hopes that renovation of their house will make it more stable and able to withstand the rainy season.

Mrs. Luy and her daughter are pictured above in front of her grocery store.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services throughout both rural and urban communities in Cambodia.

loans.use: To purchase more fish and renovate the house.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonardo is a married 44-year-old mother of four children. She has a small restaurant in a rented location. She prepares various menus that she sells during the afternoon. Her usual customers are neighbors of the restaurant, and on Sundays she prepares traditional food. Her spouse also has a car repair shop in their house, though they will be moving. Leonarda will have the restaurant in their house because she believes she will be able to provide better service to her customers there. Furthermore, Leonarda travels to regional fairs where she buys cereals that she then resells at a market near her home.

Leonarda is a member of the Florecer Village Bank. She needs a loan of 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (US$ 375) to invest in various resources to restock in her business.

Leonarda’s dream is to expand her business, to have a large restaurant, to improve her home, and that her children become professionals.

loans.use: to invest in various resources to restock in her business

loans.name: Peang

texts.en: Mrs. Peang S., a 53-year-old widow with a child employed in a garment factory, is a fruit seller in the local market in Lvea Sor Leu Village in Kandal Province. She previously obtained a loan to start her current business and has since fully repaid it. Because her business is doing well, Mrs. Peang S.  is now requesting a loan to buy more fruit to resell.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to resell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret T. is 30 years old. She is married and has two children who are currently in school. Margaret has sold frozen foods, dried fish, and smoked fish for the past seven years in the local market but she says her income is very low because she pays high rent on the store she operates from. She wants to use the loan to buy more cartons of frozen foods to enable her to raise enough income to build a permanent store for herself. She is a member of the group called Isaiah. Members in this group agree to guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy cartons of frozen foods like fresh fish, dried fish etc

loans.name: In

texts.en:
Mrs. In C. is a villager in Suong Keit Village in the Kampong Cham Province. She and her husband, Mr. Sieb Tom, are farmers. They have a problem with their fields because their soil is not fertile. To deal with this problem, Mrs. In C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to make the crop more productive.

She is 35-years-old and the mother four children. One child is a fisherman while another paints cars. The second youngest child is attending the local school while the youngest, age five, stays at home. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support the soil and increase crop production.

loans.name: Wilber Fernando

texts.es: El Sr. Wilmer tiene 27 años de edad, casado y con dos hijos que su esposa le tiene de 6 y10 años de edad, los cuales están cursando la primaria en el colegio del barrio de los Laureles Sur, don Wilmer vende contratos ópticos visuales con su esposa desde hace seis años pues es un trabajo que lo hacia ante con su hermana la cual lo oriento para que iniciara solo y pudiera tener sus propias ganancias, viaja en autobús al lado del norte de Nicaragua a mas de 120 kilómetros a lugares de alto riesgos por que la gente no circula mucho, ya que son personas de la montaña Oh lugares largo de la ciudad,  pero para poder obtener clientela y sus venta lo hace, con la solicitud que hace es para comprar aros y lentes para vender mas y ofertar a sus clientela, pues con esta inversión espera obtener expectativas positivas.  A largo plazo es hacer mejoras a su vivienda, educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Wilmer is 27 years old, married, with two children ages 6 and 10 who study in the Laureles Sur neighborhood primary school. For six years Wilmer has sold optical contacts with his wife. He initially worked with his sister, who started him in this business and encouraged him to become independent and generate his own earnings. He travels by bus to the north side of Nicaragua, more than 120 kilometers to high-risk places because there aren’t many people who travel to the people who live in the mountains or other places far from the city. But in order to gain customers and sales he makes the trips. With the loan he plans to buy frames and lenses to sell and offer to his customers, with this investment he hopes to obtain positive expectations. In the long term he plans to make improvements to his home and educate his children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy frames and lenses

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia tiene 45 años de edad, es madre de cuatro hijos que están estudiando, vive con su esposo, quien la apoya en todo. Se dedica al arte textil, lo viene haciendo desde hace ocho años atrás, confecciona prendas para adultos, como también trabaja para algunas instituciones que requieren de sus buenos servicios y le hacen diferentes pedidos, como uniformes, etc. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es conocer mucha gente con quienes comparte muchos diálogos y debido a que cuenta con muchos clientes fieles que recurren a ella desde que se inició en el negocio, le va muy bien. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado ser responsable con sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita mandará a construir su taller textil, también quiere comprar materiales como telas, hilos, agujas, entre otros, para la confección de sus prendas.
texts.en:
Alicia is 45 years old, the mother of four children who are in school, and lives with her husband who supports her in everything. She dedicates herself to textile arts, which she has been doing for eight years. She creates clothing for adults, and also works for some companies who require her excellent services and order different items from her such as uniforms, etc. What she likes about her work is getting to know many people with whom she can dialogue and, because she enjoys repeat business from many loyal customers, things are going very well for her. This is her third loan with MFP, and she has demonstrated herself to be responsible with her payments. With the funds she is requesting, she will start the construction on her textile workshop. She also wants to buy materials such as fabrics, threads, needles, and other items for making her garments.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build her textile workshop and purchase sewing supplies.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en: Mrs. Sun K. was born in 1981 and now lives in the Toek Lorng Village in the Kampong Speu Province. She has a piece of land to cultivate rice in order to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Yun Yorn, is a palm juice collector who gathers juice to process into palm sugar. In this business, he faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to buy bamboo to tie to the palm trees to climb up to gather the juice. Thus, his wife decided to ask for a loan to buy the bamboo needed for her husband's business. Mrs. Sun K. is 27 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is only five years old. Her husband is presented on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy bamboo for her husband's (palm juice collecting) business

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en: Tatu A. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur and a married woman. She runs a café at Mbagala ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases some of her business items from Kariakoo city market, and others from Mbagala market in Dar es Salaam. Her customers mostly come from Mbagala market. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 600,000 to meet her customers' demand.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Salustiana

texts.es:
La  Sra.  Salustina tiene 48 años de edad  es madre soltera con dos hijos uno ya mayor de edad  y otro en edad escolar.   

	 Esta señora es muy emprendedora, teje frazadas y manteles artesanales y ella misma se encarga de venderlos a cuotas en la localidad de Capiata en donde viaja cada mes a colocar y cobrar sus productos, gracias  a su trabajo y esfuerzo pudo brindarles a sus hijos todas las comodidades y a la vez hacerle estudiar. 

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hilos y color para tejer hamacas que en ésta temporada lo solicitan mucho sus clientes.
texts.en:
Salustina is 48 years old. She is a single mother with two children: one is of age and the other is still in school. This is a very enterprising woman: she weaves blankets and sells them herself in installments in Capiata where she travels every month to work and charge for her products. Thanks to her work and efforts she has been able to give her children all the comforts as well as pay their tuition. She is asking for this loan to buy thread and colour to weave hammocks which are in high demand at this time.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make bedspreads.

loans.name: Esrarullhaq

texts.en:
Esrarullhaq, son of Y. M., is 24 years old, single and lives with his family in a household of eight members in the Nangrahar province. Esrar has been working as a farmer, growing vegetables for the last several years in his village, but he studies up to six classes in the police in Jalalabad city.

Esrar is the only one to support the whole household.  Also in his spare time he helps his small brother who goes to school. Esrar dreams of his brother studying for his higher education and so he wants to increase his income to help.
  
Esrar needs a 50000 AF loan for buying some seeds and other essentials for his land. He is very thankful to get a loan from AFS as he could not get the money anywhere else and is very happy to be able to follow his dreams.

loans.use: Buying seeds for his land to grow more vegetables

loans.name: Jeanilyn

texts.en:
Jeanilyn S. is managing a small parcel of land. She grows rice to feed and clothe her family. She is 32 years old and has 3 small children. She is looking for possible ways to help her husband, Ronilo S., sustain their farm business. Farming is their only source of income. They want to make their farm prosper to meet the needs of their family.

Jeanilyn is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides. Fertilizers will help enrich the soil while the pesticides will prevent harmful insects from inflicting damage and disease on her rice. The loan will definitely help her achieve a better harvest for her whole family.

CEVI is a non-profit organization and a partner of WorldVision Philippines. CEVI helps people, especially the poor, to start up and own their own businesses. CEVI is reaching out to more farmers like Jeanilyn to help sustain their livelihood. They provide not only credit assistance, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Pura

texts.en: Pura  L. is 60 years old, married and the mother of six children, all of whom are married. She lives with her family in Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City, Philippines. Her husband is a hard-working farmer who occasionally helps his wife run her banana-selling business. Pura thinks that the money she earns is not enough to meet their needs, and has decided to take out a loan to expand her business and increase her income. She hopes to earn enough money to help pay for expenses like electricity. Pura extends her hearfelt gratitude to the lenders who support her request for more funding.

loans.use: To expand a banana-selling business

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Thach's Group

texts.en:
Thạch Thị Hoàng (No: 010117060018) was born in 1958. Her husband is a farmer. They have a son who is married and now they are living with him. Her family has a gas shop. They have a monthly income of about 3,500,000 VND.

This is her first microfinance loan. She wants to borrow 1,972,000 VND (approximately $115) to buy gas to sell.

There are two other fund participants in her group:

Suốt Thị Đỗ (No: 010117060016) was born in 1951. She wants to borrow 1,972,000 VND (approximately $115) to buy goods to sell.

Bích Thị Tạ (No: 010117060017) was born in 1962. She wants to borrow 2,436,000 VND (approximately $145) to invest in her confectionery business.

loans.use: To buy gasoline to sell

loans.name: Mériga

texts.fr: Cette dame exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de charbons de bois, elle a associé à ce commerce la vente de tubercules. Elle a débuté ce commerce en 1974, ce qui fait qu’elle a une maîtrise de la gestion de ce commerce. Elle s’approvisionne au nord du Togo plus précisément dans la ville de Badou. Une partie de son stock est épuisé, voulant le rehausser, elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 15 sacs de charbons de bois et 10 tas d’ignames.
texts.en:
This is a lady who earns an income from commerce in charcoal. She has included along with it the sale of tubers. She started this business in 1974, which means she has a command of this commerce. She stocks up in northern Togo, in the city of Badou to be precise. A portion of her inventory is exhausted. Wanting to replenish it, she's requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy fifteen sacks of charcoal and ten tubs of yams.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal and some yams

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk for her business.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica D. F. is 33 years old and is married with six children, all of school age. She lives in Camanga Village, Tukuran, Zambonaga Del Sur.

Jessica has been in agriculture for almost four years. She joined Paglaum MPC last year with a previous loan of PHP 5,000. She is now in her 3rd loan with a loan amount of PHP 5,000 which will be used as additional capital to buy garden fertilizer. She deeply wishes to have a good harvest and hopes to live a good life ahead.

loans.use: To buy garden fertilizer

loans.name: Ahobrasie Group

texts.en:
Kwame works very hard to bring food and joy to his family. He sells engine oil, kerosene and grease. He has been in business for the last eight years. He supplies villages where there is no hydroelectric power. He is 37 years old, married and the father of three children. All his children are currently in school. Kwame has purchased a portion of land to build a house. He requests a loan to buy engine oil, grease and kerosene, etc. in bulk. With this loan, he believes he can save enough money to support his children in school.

Kwame is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Ahobrasie’ which literally means ‘Humility’. He is the one sitting in front of the group in the photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and there is peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy engine oil, grease, kerosene, etc.

loans.name: Tafaimaa

texts.en:
Tafaimaa V. is 47 years old and lives in the town of Fasitoo Tai. She is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Tafaimaa makes and sells fried foods in the local community. Tafaimaa has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 300 WST a month.

In 2009, Tafaimaa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. She wished to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Tafaimaa is requesting a loan of 1,000 WST, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make fried food products for sale. The loan will be her first taken out from SPBD. Tafaimaa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive, and self-esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make fried food products for sale

loans.name: Mor

texts.en:
Mor S., age 35, is married and has three children. She lives with her husband and children in Takeo province. She is involved in a business manufacturing Cambodian traditional cakes, earning approximately US $8 per day. Her husband is engaged in a business of collecting coconuts from villages to sell in the town, earning an income of US $6.60 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, S. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, S. is seeking to increase her income. She is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase a motorbike and trailer for her son to operate a business like his father. By doing so, she hopes she will be able to generate more income and save more money to raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: buy a motorbike and its trailer

loans.name: Mari

texts.es:
La señora Mari, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Claveles”, Distrito de Picota, Provincia de Picota, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 44 años y 02 hijos, 01 que aun dependen de ella y son la razón por a cual se esfuerza día a día. 

Mari, es una mujer muy trabajadora y no dudo en implementar su propio taller de costura, en un local muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa, lleva 05 años dedicándose a la Confección de Vestidos, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños. Esta muy contenta, con el trabajo que realiza y así genera sus propios ingresos para aportar en su hogar, también se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y los realiza en los días que no se encuentra ocupada.

En la actualidad continua con sus confecciones de vestidos y tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden a su casa para realizar sus trabajos y pedidos, es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con la amabilidad que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes géneros, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza, así mantener satisfechos a sus clientes.

Mari, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Sra. Mari is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Claveles” (The Carnations), which is located in the District of Picota, Picota Province, Department of San Martín. She is 44 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 2 children (1 is still a dependent). Her children are the reason why she invests so much effort day after day.

Mari is a very hardworking woman and did not hesitate to start her own dressmaking shop out of her home. For 5 years, she has been making clothes for women, men and children. She is very happy with her work and being able to generate her own income from home. In addition, she sells cosmetics on the days when she is not busy.

Mari continues to make clothing and her loyal customers come by her house every day to either place or pick up their orders. She personally attends to her customers with kindness.

With this loan of 500 soles, Mari will buy meters of fabric in different styles, scissors, regular and sewing machine needles, pins, and buttons. Some of the money will be used to buy beauty products so that she can keep her customers happy.

Mari is proud of what she has accomplished, and continues to have the desire to achieve and fulfill her other dreams. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and supporting other women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sewing materials & cosmetics

loans.name: Los Alcones Group

texts.es:
El grupo los Alcones está conformado por Henry R. B. de 25 años, el inicio en el negocio del carnicería desde

muy temprana edad con su mamá y actualmente tiene  su propia carnicería en el mercado oriental la cual desea en futuro

no muy lejano ampliarlo.


Los otros integrantes son Noel Gutierrez de 28 años quien es agricultor, este año sembró y cosecho frijoles, arroz, 

maíz y trigo que vendió en el mercado de Masaya. Mientras Francisco Javier P. de 28 años tiene una pequeña 

carnicería en el mercado oriental.
texts.en:
The “Alcones” group was formed by Henry R. B., who is 25-years-old. He began a butcher shop at a very young age with his mother and now has his own butcher shop in the Oriental Market which he wants to expand in the not-too-distant future. The other members of the group are Noel Gutierrez, 28, and Francisco Javier P., 28. Noel is a farmer and this year he planted and harvested beans, rice, corn, and wheat and sold it at a market in Masaya. Francisco Javier has a small butcher shop in the Oriental Market.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy beef and seeds for planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: AUMENTO DE CAPITAL

loans.name: Idalia Margarita

texts.es:
la señora Idalia Margarita G. R. tiene 33 años de edad, es soltera y tiene tres hijos que estudian  y dependen de ella a un 100%, vive en la colonia obrera de la ciudad de San Lorenzo.
Idalia se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de ropa, calzado y cameras, las vende al por mayor y al detalle, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 7 años y esta solicitando el prestamo para comprar ropa como ser jeans, faldas, zapatos y tenis para damas y caballeros. 
Idalia desea abastecerce de prodcuto para la epoca navideña que empieza el otro mes. 
su deseo es hacer crecer su negocio y que sus ventas mejoren para tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Idalia Margarita G. R. is 33 years old, is single and has three children in school who depend on her 100%. She lives in a working class neighborhood of San Lorenzo. Idalia buys and sells clothes, shoes and cameras. She sells them on a wholesale and retail basis. For the last 7 years she has been in this business. She is requesting a loan to buy clothing such as jeans, skirts, shoes and sneakers for women and men. Idalia would like to purchase the new supplies for the Christmas season that begins in a month. Her dream is to grow her business and improve sales so that she can achieve a better quality of life for herself and her children.
