Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of shoes and clothing for men and women

loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario santa maria esta ubicado en el barrio que lleva su mismo nombre, esta integrado por tres miembros todos vecinos de la comunidad de nacaome, valle, estos señores son comerciantes, desde hace mucho tiempo se conocen muy bien, a continuacion se detalla las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:

la señora Alcida A. tiene 39 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Luis Alonzo Lopez quien labora como motorista, la señora A. se dedica a la costura confecciona vestidos, pantalones, faldas, blusas esta solicitando el credito para comprar telas, botones, hilos.
 
la señora Maria de la Paz F. García tiene 35 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Santos Javier García el trabaja en una panaderia y ella se dedica a vender en la pulperia y elaborar y vender tortillas a los vecinos de la comunidad, su pulperia la tiene desde hace 05 años esta solicitando el crediito para surtir mas su negocio.
 
el señor Santos Roberto A. tiene 25 años de edad, es casado con la señora Nixia Yolani F. Bustillo ella es ama de casa, el se dedica a la compra venta de frutas de temporada la trae en el carro de su primo viaja a comayagua, montelibano y otros lugares donde compra las frutas. Las vende en el mercado de nacaome en barrios y colonias de esta ciudad. esta actividad la realiza
hace unos 06 años, esta solicitando el credito para compra de dos pailas de naranjas.
texts.en:
The Santa María Communal Bank is located in the neighborhood of the same name. It is comprised of three members, who are all neighbors in the Nacaome Valle community. They are business people. They have known each other very well for a long time. Following are details about their different activities. Alcida A. is 39. She is married to Luis Alonzo Lopez, who works as a driver. Mrs. A. is a seamstress. She makes dresses, pants, skirts, and blouses. She is asking for the loan to buy fabric, buttons, and thread. María de la Paz F. García is 35. She is in a common law marriage with Santos Javier García, who works in a bakery. She sells in the mini-market. She makes and sells tortilla to the neighbors in the community. She has had the mini-market for five years. She is asking for the loan to further stock her store. Roberto A. is 25. He is married to Nixia Yolani F. Bustillo, who is a housewife. He buys and sells seasonal fruit. He carries them in his cousin’s car. He travels to Comayagua, Monelibano, and other places to buy the fruit. He sells them in the Nacaome market, in neighborhoods, and in suburbs of this city. He has been doing this for six years. The loan is to buy two large containers of oranges.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruit, corn, wood, water, limes, pastas, soft drinks, rice, beans, bread, crackers, sardines, juice, milk, sausage, ham, cheese, preserves, fabric, and needles

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario G., 60 years old, is a widow who lives with her four children in Tartaria, Silang, Cavite.

She buys and sells ready-made curtains for walls, windows, and doors. She also sells hand-painted wall calendars.  Rosario earns P5, 000.00 a month, more or less.  Her income varies day-to-day because she has no regular clients.  Her profits provide for her family’s daily basic needs.   

Joining the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative has made Rosario a lot of new friends.  She is in need of a fresh loan in the amount of P13, 000.00 as additional capital for her curtain business.  This would be her tenth loan cycle.  


About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: For additional capital for her curtain/hand-painted calendars business

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia B. is from the village of Paddad, Alicia, Isabela. She is 54 years old and is widowed with five adult children. To make a living, Aurelia owns and operates a business selling vegetables and eggs in the local community. Aurelia has been engaged in her business for more than seven years and earns approximately 680 daily.

In 2008, Aurelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aurelia is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used purchase some hogs to raise. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Aurelia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase hogs to raise

loans.name: Romy

texts.en: Mr. Romy D. is a farmer. He is 33 years old, married and has three children. The oldest of his children is only 11 years old. He works hard for his family, especially his children’s education. He wants all of them to someday finish school and find a decent job for themselves. As a farmer, hard work is required at the farm. He makes sure to keep himself healthy and strong so he can do his duties and earn an income for his family. He thanks God for another opportunity that he could plant rice on his farm again. He is now preparing for planting. He will need farm inputs like seeds, fertilizers and others. He applied for a loan of Php15, 000 from CEVI. He will use this loan to finance his farm.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa M. is from the village of Lumapas Bonifacio Misamis Occ.. She is 27 years old. Melissa is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Melissa owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fish    in the local community. Melissa has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Melissa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melissa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Melissa is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Melissa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy stock in bulk

loans.name: Pith's Group

texts.en:
This group loan is comprised of four people who all live in Preaek Louk village in Kandal province. Mr. Pith S. is the group leader who has been selected by all the members; they will use their loans for different purposes. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice on to support his family, and his wife, Mrs. Preak Boung, is a housewife.

This family has some problems because their house is dark at night and it does not have fresh water to use. Thus, Mr. Pith S. decided to ask for a loan to buy electricity supplies. He would like to buy a hose to provide water for his house with the remainder of the loan. He is a father of five children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory, while the others are attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy electricity supplies and a hose for water

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy W. M. is thirty-five years old, married, and has three children aged between sixteen and eight years old. Her business is located at Lang'ta, Nairobi near a chief's canteen. She has been selling food, e.g., pilau (rice), posho (maize meal), chicken, tea, soft drinks, and other items for the last four years to the local people. 

Nancy says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is power fluctuations, reducing quality service delivery. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes. 50,000 to buy fruit, a blender and a microwave to expand her business. She hopes to grow hier restaurant to a big hotel in future. She is very hard-working, honest, reliable and trustworthy.

loans.use: Microwave, blender, fruit

loans.name: San Antonio Poty Group

texts.es:
El comité San Antonio Poty se conformó gracias a las ganas de salir adelante de todas las integrante quienes se acercaron a una de las asesoras de la Fundación cuando se enteraron de Programa, logró juntar a 18 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy satifechas  ya en el 4° ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.

Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya.
Es un grupo muy activo y el trabajo solidario se nota en cada una de sus integrantes, ya todas ellas a parte de ser compañeras en el Comité son muy buenas amigas.
Una de ellas  es la señora Lourdes M. quien se dedica a la venta de ropas en su domicilio y también en forma ambulante, ella se sacrifica mucho para salir adelante con su familia, trabaja de muchas forma ya que su deseo es que sus hijos salgan adelante con una buena educación y una mejor calidad de vida.
El crédito solicitado fue para la compra de prendas de vestir en general y especialmente para la compra de uniformes escolares ya comienzan la época escolar y hay mucha demanda de uniformes para los estudiante, y ella desea aprovechar esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
The committee San Antonio Poty was formed thanks to the the members' desire to get ahead in life. They approached one of the Paraguya Foundation's advisers when they found out about the program. The group includes 18 women, who are very satisfied with their work. The group is now in its fourth loan cycle and works as a whole and supportive team within the program. All of the women work to make money. They help each other to achieve the common goals they share as a group and with the Paraguaya Foundation. This is a very active group and their supportive work is evident in each and every one of its members. Aside from being members of the same committee, all the women are very good friends. One of the members is Lourdes Marciel. She sells clothes from her home and on the street. She has sacrificed a lot to help her family get ahead in life. She works a lot because her dream is that her children move forward with a good education and a better quality of life. The requested loan is for buying general clothing as well school uniforms. Since the school year has already started and there is high demand for uniforms, Lourdes wants to take advantage of this timely opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clothes and school uniforms to sell

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Luzviminda A. is from the village of Tambagan, Gingoog City. She is 40 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Luzviminda owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Luzviminda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Luzviminda is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 5th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of kola nuts

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim, 50, lives in Lahore, known as the heart of Pakistan, with her husband and five daughters in a small two-room house. Her husband works in Marriage Hall as a cleaner, but his income is not sufficient to maintain the family. She also worries about her daughters’ marriages. 

Therefore, a few years ago Shamim started her business of cloth selling, an enterprise she has steadily expanded into the cloth market, where she obtains orders and travels to various cities to purchase embroidered dresses such as Multan and Faisalabad.
She purchases clothes from these cities because of their cheap rates and good designs. 

Shamim earns from Pak Rs. 10,000 to 15,000 on a monthly basis but earns more on occasions such as Eid  and marriage functions. She lives with a dream of someday opening her own boutique where she can sell embroidered dresses and get the full profits of selling.  Shamim is now requesting a loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan and a partner of Kiva) to purchase more dresses to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase embroidered dresses to sell

loans.name: Divina

texts.en: Divina R. is from Barangay Paniki, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 40 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Divina owns and operates a business raising chickens for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Divina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase chicks to raise and sell. Divina is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to expand the shelter used for her chickens. This loan will be her seventh from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the shelter used for her chickens

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita B. is from the village of San Manuel, Naguilian, Isabela. She is 63 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Nenita owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling vegetables in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. In 2008, Nenita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Nenita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fifth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Bonny

texts.en:
In the small township of Bundibugyo, Uganda lives a young man who goes by the name of Bonny. He is 25 years old, married with one child aged one year. He is the breadwinner for his small and young family. Like many Ugandans, he dreams of seeing his children educated to university level. 

Bonny operates a retail shop and has been in the business for the last two years having first been involved in the motorcycle transport business. He also wants to transform his small shop into a wholesale one in the future. This is Bonny’s first loan from HOFOKAM and he intends to purchase cell phone air time, soap, and boxes of biscuits to sell.

loans.use: Purchase air time, soap, boxes of biscuits to sell

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is the 27-year-old father of a two-year-old child. He sells charcoal to earn a living. He was previously employed and decided to venture into business so as to earn a better income.

Boniface has engaged in his charcoal selling business for four years and hopes to expand the business into a wholesale operation in the future. He has requested for 20,000 KES to add to his stock of charcoal.

loans.use: To add to his stock of charcoal

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is married with six children, and all her children go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members.  She owns a stall  at her home in Bwaise, selling bananas and charcoal. She buys bunches of bananas from delivery vans which get them from villages of Masaka.  She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas and bags of charcoal. 

Farida first dealt only in bananas but with  additional loans from MCDT, she started investing in charcoal.    She works in a semi-urban area of Bwaise in Kawempe Division, Kampala district. She has been in this banana business for over six years.    Besides this banana business she has rental rooms. 

Farida works seven days a week.  Her business challenges are thieves and seasonality.   She is aspiring of seeing her business grow big and starting going to farmers in Masaka district. She decided to work with MCDT because she wanted additional capital.  Farida resides in and owns a two-roomed house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water.   Her monthly expenses includes food and school fees

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas and bags of charcoal

loans.name: Bellaflor

texts.en:
Bellaflor L. is from the village of Brgy. Salamague, Lamut, Ifugao. She is 42 and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Bellaflor owns & operates a business providing plumbing repairs. Bellaflor has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Bellaflor joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the first loan taken out by Bellaflor from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita C. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 50 years old. Merlita is married and has seven children. Her older children are adults now and help her at the farm, while her younger ones still go to school. To make a living, Merlita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Merlita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years.

Merlita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Merlita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Nahashon Njoroge

texts.en:
Nahashon is 26 years old and he has been transporting people and goods from one place to the other using his bicycle in Naivasha town for the last two years.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He repaid his first loan of Kshs 18,500 well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan to buy another bicycle which is enhanced with an engine.  He will employ someone else to operate it for him.

Nahashon hopes to grow in the transportation business by owning his own fleet of mini-buses.

loans.use: To buy another bicycle enhanced with an engine

loans.name: Mariana Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Mariana Del Socorro, tiene 60 años es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos, pero solamente 1 está a su cargo. Ella se dedica a una pulpería  sus compras las realiza en el mercado y algunas veces los camiones llegan a dejarle los productos.  Ella dio inicio con este negocio desde hace 2 años, ante la gran necesidad que tenia ya que necesitaba empezar a pensar en su futuro. Ella por supuesto, desea seguir continuando con su negocio, es por eso que cada día se levanta con mucho entusiasmo para atender a sus clientes. El crédito será invertido en la compra de golosinas, refrescos, detergentes y granos básicos. Su deseo es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda que son muy necesarias.
texts.en: Mrs. Mariana Del Socorro is 60 years old, is a single mother and has 2 children but only 1 is under her care. She has a general store, she buys her products in the market and sometimes trucks come in to leave her merchandise. She started this business 2 years ago since she needed to think about her future. She wants to keep her business and each day she gets up with a lot of enthusiasm to take care of her customers. The loan will be used to buy candy, refreshments, detergents and basic grains. Her wish is to improve her home since it is necessary.

loans.use: Work capital.

loans.name: Knowledge Resource Center-Bushenyi Group

texts.en:
Hard working A. Joan, age 32, is a married mother of four kids between 14 and 6 years old. She has been operating a retail shop selling general products for home use from Nyakabirizi trading centre in Bushenyi. She started this business seven years ago upon realizing the ready market in the area and at the end of every week she is able to pocket profits to the tune of 40,000 Ugandan shillings. 

Her main challenge has been not having enough stock in her business to match the purchasing rate of the customers. She is therefore seeking a loan that she says will help her stock more general merchandise retail goods to satisfy the customers’ high demand and transform her enterprise into a big enterprise.
 
Being very committed to the business with good customer care, she hopes to increase her sales revenue. This will bring about a transformation in her business as she hopes to build a family house, achieve a self-sustaining life and take care of her children’s education expenses. She belongs to the Knowledge Resource Center Group-Bushenyi.

loans.use: To buy more stock for resale

loans.name: Chanda

texts.en:
This is 28 year-old Chanda B..  She is married and has 2 children aged 9 and 3.  In 2000, she established  her cow's milk selling business.  Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buys a young cow.  In the future, Chanda plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal.  Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made.  Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking.  On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day.  In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50.  In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks.  The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.  

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:
 BPW Partner Page     Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team"

loans.use: to buy a young milk producing cow

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 25 years old and in business. She runs a grocery store in a good business area where she sells kales, spinach, carrots, bananas, among other food products.  She is requesting a loan of Kes. 10,000 to purchase stock items such as carrots, kales and spinach. 

Janeth is a single mother of one child who goes to school. She was previously employed in a pharmacy before she started her own business. Janeth says she is determined to change her life.

loans.use: To purchase food for resale

loans.name: Biyogo

texts.en:
Biyogo, a 48-year-old married father of six children, five of whom are students, does mixed farming in his hometown of Kisii in Western Kenya. He produces tea, milk, beans and maize, all sold within the local market.

Biyogo has requested this loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow, hopeful that the loan will help uplift the family financially with its gains. He aspires to have three dairy cows in five years. Biyogo's major problem is limited finances for the purchase of farm inputs such as fertilizers and pesticides for animal sprays.

He remains grateful for Juhudi's loan services.

loans.use: The purchase and insurance of a dairy cow

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en: Phalla V. is a 21-year-old man, and married to Mim Channa, age 26, who is a local farmer in Phnom Penh City of Cambodia. This couple has given birth to two children,and two of whom are single. Phalla V. could earn a living by planting various crops on his own farmland which come from his grandparent. Phalla V. presently plants different kinds of vegetables, which he will harvest when they are mature. Unfortunately, his crop is not growing well because his farm is outside of a watering system. So that Phalla V. would like a loan to purchase a machine that he uses to pump water for his crops.

loans.use: To purchase a machine that he uses to pump water for his crops.

loans.name: G.s. Nagarote Group

texts.es: Patricia Isabel Dolores y Laura conforman el Grupo Solidario Nagarote ellas tienen mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000, pues no es la primera vez que realizan financiamiento. Ellas han depositado mucho empeño y dedicación en sus negocios, ambas tienen diferentes actividades económicas, y las experiencias le han enseñado a mejorar cada día. El motivo por el cual se han unido es para solicitar un financiamiento para mejorar sus negocios en esta buena temporada festiva.
texts.en: Patricia, Isabel, Dolores and Laura are the members of the Nagarote community bank.  They have worked with Fundacion Leon 2000 for a while so this isn't their first loan.  The women have committed a lot of time and effort to their respective businesses.  The businesses are different from one another, but their owners have learned over time how to make them better and better.  They are applying for this loan to prepare their businesses for the upcoming holidays.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Suvderdene

texts.en: Suvderdene A. is 29 years old and lives with her husband and three daughters in the Yaarmag of Han-Uul district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband currently works in a train station, her eldest daughter attends secondary school and her youngest two daughters are both in kindergarten. Suvderdene operates a hair salon in a rented space in her district. She started the hair and beauty salon in 2009 and has developed her business in a short time with many clients. She graduated from a vocational training course with a professional certificate. In addition, she operates a dance and calisthenics service to supplement her earnings. For the future, she hopes to expand both of her businesses. Suvderdene is a very kind and hardworking woman. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase necessary supplies and materials such as hair cream, face cream, makeup, towels etc. and to make repairs to her dancing hall workspace.

loans.use: to purchase necessary supplies and materials

loans.name: Adys Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama ADYS,  porque la hija de la señora que formo el grupo se llama Adriana y creen que ese nombre les traerá suerte al grupo, asi como le trajo bendiciones a su madre con su nacimiento. Este grupo se localiza en Tlaxcala, México; en una comunidad rural netamente Agricola, la mayoria de los habitantes de esa comunidad se dedican a la agricultura y además trabajan en las empresas localizadas en zonas industriales cercanas a la comunidad. Este grupo está integrado por 11 Mujeres trabajadoras, cuyo fin común es darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.La Señora Ana Bertha T. T., es una mujer que desde hace 3 años se ha dedicado a vender tortillas con eso se ayuda para el gasto de la casa y un poco para sus hijos, quiere el crédito para comprar otro comal, va a vender comida preparada para que crezca su negocio poco a poco con el préstasmo.
texts.en:
This group is called “Adys” because the daughter of the woman who founded this group is named Adriana and she believes it will bring luck to her group just as her daughter brought her blessings when she was born. The group is located in Tlaxcala, Mexico, in a rural farming community where most of the residents work for local businesses in nearby industrial areas.

This group consists of eleven hardworking women who have a common goal of providing a better quality of life for their children. Sra. Ana Bertha T. T. has been selling tortillas for three years to help cover her household expenses and provide a little bit of support for her children. She wants this loan to buy another tortilla griddle so that she can sell prepared meals and steadily grow her business.

loans.use: Purchase a tortilla griddle

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
Mrs. Kan P. (in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Chenda Chum, live in a village along National Road Number One, approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Mr. Chenda Chum is a construction worker and drives a motor taxi when he is free. 

Kan stays at home and does housework. The main source of income is from her husband’s business and her children’s salaries. 

The family asked for a Kiva loan to finish their house-building. They now are in the process of building a concrete brick room under their wooden house. So, Kan requests a loan of $1,200 to finish the building.

loans.use: To build a concrete brick room under her wooden house.

loans.name: Elmer Amilcar

texts.es:
Elmer, reside en Osicala departamento de Morazán, tiene 31 años de edad, su familia la conforman su esposa y una hija de dos años de edad, él se dedica a la panadería, desde hace dos años, el aprendió cuando se desempeñaba como trabajador de panadería lo cual aprendió perfectamente el proceso de hacer el pan, vende sus productos en los municipios  cercanos tres días por semana.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para comprar ladrillos y maya, para cercar el contorno de la panadería, ya que para él es muy necesario tener en mejores condiciones la panadería y espera realizar una buena inversión.
Su sueño es crecer con el negocio, ampliar el local y dar empleo a otras personas que necesitan también una fuente de ingreso.
texts.en:
Elmer lives in Osicala, Morazán department.  He’s 31 years old and his family is composed of his wife and a two year old daughter.  He’s been a baker for two years.  He learned while working as an employee in a bakery so he learned the bread making process perfectly.  He sells his products in nearby towns three days a week.

He is asking for the loan to buy bricks and wire mesh to enclose the bakery’s perimeter because it’s very necessary for him to have better conditions in the bakery and he hopes to make a good investment.

His dream is to grow with the business, to expand the locale and provide employment to other people who also need sources of income.

loans.use: To buy bricks and wire mesh.

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en:
The woman shown in the picture above, Mrs. Chhin H., is a 37-year-old farmer residing in the city of Phnom Penh. She plants rice; that is her annual business. Her husband works in construction. 

Mrs. Chhin H. is looking for a $300 loan as capital to support her farming business. She will use the loan to buy many sacks of fertilizer and rice seed. With any remaining funds, she will repair her old house. Mrs. Chhin H. has seven children who still living under her roof till the present time. One of them is employed as a sewing worker in a factory and has a formal salary per month.

loans.use: To buy many sacks of fertilizer, rice seed, and repair her old house.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 40 years old and lives in the town of Banga with her family. She is married and has 4 children. Her oldest child is 17 years old, while the youngest is only 4.

Emily is into farming. She grows rice to sell to her community. She also owns and manages a sari-sari store where she sells shampoo, soap and other products.

Emily requested a loan so she could purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs she needs. In the future, Emily hopes for her children to finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Tserendorj

texts.en:
Tserendorj is 58-year-old widow who lives with her daughter and son in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. Her husband died in early 2010. Her son lives by himself and works as a taxi driver in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter, who is 23, helps with the family business. 

Tserendorj operates a clothing business from a rented stall at a trading center. She started her business in 2002 at an outdoor market. Tserendorj worked hard to expand her business and rent a stall at an indoor market. In 2005, she expanded to rent another stall at a different indoor market that her daughter now manages. Tserendorj has gained a great deal of business experience and has built good relationships with her partners. She is a well-known businesswoman who says, “I want to buy a house for my children in order to make their living conditions better.” 

Tserendorj is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes to sell in the springtime when demand is high.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Srun

texts.en:
Srun S., age 32, is a local farmer. She lives in the province of Kompong Cham, which is the best territory for farming. She is a married woman who is devoted to her four children; three of them are attending school and depend on her care while the other one is married. 

Srun S. owns a big farm that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows various crops on it. She also plants a peanut crop on her land, and she will harvest it within the next two months when the plants mature. 

Srun S. can get the income from selling her mature produce to better meet her family’s needs. Her husband also helps her to grow crops. Currently, Srun S. would like to borrow some funds from Kiva for purchasing peanut seeds and fertilizer for growing a new crop.

loans.use: to purchase peanut seed and fertilizer for growing a new crop.

loans.name: Paula Andrea

texts.es: La señora Paula vive en casa de sus abuelos que ya fallecieron su mama vive en Santa Cruz, ella se dedica a la venta de sándwich en una zona muy concurrida en Cochabamba hace 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad, el horario de trabajo de la señora es de 19:00 a 6:00 de la mañana ella vende toda la noche, su esposo trabaja en Santa Cruz de albañil ella se quedo a cargo de sus dos hijos,  su esposo llega al mes una vez y le ayuda en el cuidado de sus hijos la señora es una persona joven y trabajadora, con el dinero del crédito comprara un refrigerador para mantener en buen estado la carne para realizar sus sándwiches, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Paula lives in her late grandparents' home.  Her mom lives in Santa Cruz.  Paula sells sandwiches in a very busy area of Cochabamba.  She has been in this business for five years.  She works from 7.00pm to 6.00am.  She makes her sales all night long.  Paula's husband works in Santa Cruz as a construction worker and she is left in charge of their two children.  Her husband comes home once a month and helps her to care for the children.

Paula is a young and hard-working person.  She will use her loan money to buy a refrigerator to keep the meat that she uses to make her sandwiches fresh.  She is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to keep the meat she uses in her business fresh

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina in this photo is sitting close to a pan of body creams, lotions, hair creams and baby creams. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a saw mill operator. She has received junior high level of education. 

Faustina wants a loan so she can supply other types of creams requested by her customers.

loans.use: to purchase other types of creams requested by her customers.

loans.name: Ochiroo

texts.en:
Ochiroo is 46 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Uvs province of Mongolia.  His older daughter is in kindergarten while the younger one stays home.  

He manages a shoe making business with the help of his wife in his town. They make variety of Mongolian traditional shoes that are well-known amongst their customers for their quality and durability.  They started their business in 2000 and gained much experience.  His wife is responsible for making their products and he is responsible for selling them. 

Ochiroo works as a shoemaker at a private factory too.  Now his working capital exceeds 500,000 MNT and he is planning to expand his business in the future.  He is an open-minded man who attributes his business success to his good accounting skill.  He says, "I want to have my own plot of land where I can build a house for my family."  He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for making shoes

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI est un regroupement de 9 hommes mariés qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Ils vivent la plupart dans les familles polygames à  Fofanabougou  un des villages de la commune de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Ils sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir réaliser les activités hivernales. Ils font exclusivement la culture du maïs qui reste la  culture dominante de la zone. 
Par rapport à l’utilisation de ce prêt, ISSA,  qui est la deuxième personne debout à droite en boubou, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 2 hectares environs de maïs.
Après les récoltes, la production est vendue au niveau de Fana et Marka-Coungo à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Ils comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 250 000FCFA après la campagne.
Les membres du groupe BENKADI souhaitent la continuation de leur collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
BENKADI est un regroupement de 9 hommes mariés qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Ils vivent la plupart dans les familles polygames à  Fofanabougou  un des villages de la commune de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Ils sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir réaliser les activités hivernales. Ils font exclusivement la culture du maïs qui reste la  culture dominante de la zone. 
Par rapport à l’utilisation de ce prêt, ISSA,  qui est la deuxième personne debout à droite en boubou, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 2 hectares environs de maïs.
Après les récoltes, la production est vendue au niveau de Fana et Marka-Coungo à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Ils comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 250 000FCFA après la campagne.
Les membres du groupe BENKADI souhaitent la continuation de leur collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: Labours, semence, engrais, herbicides et petits équipements

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 50 years old and married. She has two children.

Rosie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines. She has been running the variety store for eight years and also earns an income from raising pigs. 

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like juice, powdered milk, groceries, etc., to sell in her variety store. Rosie has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Rosie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like juice, powdered milk, groceries, etc., to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Herman

texts.en:
Herman is a 46-year-old-man married to Atriana, a 40-year-old lady. They have four children: 
• Fince, 21 years old, graduated from senior high school and now is working in another province. 
• Ovi, 17 years old, is studying at the first grade of senior high school.
• Filadelfia, 12 years old, is studying at the first grade of junior high school.
• Hesron, 7 years old, is studying at the first grade of elementary school.

Herman has a small kiosk to sell detergent, snacks, candies, rice, sugar, coffee, etc. He has been operating the business for years to support his family life and the education of his children. Besides operating the kiosk business, Herman is also planting vegetables such as mustard greens and spinach at his farm for his family's consumption. Sometimes Herman sells the vegetables at the local market to get more income for his family.

Herman is dreaming of adding more stocks to his kiosk to meet the demand of his customers. He is requesting a loan amounting to 10,000,000 Indonesia rupiahs (IDR) from TLM. He plans to buy kerosene, detergent, instant noodles and eggs as well as renovating his kiosk. He hopes to have an improvement in his business from the loan.

loans.use: To buy kerosene, detergent, noodles and eggs for his kiosk and to renovate his kiosk.

loans.name: Ann Marie

texts.en:
Anne Marie is a 45-year-old Rwanandan entrepreneur with a 17-year-old child.  She is a widow and her child is still in school.

For the past 20 years, she has worked as a tailor who sells a variety of clothing. Her successful business has enabled her to meet the needs of her family.

She will use this loan to purchase a sewing machine and threads for her work. 

With her future profits, she plans to accumulate savings and school fees for her child.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, needles and threads

loans.name: Erdenebat

texts.en: Mr. Erdenebat is 50 years old.. He is a taxi driver in the city of Ulaanbaatar. He has a son and daughter. He has been running a taxi service since 2002 and his daily income is not enough for his life. In this year, his son Khishigbaatar is going to marry and will be living separately. So his parents want to give him a wedding gift like a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent. He will use it as a house. It’s a very important to start a new family life. Therefore, Erdenebat is taking a loan to purchase one new ger for his son’s wedding.

loans.use: To purchase one new ger for his son’s wedding gift.

loans.name: Abdel Ilah

texts.en:
Abdel Ilah has been an owner of a food market since 2010, selling soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is situated in a crowded area, so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

Abdel Ilah decided to apply for a $2400 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his market and to buy a showcase. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

This borrower is from Iraq. He is 59 years old, married and has four children.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his market and to buy a showcase.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice has made a living for the last five years by selling charcoal in the town of Ndunyu Njeru. She is 52 years old, widowed and has one child. She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and is applying for her first loan. She plans to use it to buy four sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers. In the future, Alice hopes to improve her family's living conditions and find a better and more permanent place to live

loans.use: to buy four sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Kanipa's Group

texts.en:
Kanipa is the treasurer of this group. She is 49 and, unfortunately, she is a widow. She has a daughter and a son. The son works in Russia and the daughter studies at school. 

In order to earn money, Kanipa breeds livestock. At the moment, she is keeping three goats and a cow. She also takes orders and sews Kyrgyz national pillows and blankets. In this way, she earns 1,000 KGS per month. 

With money received from the loan she wants to purchase materials needed for sewing. In the future she wants to see her children wed.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase materials for sewing.

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida is married and has seven children, four of whom work and two of whom attend school.  Her husband works in a factory earning a meager income. 

Zahida has been operating a school canteen for the last 10 years to financially support her husband and family. Through her canteen, she sells cold drinks, snacks, and other foods to school children. Her rates are very reasonable and she earns a good profit every month. 

Zahida is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her canteen business. With the loan, she will  purchase cold drinks, snacks, juices, etc. in larger quantities for selling and increasing her profits.  She is very confident that an investment will help her improve her business and increase her profits.

loans.use: to purchase cold drinks, snacks, and juices for canteen business.

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
Suleiman is a married man with 10 children, five of whom attend school while the others are through with their studies. His wife is a businesswoman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. He has a house with electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children. 

Suleiman has operated a carpentry shop for the past 15 years; his potential clients are Kwale area residents. He faces a major challenge of expensive timber due to the tree-cutting ban. He dreams of having the best timber shop in Kwale.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase timber, nails and vanish for his business. He decided to join Yehu because of the easy accessibility of loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase timber, nails and vanish for his business.

loans.name: Niyonkuru K1 Group

texts.fr:
Thérèse est une commerçante âgée de 46ans qui habite  la Commune Gatumba de la Mairie de la Ville de Bujumbura. Elle vend divers produits vivriers comme l’huile, le sel, le sucre, les oignons, le riz, le haricot depuis 9 ans. Elle était fonctionnaire de l’Etat avant de commencer cette activité. Elle est détentrice du Diplôme A2 en Technique. Elle est mariée a Gordien, un chauffeur mécanicien et ont ensemble 2 enfants qui étudient. Elle prend aussi en charge 2 orphelins de parente proche et assure pour eux les frais de scolarité.

Le crédit Kiva  de 200,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités de produits vivriers (l’huile, le sel, le sucre, les oignons, le riz, le haricot) à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices et ainsi accroitre ses économies. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« NIYONKURU 1».
texts.en:
Thérèse is a 46-year-old retailer who lives in Gatumba, in Bujumbura.  She sells a range of food products such as oil, salt, sugar, onions, rice and beans.  She has been in this business for nine years.  Before starting this business, she was a civil servant.  She has an A2 diploma in technical subjects.  She is married to Gordien, a driver/mechanic and they have two children who are in school.  Thérèse is also responsible for two orphans from her immediate family and she covers their school fees.

This Kiva loan for 200,000 Burundian francs will allow her to increase her capital and buy large quantities of food products (oil, salt, sugar, onions, rice and beans) to re-sell in order to make large profits and thereby increase her savings.

Thérèse is a member of the Niyonkuru 1 community bank.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy large quantities of food products (oil, salt, sugar, onions, rice and beans) to re-sell

loans.name: Maria Edi

texts.es: La socia tiene 55 años de edad; la socia se dedica la cuidado de una anciana y a la fabricación de buzos en su taller de confección, la socia se dedcia a ambas actividades en diferentes horarios, ella en esta ocasión requiere el prestamo para invertir en la compra de telas, cierres, hilos entre otros para la elaboración de los buzos al por mayor en su taller de confección.
texts.en:
This member is 55 years old. She takes care of an elderly person and operates a sewing workshop where she makes track suits. The member engages in both activities on different schedules.

On this occasion, she is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of fabrics, zippers, thread, and other supplies for making track suits in mass quantities within her workshop.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, zippers, thread, and other supplies.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es: La socia tiene varias actividadescomo la agricultura, ella siembra y cosecha maíz; la socia también tiene unos stands en una galería en la ciudad de Cusco y ella se dedica al alquiler de los mismos, la socia apoya en los estudios de sus dos hijos de 24 y 16 años de edad; la socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el prestamo en el pago de servicios y aumentara animale smenores para la crianza. La socia soliciat el prestamo para invertir en el pago de servicios como luz, agua, telefono y en la compra de pollos para la crianza.
texts.en: This member engages in several business activities, such as planting and harvesting corn.  She also manages a few stands at a shopping center in the city of Cusco and rents out some of them.  The member supports the studies of her two children, ages 24 and 16.  On this occasion, she wants to pay for services and increase the number of small animals that she raises.  Therefore, the member is requesting a loan to invest in the payment of services such as electricity, water, and telephone, as well as purchase chickens to raise.

loans.use: to buy chickens and to pay for utilities.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.fr:
Jacqueline est une femme âgée de 30 ans. Elle est mariée à un médecin. Elle a 2 enfants.
Jacqueline travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2004. Elle vend du charbon de bois pour tous clients, ambulante. Elle achète les produits à Anié. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, n’a pas de difficulté.
Jacqueline a requis son 2 crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du charbon de bois. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Jacqueline voudrait agrandir la taille de l’activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is a 30-year-old woman. She is married to a doctor, and has two children.

Jacqueline has been working as a retail merchant since 2004. She sells charcoal to all-comers as an itinerant vendor. She resupplies in Anié, works alone, and at this time is experiencing no difficulties.

Jacqueline has requested her second WAGES credit loan to buy charcoal, as she wants to reinvest in her business activity.

In coming years, Jacqueline intends to increase the size of her business. She said she will use the profits to take care of her family.

loans.use: Buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Guadalupe De Jesús

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua, el señor Guadalupe De Jesús es una persona casada que se desempeña como fontanero para llevar el bienestar a su hogar y ha logrado mantener a su familia con esfuerzo de su trabajo y así darle una buena condición de vida a su familia. Él se ha caracterizado por ser una persona excelente y con buenos valores morales como persona.

En esta oficina de Ceprodel se presentó el señor Guadalupe de Jesús a solicitar crédito para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, el objetivo de este crédito lo necesita para la compra de materiales de construcción como cerámica, boom, porcelana, pago de mano de obra esto será utilizado para poner piso y así darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Guadelupe De Jesús lives in the city of Managua.  He is married and works as a plumber to provide for the well-being of his household.  He has managed to support his family through his work efforts, and in this way provide good living conditions to his family.  He is known to be an excellent person with good moral values.  

Guadelupe De Jesús came to this office of CEPRODEL to request a loan to improve the condition of his house.  His goal with this loan is to buy construction materials such as tile, insulation foam, and porcelain, and to pay for the labor that will be used in order to put in a new floor, in this way providing better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to make improvements to his home

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu is 43 years, married and has one child. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a technician. She earns an income by selling garlic to her customers for food production. She buys garlic bulbs from wholesalers and then peels the outer layer of garlic before selling. She has done this since 2006. 

Thu is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy a larger quantity of garlic to increase her production for selling. This loan will allow her to increase her income and set aside some savings for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of garlic to increase her production for selling.

loans.name: Francisco Luis

texts.es: A sus 25 años, el señor Francisco se dedica a la agricultura y la ganadería, actividad heredada de sus padres puesto que toda su vida la ha pasado en el campo. Gracias a esta labor puede conseguir el sustento para él y su esposa quienes sueñan con tener dos hijos. Con el ánimo de buscar una mejora en la economía de su hogar, el señor Francisco desea adquirir una vaca lechera con la cual pueda producir leche y venderla a sus vecinos y familiares, con lo anterior podrá conseguir los ingresos necesarios para vivir con su esposa y ahorrar para sus futuros hijos.
texts.en: At 25 years old, Francisco is working in agriculture and raising cattle. He inherited this work from his parents, having spent his entire life in the fields. Thanks to this work he has been able to sustain himself and his wife. They dream of having two children together. With the aim of improving their household economy, Francisco would like to acquire a dairy cow so that he can produce milk to sell to his neighbors and relatives. This will make it possible for him to obtain the income he and his wife need to live off of and to save for their future children.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Nanci Yoni

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN VALENTIN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 50 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de cereales como trigo, cebada y quinua, ella vende al por mayor a los diferentes mercados desde las  8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cereales como trigo, quinua y cebada al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Nanci belongs to the communal bank "San Valentín". The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to Cusco Province and Cusco Department.

She is 50 years old and has a live-in partner and two children. She alternates her daily activities with her business, which is selling cereals such as wheat, barley and quinoa. She sells wholesale to different markets, from 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM. She is able to take care of her children by means of this business. Her goal is to set up a shop where she can sell cereal. She is requesting this loan to purchase cereal wholesale such as wheat, quinoa and barley.

She’s happy with the loan and commits to meet her installment payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase cereal wholesale such as wheat, quinoa and barley.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a very hardworking woman who practices mixed farming. She has been in this business for over five years and earns a monthly profit of 5,000 KES. She is 34 years old and married to Paul, who is also a farmer, and they have two children. 

She is applying for her second loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy farm inputs like seeds and chemicals. 

She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to buy cattle for fattening and to pay her children's school fees. She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy seeds and chemicals

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina 
	Cristina tiene 32 años de edad, actualmente vive con su compañero y su hija de 7 años, vive en la zona de Horquetas de Sarapiqui.  La solicitante tiene un importante historial dentro de Fundación Mujer, en la comunidad fue la artífice de la formación de un grupo  formado por jóvenes emprendedoras de la zona;  cancelaron con puntualidad el  crédito otorgado. Ella decide  optar por un monto mayor por lo que va a solicitar éste créditos. Los préstamos anteriores le sirvieron para la actividad de Pollos de engorde, la cual se ha venido manejando desde hace 3 años. Actualmente junto a su esposo, se dedican también al comercio de tenis de marca, por lo que el capital solicitado irá dirigido a la compra de esta mercadería y seguir atendiendo los pollos.
	La actividad le ha  permitido generar ingresos para cubrir el pago del préstamo y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. En este caso particular se desea retomar la actividad de comercio ya que maneja una cartera de clientes en la zona, cubrir los pedidos y seguir apoyando los ingresos familiares. Entre las labores diarias de Cristina esta llevar a su hija a la escuela y atender al alimentación de los pollos y además cuenta con una cerda de cría, en las tardes junto a su compañero, en el vehículo de la familia,  se dedican a la venta de ambos productos (pollos y tenis), en las comunidades cercanas.
	 Es el cuarto crédito que se  solicita, el segundo de forma individual, se ha demostrado una conducta de pago muy buena, y la actividad comercial a venido en aumento; según los datos recopilados en la visita a la microempresa
	Se cuenta con los gallineros y un congelador para el almacenamiento de los pollos, existe en la zona un restaurante y una soda que compra los pollos, además de los vecinos de la comunidad. Con respecto a la actividad de venta de zapatos deportivos,  esta es manejada junto a su esposo, es complementaria a los pollos. Se cuenta con una cartera de clientes desde hace 5 años, y se pretende realizar una inversión importante para cubrir los pedidos de los clientes. Las tenis son de marca y se adquieren en la frontera de Paso Canoas a un precio muy competitivo y dando facilidades de pago.
texts.en:
Cristina is 32 years old and currently lives with her husband and 7-year old daughter in the Horquetas de Sarapiqui area. She has an important historical role in Fundación Mujer as she was the reason a group of young entrepreneurs was formed in the community. They paid off their loan promptly. Cristina has decided to seek a larger loan. Last time she used the money to raise chickens and has been doing this for three years. As she and her husband also sell brand name sneakers, the new loan will be used to buy these items, and Cristina will continue to raise chickens.  

This job has enabled her to earn money to pay off the loan and improve the standard of living of her family. Now she wishes to invest in the business again as she has orders from customers in the area. This would bring more money into the household. Cristina’s daily chores consist of getting her daughter ready for school, feeding the chickens and a pig she is also raising. 

In the afternoon she and her husband take the family vehicle and go off to sell both the chickens and the sneakers in nearby communities. This will be Cristina’s fourth individual loan. She has demonstrated responsibility in repaying the money each time, and her business is doing well according to data collected in a visit to her small business.  She owns henhouses and a fridge for the chicken food. A neighbourhood restaurant and coffee shop buy chickens from her, as do people in the community. The sales of sneakers are done by both her and her husband alongside sales of chickens. She has had a group of regular customers for five years, and she hopes to make a large investment so she can fill her customers’ orders. The sneakers are brand name obtained from the border at Paso Canoas, Panama, for a competitive price on credit and easy payment terms.

loans.use: To buy chickens to raise and sport shoes to sell.

loans.name: Loise

texts.en: Loise is 54 years old married with a family of 5 children. She is the group and Anglican Church Treasurer as well as the Mothers Union Chairlady. She also works for Kenya Generation Company. She is committed in leadership and Empowering women in her area. She supplements her salary by selling eggs from her Poultry business.  She collects and sells 5 trays of eggs per day at $3 per tray. She also has a cow which gives her milk for sale and home consumption. She sells between 17 – 20 litres of milk per day giving her about USD225 every monthly. This business has helped her in educating her children and maintaining the family. Rearing more chicken will increase her earnings and this will make her live a comfortable life.

loans.use: Loise would like to buy 400 chicks and chicks mash.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a lorry to deliver vegetables

loans.name: Tauloto

texts.en: Making beautiful Samoan handicrafts begins with knowledge of the land and the people, and that is what attracts so many to the beautiful art of traditional Samoan crafts.  Tauloto is a 26-year old single mother.  Financial self-sufficiency is a daily struggle for Tauloto, and her flea market stall is her only means to achieve this goal.  She stocks the stall that she rents at the local flea market with traditional Samoan handicrafts made by her and others in her village.  She is seeking a loan in order to pay flea market rents and purchase some tools to aid her in making crafts to sell at her stall.

loans.use: Purchase tools and pay flea market rents

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
Maria Dolores is married and has four children. Because of the necessity to obtain extra income that allowed her to help her husband with home expenses and its oldest daughter who is a single mother, Maria Dolores began to sell slushes five years ago in her house and during the weekends has a place in the markets. Slushes are drinks done with ice, sweetened with syrups of different natural flavors, very well demanded during hot weather days.

This is the best time of sales for Maria Dolores and in order to cover her demand she is requesting a loan of $550 which she Hill use to buy a “tirón” (a piece that is used to connect the car to the trailer which is her sales post), in order to carry the trailer, this will make easier for her to move around and offer a better service, she will repay her loan in 6 months. Help Maria to keep on growing in her business, be an important part in the life of this family, they will sincerely appreciate it.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Dolores es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Ante la necesidad de obtener un ingreso extra que le permitiera ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar y a su hija mayor que es madre soltera, Maria Dolores comenzó a vender raspados desde hace cinco años en su casa y los fines de semana establece su puesto en los mercados. Los raspados son bebidas a base de hielo picado, endulzados con jarabes de diversos sabores naturales, muy consumidos en tiempo de calor.

Por esta temporada las ventas de Maria Dolores se incrementan considerablemente y para poder cubrir la demanda solicita un préstamo de $ 550 dólares que utilizará en la compra de un tirón (es una pieza que sirve para poder conectar un carro al remolque que tiene como su puesto de venta), para poder jalar el remolque, esto le facilitará los traslados y podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Ayuda a Maria a continuar creciendo con su negocio, se parte importante en la vida de esta familia, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To buy a tirón (hook between car and trailer)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy Merchandise

loans.name: Debmy

texts.es:
My name is Debmy O. and I sell clothes for ladys and gentlemen, bracelets, earrings, necklaces, purses, etc. I’ve been doing it for 3 years and my business is very succesfull since it’s located in a commercial area in the capital city. Nowadays, I need to get more products before Christmas wich is the time of the year with higher sales. With the profits, I wish to pay for my son’s studys and support my house which is difficult to me as I am a single mother.

Translated from spanish by Augusto Salazar, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Debmy O. me dedico a la venta de ropa para dama y caballero, pulseras, aritos, collares, carteras etc, actividad que realizo hace tres años, mi negocio es muy bueno ya que estoy ubicada en una zona comercial de la cuidad capital, en estos momentos necesito abastecerme mas de producto ya que faltan pocos días para la navidad y en esta época es cuando mas se vende, con las ganancias que obtenga deseo poder pagar los estudios de mi hijo y mantener mi hogar el cual me es difícil ya que soy madre soltera y no tengo ayuda de nadie.

loans.use: Purchase of clothes for ladys and gentlemen, bracelets, earrings and purses.

loans.name: Norma Elia

texts.es:
I have been selling women’s clothes for the last 3 years. This is the only source of income that we have, since my husband and I work together in it. We would like to get winter and men’s clothes without running out of money. So we are asking for a loan of US$ 1,200 for this purpose. Thank you for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Ramón, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo ya más de 3 años en la venta de ropa para dama. Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso de mi familia en el trabajamos mi esposo y yo. Que remos comprar mercancía para frió y para caballero sin descapitalizarnos. Solicitamos un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls para la compra de mercancía.

loans.use: To get more merchandise

loans.name: Maria Flora

texts.es:
María S. tiene viviendo en huascar 25 años,  tiene 7 hijos, de los cuales 2 son menores de edad y actualmente estudian en el colegio, ellos son la razón de su esfuerzo, sus ganas de mejorar su negocio cada día.
La señora se inicia como microempresaria vendiendo carbón, luego por iniciativa de sus hijos mayores crear un taller de confecciones el cual tiene 2 años.
Actualmente la señora cuenta con 5 máquinas la cual le permite confeccionar y prestar servicios a terceros.
Su proyección es tener un taller mas equipado, es decir contar con 15 maquinas aproximadamente.

loans.use: Compra de una maquina industrial

loans.name: Liberato

texts.es:
Liberato has his own vehicle with which he provides public transport between the cities of El Alto and La Paz. He works as a chauffer. This business is the source of the income with which he supports his three children, two of whom attend a state university while one is still in a local school. His wife does domestic work out of their home. They live in the Ciudad Satélite zone of the city of El Alto.

The requested loan will be used to maintain his work vehicle; maintaining the vehicle will allow him to continue contributing economically to the family.

This is Liberato's second loan with IMPRO; his good history with the institution qualifies him for another loan. Liberato has been an IMPRO client since 2005.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Liberato tiene su movilidad con la que trabaja de transporte publico Inter ciudad El Alto – La Paz; él trabaja de chofer y esta actividad es su fuente de ingresos con los que cubre la manutención de sus tres hijos, dos de ellos están en la universidad estatal y uno en el colegio, la esposa realiza trabajos domésticos en el hogar; vive en la Zona Ciudad Satélite de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito solicitado será utilizado en el mantenimiento de su movilidad de trabajo para seguir contribuyendo económicamente con la familia.

Es el segundo crédito con IMPRO, el buen antecedente con la institución le faculta aprobarle otro préstamo. Liberato es cliente nuestro desde el año 2005.

loans.use: Maintain the vehicle he uses as a chauffer

loans.name: Eleodora

texts.en:
Eleodora has been a member of the community bank “Cocharacas” for four months. Through the community bank she has learned to be responsible, have a healthy relationship with her husband, how to educate her children, and to save.

Eleodora is married and has seven children, four of whom live with her. Eleodora makes typical clothing, which is mainly used for festivals and parades. She makes sashes, blouses, and skirts, which she learned to do from her mother-in-law. Eleodora sells her products at various markets around Ayacucho.

Eleodora needs a loan of 1600 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy fabric, thread, zippers, and buttons.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account each associate has. Eleodora plans to use her savings to educate her children and to construct her home. Her dream is to own a home, that her children will be professionals, and that she will have a secure job.

loans.use: Eleodora needs a loan of 1600 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy fabric, thread, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Amelia Clara

texts.es:
Mrs. Amelia Clara Anhuamán B. is 43 years old. She studied up until her third year of high school. She has five children, of which four are still dependents. She lives on the Deam Saavedra street in the El cortijo sector in the Trujillo province, La Libertad apartment, Perú. Mrs. Amelia has a small farm in which she grows vegetables such as radish, cucumber, onion, cilantro, and broccoli and then distributes around the different markets of the city of Trujillo. She has tended to her small farm since she lived with her parents, and that is why she knows how to be successful in the business. She is a founding member of the Comunal Bank "Nuevo Perú", through which she obtained her first loan of 300.00 Soles ($106 USD). She used this money on everything necessary to achieve a good harvest. She will purchase six sacks of urea, fertilizer, manure, and insecticides with a loan of 1,700.00 Soles ($625 USD) which she will repay in six months. Her main dream is to open a restaurant at her house.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Amelia Clara Anhuamàn B. tiene 43 años de edad, estudio hasta el tercer año de secundaria. Tiene cinco hijos pero cuatro aun dependen de ella. Vive en la calle Deam Saavedra en el sector El Cortijo en la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad – Perú. La señora Amelia tiene una gran chacra en la que siembra verduras tales como: rábano, pepinillo, cebolla, cilantro y brócoli, el cual lo distribuye por los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Trujillo. Desde que vivía con sus padres se ha dedicado a la chacra y es por eso que sabe llevar con éxito el negocio. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal “Nuevo Perú” en el que obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 este dinero lo invirtió en todo lo necesario para lograr una buena cosecha. Con el préstamo de S/. 1700.00 el cual pagará en seis meses comprara seis sacos de urea, fertilizante, abono e insecticidas. Su mayor sueño es abrir un restaurante en su casa.

loans.use: She will use the loan to purchase manure and other products for her business

loans.name: La Union Group

texts.en:
Ivelisse is a soft-spoken, but hard working woman in her mid-thirties. She lives with her husband and two children in the small rural town of Consuelo. In Consuelo, she is surrounded by agriculture and vegetables such as yucca, a variety of other tubers (which have a close resemblance to potatoes), plantains, and plenty of sugar cane.

She is asking for this loan so that she can afford to purchase some of these vegetables in bulk quantity, fresh from the local farmers. After being able to purchase them, she will then re-sell them to smaller vendors at a marked-up price; as such she will be able to integrate herself into the food supply chain, and as a result, begin earning money for her family.

Her dream is to one day have enough money to purchase and own her home and vehicle. Consuelo is a beautiful town, but somewhat disconnected from the rest of the island—a vehicle would allow her and her children to more frequently visit family members living in other areas, family members that she says she misses dearly.

On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, and from Ivelisse herself, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of fresh fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Elida

texts.es:
Norma belongs to the Communal Bank “Virgen de la Asunción,” and she has a grocery store. Her business is located in the district and province of Carhuaz in Ancash state.

With the S/.1,300 nuevos soles loan, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy 5 cases of oil, 4 bags of sugar, and 5 bags of rice.

She is 37 years old, married and has 3 children, her husband is a truck driver and they both work so they can educate their children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Norma, pertenece al Banco Comunal Virgen de la Asunción, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes. Su negocio esta ubicando en el distrito y provincia de Carhuaz, departamento de Ancash.
