Con el préstamo de S/. 1,300.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelada en 6 cuotas, comprará 5 cajas de aceite, 4 bolsas de azúcar y 5 bolsas de arroz.

Ella tiene 37 años, conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, su esposo es conductor de camiones ambos trabajan para educar a su hijos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Rahima

texts.ru:
Rahima A. lives in Rudaki. She lives with her son and his family. Despite the fact that her son works, she earns a living for herself and still helps her son's family. She sells honey and eggs. She works in the Shokhmansur market. She buys goods from suppliers and sells them at retail. She buys eggs at a factory for low prices. She wants to increase her product turnover and increase her honey supply. This is possible only if she receives a loan. She plans to pay off her debt in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Абдуллоева Рахима проживает в районе Рудаки. Живет с сыном и его семьей. Но не смотря на то , что сын работает она сама зарабатывает на жизнь и еще помогает семье сына. Занимается торговлей меда и яиц. Торгует на рынке «Шохмансур». Закупает товар у поставщиков и продает в розницу. Яйца скупает на фабрике по более низким ценам. Хочет увеличить товарооборот , для того , чтобы увеличить запас меда. Это возможно только при получении кредита. Погасить кредит она планирует в течении 12 месяцев

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Scola

texts.en:
Scola is 37 years old. She is a married woman with 2 children aged 10 and 4. She owns and operates a restaurant. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

Scola now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Rehema's Mungu Tusaidie Group

texts.en:
Rehema is 28 years old. She is married and she has 2 children aged 1 and 7. She has been an onion-seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 6 AM to 6 PM at her business and she can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

Rehema now hopes for a loan to buy more onions for re-sale. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Mwanaisha and MwanaM., who also have businesses.

loans.use: To buy more onions for  re-sale

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi A. is a trader in the local market of Obuasi in the Ashanti Region of Ghana, where she lives with her family. She is 45 years old, married, and the mother of five children who are currently in school. She is a busy trader who treks to Tarkoradi in the Western Region of Ghana to purchase bulk supplies of fish at the seashore so she can sell the fish to her customers. Esi has been in this business for the past 25 years. Because of this business, she has been able to pay for two of her children to complete senior high school. She needs more working capital to grow her business. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality fish directly from the seamen so she can upgrade her inventory. She is grateful for your assistance. She belongs to the group called Gospel Light Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee the repayment of loans for one another.

loans.use: To purchase fish.

loans.name: Bilaly

texts.fr: BILALY C. EST UN PHOTOGRAHE QUI HABITE AU QUARTIER NDAYANNE A DIOURBEL. IL A UNE EXPERIENCE DE 10 ANS DANS LE SECTEUR. IL EST MARIE
texts.en:
BILALY C. is a photographer who lives in the NDAYANNE district in DIOURBEL. He has ten years of experience in the sector. He is married.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: EQUIPMENT

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en: Rovshan is 30 years old, and is married with one child He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Kalbadjar region, settled in Khirdalan settlement. Ten years ago he started baking bread for a living. He would like a loan of 970 AZN to buy the necessary products to help improve his business.

loans.use: to buy the necessary products for improving his business

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es: Jessica tiene 28 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con sus hijos que están estudiando y la quieren mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, la lleva a vender por los diferentes caseríos del río Ucayali, y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce muchos lugares y mucha gente. Le es rentable debido a que lleva sus prendas y las vende personalmente, además no hay lugares cercanos donde sus clientes puedan comprar ropa, por lo que la esperan para comprar sus prendas. Lo que no le gusta es dejar a sus hijos, pero tiene a su hermana quien los cuida mientras ella está lejos. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado ser responsable con sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita va a alquilar un local para poner su tienda de ropa estable y así poder estar más cerca de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jessica is 28-years-old; is a single mother; and lives with her children who are in school and who love her very much. She sells used clothing, which she takes to sell in the different towns of the Ucayali River. What she likes about her job is getting to know many places and people. It is profitable since she takes her clothes and sells them personally. There also aren't any nearby places where her customers can buy clothing, so they wait to buy clothes from her. What she doesn't like is leaving her children, but she has a sister who takes care of them while she is far away. This is her third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she has proven to be responsible with her payments. With the money she is requesting, she is going to rent a location to start a stable clothing store so she can be closer to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To rent a location to sell her clothing

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort sells bags of charcoal and crates of eggs. She makes good profits from this business and this makes her happy. She has been in this business for a long time. Comfort needs the loan amount of 140,000 NGN ($1,000 US) to purchase more bags of charcoal and crates of eggs to sell. Comfort is 50 years old and married with four children. She lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She says, "thank you to all that made this loan possible."

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal and crates of eggs to sell.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: La Sra. Maria del Rosario tiene 39 años de edad y reside en la colonia Sagastume de la ciudad capiptal, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su casa de habitacion, tiene su negocio hace varios años, las tortillas que produce las vende en una fabrica avicola y las que le sobran las vende de forma ambulante cerca de su colonia, con los ingresos que percibe con sus ventas ha logrado poder levantar su casa de habitacion y tambien este negocio le brinda a sus hijos alimentacion y estudio, ella solicita un credito para poder salir adelante y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos
texts.en:
Maria del Rosario is 39 years old and resides in Sagastume, a suburb in the capital city. She is dedicated to selling tortillas in her home. She's had her business for various years. She sells the tortillas that she produces in a poultry factory and she sells whatever is leftover on foot near her area. With the income that she makes from her sales she has been able to improve her residence. Also this business provides food and education to her children. She is requesting a loan so she can get ahead and improve her children's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn, corn flour, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.es:
El joven Virgilio tiene de 23 años de edad, es soltero vive en unas de las compañía (TajyLoma) de la ciudad de Carapeguá con sus padres. 

    	Como proviene de una familia humilde y con ganas de salir adelante y pensando en el futuro decidió viajar con su tío, ya que este se dedica a la ventas de artesanía en otras ciudades lo llevo con él como  repartidor de mercaderías
Mas adelante  con la  experiencia  adquirida  y  un poco de capital que  reuniò tomo el dasafiò de  intentar la misma  actividad por cuenta propia pero  buscando  una  nueva  zona de trabajo y realizo  su venta por la zona de   Ciudad del Este , actualmente ya cuenta con buena clientela formada. 
Gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo  pudo comprarse una motocicleta  con  la cual   realizar su rrecorrido en forma  mas  ràpida  y eficiente 
	Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías (hamacas, frazadas, fajas y sábanas) .
texts.en:
Virgilio is 23 years old, single, and lives in the city of Carapegua with his parents. In order to provide for his humble family and thinking about how to get ahead in the future, he decided to travel with his uncle who sells artisanal products in other cities. Virgilio went with his uncle to work delivering merchandise. Later, with the experience he acquired and a little bit of capital that he put together, Virgilio took up the challenge of starting his own independent business, but in a new area of work. He set up sales in the zone of Ciudad del Este and now has a good base of clients. Thanks to the effort and work, Virgilio was able to buy a motorcycle with which he can travel his delivery route in a faster and more efficient manner. He is seeking a loan to buy merchandise such as hammocks, blankets, sheets and belts.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kahn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise such as sheets, blankets, hammocks and belts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more sugar, salt, cooking oil and vitenge in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy products to stock his business

loans.name: Foulematou

texts.fr:
Madame  Foulematou Berthé est mariée, mère de 8 enfants (3garçons et 5 filles). Elle est née vers 1969 à Bamako (capitale du Mali) en Afrique de l’Ouest. Elle vit chez son époux dans une famille nucléaire avec leurs enfants à Kadiolo ville dans le quartier Noumousso.
Elle fait l’achat vente des condiments alimentaires (concentrée de tomate, oignons, sel de cuisine, cube maggi, poudre de gombo, l’ail, laurier, poivre,tomates fraiches etc) depuis 10 ans. Expérimentée en raison des années d’activité, elle mène son commerce avec réussite.
Elle est à son troisième prêt individuel avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Les prêts passés se sont bien dénoués. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter,  8 paquets de condiments. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Sikasso ville, de Kadiolo ville et dans les villages avoisinants. Elle vend la plupart au comptant (en détail) à une clientèle composée de femmes.
Elle envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour augmenter le fonds de commerce et l’autre partie sera mise en épargne car elle  envisage acheter un congélateur pour diversifier produits
texts.en:
Mrs. Foulematou Berthé is married and the mother of 8 children (3 sons and 5 daughters). She was born around 1969 in Bamako (capital of Mali) in West Africa. She lives with her husband in a nuclear family with their children in the town of Kadiolo, Noumousso district.

She has been buying and selling condiments (tomato paste, onions, cooking salt, Maggi cubes, okra powder, garlic, bay leaves, pepper, fresh tomatoes, etc.) for 10 years. Since she has so many years of experience, she goes about her business with success. She is on her third loan with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. Both preceding loans were correctly reimbursed.

With this new loan, she intends to buy 8 packets of condiments. She buys her merchandise at the market in the town of Sikasso, in the town of Kadiolo, and the surrounding villages. She sells mostly for cash (retail) to a clientele composed mostly of women.

She expects to make a monthly average profit of 25,000 F CFA of which part will be used to bolster her working capital and the rest put into savings since she hopes to buy a freezer so as to diversify the goods she sells.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of condiments for re-sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 45-year-old woman. She is married with three children. Currently all of them are in school. She prepares and sells pastries to the working community and at bus stops at Kasoa. She wants to use the loan to buy more flour, margarine, vegetable oil, etc. to increase her stock and to avoid price hikes.  This she believes, will minimize her cost very significantly to enable her to raise good income to support her children in school. She is a member of the trust group called ‘Olivet’ In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access a loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more flour, margarine, vegetable oil, etc.

loans.name: Kokoè

texts.fr: Kokoè est mariée et mère d’un jeune garçon, son mari est un policier à la retraite. Afin d’aider son époux dans les charges du foyer, elle a entamé en 2003 le commerce de céréales, elle vend les céréales en gros et en détail. Elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays dans la ville de badou parce que dans cette ville les prix des céréales sont moins coûteux. Le stock dont elle dispose ne lui permet pas de faire face à la demande de ses clients. Elle veut augmenter son stock et sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 10 sacs de maïs, 12 sacs d’haricots et 5 sacs de mil.
texts.en:
Kokoè is married and the mother of a little boy. Her husband is a retired policeman. So as to help her husband support the family, she began selling cereals in 2003, both wholesale and retail. She buys her supplies in the country, in the town of Badou, because the price of cereals is less expensive there. Her present stock does not allow her to cover the needs of her clientele. She would like to increase her inventory and is asking WAGES for her first loan to buy 10 sacks of maize, 12 sacks of dried beans, and 5 sacks of millet.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of maize, dried beans, and millet

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: Mariama Y. is 33 years old, married, and has four children—a daughter and three sons. Some are currently in the senior high school and others are in the junior high and the primary schools. They live in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Her husband is a farmer. She sells cereals such as maize, beans, millet, and so forth. Mariama buys her goods from nearby communities at affordable prices and sells them in the market square in her community. She sells to food vendors and retailers. She also treks to other markets to sell her products. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. Mariama aspires to expand her business and sponsor her children in school.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Kareema

texts.en:
Kareema is 54 years old. She has ten children, six of whom are married and financially independent from the family. Her other four children still live at home: two of them are under 18 years old and still at school, while the other two are working at the family barber shop.

The barber shop is the only source of income for the family since Kareema's husband does not work. Kareema started the business three years ago in order to give her children a career. They were already trained to do haircutting and had worked for a while at other barber shops.

Kareema helps her two children by buying all the merchandise and cleaning the shop. The new loan will be used to pay for the shop rent since they decided to move to a new, bigger shop that has a better location.

This is Kareema's second loan. Her first loan was for $700 and was fully repaid on time.
 
Kareema's son appears in the photo at his saloon after they moved to the new location and did some renovation. Kareema doesn't appear in the photo for social reasons.

loans.use: To pay rent for the new barber shop

loans.name: Gloria Alejandrina

texts.es:
la Sra. GLORIA ALEJANDRINA V. se dedica a la venta de golosinas y venta de queso al por mayor. Tiene mas de 4 años dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, durante todo este tiempo
le ha ido bien ya que su negocio esta ubicado en un punto muy estrategico y de mucha afluencia de personas que transitan por ese sector.
la comida todo tiempo se vende ya que es una necesidad basica que obligatoriamente hay que suplir y aquí el queso es un producto que se procesa en grandes cantidades lo suficiente para satisfacer la demanda  local y regional,  ya que es una zona apta para la ganaderia.
con las utilidades que le genera este negocio le permitide suplir los gastos del hogar y la crianza y educacion de sus hijos  tambien otros compromisos adquiridos que tiene y de esta manera contribuye a su esposo en el hogar, ella quiere mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Gloria Alejandrina V. sells candy and cheese wholesale. She has been working in this business for more than 4 years and she has done well since her business is located at a very strategic point where there is a great inflow of people who travel in the area. The food always sells because it is a basic necessity. Here, cheese is a product that they process in high quantities in order to satisfy the local and regional demand since it is an area that is very suitable for cattle farming. With the profits this business generates she is able to pay for household expenses and the upbringing and education of her children. Also, other deals that she obtains in this matter she contributes to her husband and her household – she wants to improve her and her family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beef, chicken, vegetables, drinks, condiments, tortillas, lard, and cheese

loans.name: Epi

texts.en: Epi P. (0) is a 36-year-old woman living in the town of Saletele. She is married and has four infant children. Epi owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 800 WST a month. In 2005, Epi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase harvesting equipment. Epi is now requesting a new loan of 3,000 WST which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 5th from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional seafood products

loans.name: Agne Luis

texts.es: Agne Luis Berríos R. tiene la edad de 30 años, el es un buen cliente de Fundación León 2000, por lo que tiene varios créditos ya que siempre le ha gustado trabajar para mantener a su familia. Su esposa también aporta a ciertos gastos de la familia. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de ropa, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Por lo que siempre le ha gustado satisfacer a sus clientes. A pesar de los problemas que enfrenta como es el cobro de la mercadería que con tanto sacrificio gana. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo destinado para la compra de ropa.
texts.en:
Agne Luis Berríos R. is 30, and he is a good client of Fundación León 2000. He has various loans because he has always liked to work to support his family. His wife also helps with some of the family expenses. He sells clothes, and he is a street vendor. He has been doing this activity for over four years. He has always liked satisfying his customers, in spite of the problems he encounters like the cost of the merchandise, which takes such sacrifice to obtain. The loan is for working capital to buy clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 39 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Desde hace 6 meses tiene una tienda de productos comestibles de primera necesidad y actualmente es la más concurrida de su localidad. Este negocio es una gran oportunidad para incrementar sus ingresos económicos, además que no descuida la atención de sus hijos. Su trato amable y los precios cómodos que ofrece le garantizan el retorno de sus clientes. Para el futuro de su negocio, Blanca desea adquirir vitrinas para que pueda exhibir más mercadería, tanto de comestibles como artículos para el hogar.
Esta es la doceava oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es una persona muy comprometida y perseverante en su banco comunal y también fue parte de junta directiva. Ahora desea continuar con el mismo ánimo de realizar un trabajo responsable con su grupo. El dinero que viene solicitando será utilizado para adquirir más productos como fideos, azúcar , arroz entre otros, los cuales son de mayor demanda en su tienda.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en: Edgar M. is from the village of Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga del sur. He is 52 years old, married and has one adult-aged child. Edgar raises baboy livestock (pigs) which he sells. He has been raising pigs for over eight years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month. In 2009, Edgar joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services in order to improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Edgar has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from GDMPC. He used this previous loan to purchase breeding livestock. Edgar is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which he will use to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Edgar from GDMPC. He will use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy stews and meat for her business

loans.name: Floridelia

texts.es:
la sra. Floridelia B. S. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia en la cual vende todo tipo de productos, Floridelia tiene 30 años de edad, nos comento que se siente muy feliz ya que ahora que tiene su propio negocio todo le esta saliendo bien, tiene buenas ganancias pero le gustaria mejorarlas y para eso es que necesita el credito, desea invertir en mas variedad de productos.
floridelia vive en el barrio San Antonio de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, su negocio esta bien ubicado ya que por ahi pasan muchas personas.
su sueño es llegar a tener un supermercado y crear fuentes de empleo.
texts.en:
Floridelia B. S., 30, sells popular consumer goods. She has a small grocery store where she stocks all kinds of products. Floridelia tells us that she feels very happy because, now that she has her own business, things are going very well; she earns good profits but would like to increase them and this is the reason she needs this financing. She wants to invest in yet a wider variety of products. Floridelia lives in the San Antonio neighborhood of the city of San Lorenzo. Her store is well situated since many people pass by it. Her dream is to some day have a supermarket and create jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, churros, rice, beans, sugar, coffee, spices, sardines, toilet paper, sanitary napkins, candles, matches, batteries, safety razors, bread, crackers, juices, notebooks, pencils, balls, chocolate, powdered soft-drink mix, milk, ham, cheese, soups, pasta.

loans.name: Bakuseka Magya Development Group Of Mukono

texts.en:
Prossy N. is 46 years old and the leader of her group in Mukono. She is divorced with 8 children whose ages range from 25 years to 6 years. Prossy has been selling dry fish for 17 years and generates 80,000 USH per week from the enterprise.

The fisheries are raising prices, though, and Prossy’s capital levels are too low to maintain her standard levels of inventory. She would like to use the loan of 300,000 USH to increase her stock and keep up with demand.

The good quality of the fish she sells has created a loyal customer base and she hopes to continue being successful. Her dream is to one day have a big stall in the market and to be able to educate her children.

loans.use: For increase of stock

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna B. is from the village of Villa Coloma, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 47 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Lorna owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Lorna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 23,000 PHP from ASKI. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her eighth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Vaialalua

texts.en:
Vaialalua U. is 25 and single with no children.  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Vaialalua  has 3 years of experience in this business.  Vaialalua  needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

Vaialalua  joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Vaialalua 's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Vaialalua  U. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.4 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.8 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Baldorj

texts.en:
D. Baldorj is 31 year old and lives with his wife and five children in the Arhangai province of central Mongolia. The family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.
Baldorj and his wife run a retail dairy business from a stand at the local market. Baldorj began his business in 2006 with working capital of 500,000 MNT. In operating his business, he purchases dairy products in the Ugiinuur soum and sells them both in the province center and in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Due to his dependable suppliers and good business sense, today his working capital exceeds 2,000,000 MNT. Baldorj would like to save money for the future to ensure that his family has security and that he and his wife can continue to pay their children's education fees. He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a large variety of dairy products to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a large variety of dairy products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy wristwatches

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en: Ruby J. owns and operates a sari-sari (variety retail store) selling food and daily use products in her community. She is 39 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the village of Benoni, Mahinog, Camiguin province. Ruby has been in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Ruby joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Ruby is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Nadir

texts.en: Nadir is 39 years old. He is married and has two children. His family lives in the Fuzuli region. He has been in business for five years. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy more furniture for expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy furniture

loans.name: Naranjaisy Group

texts.es:
El Comité Naranjaisy, es un excelente  comité conformado en fecha 10 de octubre del 2.008, integrado por 28 mujeres de la Ciudad de ITA, este grupo se formó  gracias a que la Sra. Dolores G. se acercó a la asesora en una reunión de renovación de crédito que la misma tenía en la zona para averiguar acerca del Programa del Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
 La misma quedó muy entusiasmada y muy ansiosa de poder trabajar con este programa y ahora ya se encuentran trabajando muy contentas en el 6° ciclo del Programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
La señora DELMA es una de las integrantes que trabaja de una forma muy práctica y además muy novedoso ya que fabrica bandejas para uso domésticos, y para uso de restauranes, ella utiliza materiales reciclados y tambien comprados, y las fabrica con la ayuda de sus hijos de acuerdo a la cantidad de pedido que ella tiene.
Se encuentra muy satisfecha con su trabajo ya que mediante el puede ayudar a su familia y desea sguir trabajando para progresar y en el futuro fabricar otras cosas también para vender.El crédito solicitado fue para la compra de materiales que ella utiliza para fabricar las bandejas como (cartones, plásticos, colas, colorantes y otrso )
texts.en:
The committee Naranjaisy is an excellent group that was formed on October 10, 2008. It is made up of 28 women from the city of Ita. It was formed thanks to Mrs. Dolores G., who approached the adviser at a meeting for renewing credit that the foundation held in the area to find out more about the programs for entrepreneurial groups of women. Dolores was very enthusiatic and anxious about the possibility to work with this program. The group is now happily working through its 6th cycle with the program. Mrs. Delma is one of the members of the group, who works in a practical--as well as novel--field. She makes flags for household and restaurant use. She uses recycled as well as purchased materials. She makes the flags with the help of her children based on the number of orders she has. She is very satisfied with her work, which has allowed her to help her family. She wants to continue working so that she her business can grow and hopes that in the future she can make other things to sell. The requested loan is for purchasing materials she uses to make the flags like cardboard, plastic, tails, dyes, and other materials.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying material for flag making

loans.name: Deepani

texts.en:
Deepani is a 35-year-old married lady living with her husband and two children in the Pinnaduwa, Galle district of Sri Lanka.  She is a hard-working woman who can maintain her work independently, as she values being a self-dependent woman.

Deepani runs a tailoring business, which she has been doing for 15 years now.  She sews clothes for local customers, and has gained great experience over the years in the tailoring business.  

Now, Deepani has requested a 30,000 LKR loan from BRAC for her business in order to buy cloth. She hopes to open up her own shop in the near future and to pay her children's tuition with the increased income.

loans.use: to purchase cloth

loans.name: Oulimata

texts.fr: -Madame Oulimata  G. est une couturière  de 31 ans qui habite dans la localité de Camberene. Elle a été apprentie pendant longtemps dans un atelier de couture du  quartier. En plus des prestations de service de couture Madame Oulimata expose aussi pour la vente dans son atelier. Elle sollicite un crédit de  200 000 frs destine a l’achat de tissus qui lui permettra de confectionner les habits à exposer et aussi de finaliser ses commandes en cours. L’augmentation de ses bénéfices  lui permettra de mieux prendre en charge ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Mrs. Oulimata G. is a 31-year-old seamstress who lives in the town of Camberene. For a long time she was an apprentice in a sewing workshop in the neighborhood. In addition to the sewing services she provides, Mrs. Oulimata also displays [clothing] for sale in her workshop. She is requesting a loan of 200,000 Francs intended for the purchase of fabric that will enable her to make the clothing to be displayed. Also she will finish the orders she has pending. The increase in her profit will allow her to better provide for her personal needs.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her working capital

loans.name: Unjima

texts.en:
Unjima I. is currently in the business of selling weaving materials in a beauty salon and is requesting a loan to stock more weaving materials to sell.  Unjima is 34 years old and is married to a husband who is a head teacher. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to employ one lady to work for her the salon.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more weaving materials to sell

loans.name: Tugalhuu

texts.en:
Tugalhuu B. is 35 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in Arhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a traditional nomadic tent called a ger in a small yard that they rent. His oldest son, Davaasuren, attends a local primary school, and his youngest, Temuujin, will soon begin school.
Tugalhuu operates a bread-making business in his town with the help of his wife. They sell the bread that they produce to small grocery shops and service centers throughout their local area. He started his business in 2009 with working capital of 100,000 MNT and has grown his business successfully in a short time. In only a year, his working capital has increased to a level exceeding 300,000 MNT.
Tugalhuu's family and business are both very important to him. One day, he hopes to purchase a yard for his family to live in. He is requesting a 400,000 MNT loan to purchase flour in bulk to make bread to sell to his customers.

loans.use: To purchase flour in bulk to make bread

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en:
Mr. Vorn T. and his wife, Mrs. Soeun Norn, have been married since 1980 and have eight children: six sons and two daughters. One of them is married and lives outside the family home; two children are silk weavers, and two other children attend school, one has full-time employment, and one is a garment factory worker, while another child is young and stays at home. Vorn was not there for the photo, but his wife was available instead. 

Vorn is a farmer. He grows corn, sesame, cucumbers, and ginger. His wife has been a silk weaver since she was 20 years old. He hopes to continue increasing the volume of his produce, so he is requesting a loan of US$ 300 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: For the purchase of seeds and nutrients necessary for the production of peppers

loans.name: Gricelda Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Sra. Gricelda Elizabeth S. es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, la misma está casada y tiene dos hijos, se dedica a la venta de ropas y su marido se de dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas.
Ella atiende su local de ventas de ropas  y actualmente cuenta con mucha clientela, los dos se ayudan mutuamente para salir adelante ya que el deseo de los dos es la mejorar la calidad de vida en que viven.

La cliente solicito un nuevo crédito con nuestra entidad que lo utilizó para la compra de ropas como remeras, camperas, buzos, camisas, pantalones y otros, a modo de renovar su inventario y cubrir sus pedidos y de esta forma aumentar su clientela.
texts.en:
Gricelda Elizabeth Sanchez is from the city of Cirapegua, married and has two children. She sells clothing and her husband sells fast food. She attends her clothing store and currently has many customers. She and her husband help each other to succeed since their shared desire is to improve the quality of the life that they live. Gricelda is requesting a new loan with our group to be used for the purchase of clothing such as t-shirts, jackets, sweaters, shirts, pants and others, to update her inventory and cover orders, thus increasing her customer base.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of clothing items such as jackets, sweaters, t-shirts, pants, shirts, and others

loans.name: Unity Group

texts.en:
Hawa S., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Unity. She is 33 years old, widowed and has two children who range from 10 to 12 years old. She was only able to attend school through seventh grade due to lack of financial support.

For five years, she has been selling plantains and bananas in New Georgia Market, outside of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more plantains and bananas. She describes herself as a caring mother.

Her dream is to improve her business, make a profit, and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more plantains and bananas

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
N. Maria is 16 years-old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala East region of Uganda.  She is unmarried and has no children.   For the last three years, Maria has had a business of selling shoes.         

To help expand her business, Maria has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase to buy more shoes.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Maria hopes to generate greater profits and to take care of herself by buying food and clothes.  In the future, Maria hopes to own a house and a vehicle.    

Note to lenders: 

BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan.  Initially, the ELA program provides disadvantaged adolescents, particularly girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills.  Afterwards, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses.  These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age, improve their prospects for the future and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance.  Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and to give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: To buy more shoes.

loans.name: Maria Pastora

texts.es:
Maria Pastora C. A. tiene 40 años.  Es casada y vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia Bolívar de Ecuador. Tiene 4 hijos.  

Maria Pastora es socia de la ventanilla rural Gradas Chico, que está ubicada a quince minutos en carro de la ciudad de Guaranda. Son 20 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz, trigo, papas, y la cria de animales.  Este es el tercer préstamo que sacan con la cooperativa. 

Maria se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de maíz y trigo. Realiza las compras y las ventas de sus productos cada semana en el mercado de Guaranda.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar 2 o 3 bacas. El apoyo del préstamo lo ayudara a invertir para poder hacer mas cosas. Su meta para los proximos anos es aumentar su trabajo en la agricultura. 

Le gusta pasar tiempo en la casa con su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Pastora C. A. is 40 years old. She is married and lives in the canton of Guaranda , part of the Bolivar province in Ecuador. She has four children. Maria Pastora is member of the Gradas Chico rural bank, which is located 15 minutes by car from the city of Guaranda. There are 20 members in total, who for the most part dedicate themselves to growing corn, wheat, potatoes and the breeding of animals. This is the third loan taken out with the cooperative. Maria devotes herself to agriculture, that is growing corn and wheat. She gets her supplies and sells her products at the weekly market in Guaranda. She is requesting the loan to buy two or three cows. Supporting this loan will help her to invest in other activities. Her goal for the coming years is to increase her agricultural work. She likes to spend time at home with her family.

Translated from Spanish by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy several cows

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia, a 32-year-old married mother of one, is a hardworking lady who works as a tailor to earn a living.  In the business for three years now, she has developed a good client base, and she also farms to supplement her family’s income.  Virginia is grateful to belong to the Ikinu Clean Shine Group in Faulu Kenya because membership has enabled her to save money.  She is now requesting a loan of 20,000 kes in order to purchase another sewing machine and additional fabric, and hopes for continued and growing success in her business.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Santos Ramona

texts.es:
Santos Ramona S. García
Santos Ramona  es de 47 años de edad, casada con tres hijos, se dedica a oficios domésticos  pero actualmente se dedica a la prestación de servicio de baños con regadera en la cual lleva 10 años de experiencia en dicha actividad, actualmente solicita su segundo  crédito para la compra de calderas, tubería para baño y de esta manera ofrecer un servicio mas adecuado para sus clientes. Las referencias personales indican que es una persona responsable  y trabajadora por lo que no tendrá inconvenientes para realizar sus pagos correspondientes.
texts.en: Santos Ramona is 47 years old.  She is married and has three children.  She is a domestic worker but presently she provides restroom and shower services.  She has 10 years of experience in this business.   She is requesting her second loan to purchase water heaters and bathroom water pipes in order to upgrade service to her customers.  Her personal references indicate that she is a hard-working, responsible perS. who will not have problems making her payments.

loans.use: To buy bathroom water pipes and water heaters

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic M. is 32 years old and a father of four children: Humprey, 9; Chris, 7; Rebecca, 4; and Lucy, who is 7 months old. His wife is Susan Robi and she sells vegetables to help support the family.

Dominic is in the transport business with a motorcycle. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a fellow client. He is in need of buying spare parts for his motorcycle and the loan will come in handy to help him out. He intends to use the profits to cater to his family's needs.

His hope and dream is to build a permanent house for his family as they are currently living in a mud-thatched house.

loans.use: Buy motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Emvar Ulises

texts.es:
El Sr. H. Q. Emvar Ulises es conviviente, tiene dos hijas de 6 y 3 años. Viven en casa de sus padres con los cuales comparte sus gastos.
Se dedica a prestar servicios de arreglos de celulares en un puesto alquilado en una galería hace 2 años.
Además también se dedica a la venta de artículos de celulares y alquiler de disfraces.
Tiene buenas referencias personales y solicita el préstamo para incrementar su negocio y así poder brindarle mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Sr. H. Q. Emvar Ulises is partnered and has two daughters, 6- and 3-years old, respectively.  They live with his parents and share the household's expenses.  He has operated a cell phone repair busines for 2 years, in a stall that he rents at a local shopping center.  He also sells cell phone accessories and rents costumes.  He has good personal references and is applying for a loan to grow his business and, in turn, provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani lives in a three-room brick house with her husband and three children. Her house is located in the city of Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore is Pakistan’s second largest city and is known for its history and culture. She has lived there in an area named R-A Bazar for the past 11 years. 

Two of her children are enrolled in a school and are getting their education while the last one is only 3 years old. Her husband’s name is A. H. and he is a movie maker by profession. He offers his services at different occasions such as wedding ceremonies and birthday parties, etc.
 
Rani has proved herself as a great mother and housewife who not only takes care of her children very well but also made her house into a home with her good management skills. She is fond of cooking and cooks delicious and healthy food for her family. All the members of her family take care of her and respect her.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy a digital movie camera that will help him provide his customers a better quality movie of their occasions. 

He has been doing this business for past 18 years and Rani is hopeful that after this investment, his business will improve further. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has built a good credit record and never missed a single meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who holds the book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Rani.

loans.use: To buy a digital movie camera for movie-making business

loans.name: Hezekiah

texts.en:
Hezekiah hails from Kisii Town in Western Kenya. He is 67 and is married with 9 children, the majority are now adults. He has been in mixed farming for 20 years with his produce of coffee, maize, tea, sugarcane, bananas and milk sold locally  and to established co-operative societies.

He has requested this loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and maintain a dairy cow. He believes this will provide enough milk for the family and pay the education fees to educate children. He is also focusing on buying a vehicle in the next five years to help transport his produce to the market.

Hezekiah sees insecurity, low market prices and diseases as the greatest threats to the business.

loans.use: Purchase and maintain a dairy cow

loans.name: Yonn

texts.en: Yonn C. is 27 years old, married, and has one child who attends the local public school. She and her husband are working in the same business as potato and salt traders.  They sell their products to their villagers and in other provinces for income. They use their old motor-trailer to pick up their items for sale.  On average, this couple earns $10.50 a day from this business, and it can support their family. Unfortunately, their motor-trailer broke down while they were working. Yonn C. wishes to buy another one, but her savings are not enough to make the purchase. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to purchase a motor-trailer to replace the broken one.

loans.use: To purchase a motor-trailer to replace the broken one

loans.name: Teresa De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Teresa madre soltera mujer honesta y trabajadora, su objetivo es que sus hijos se preparen profesionalmente y que obtenga a un mejor nivel de vida. Labora como domestica y Aspira a un mejor trabajo para este año venidero. Tiene como planes seguir mejorando la infraestructura de su vivienda. 
Por medio de los préstamos que le ha brindado la institución ha logrado mejorar parte por parte su casa. Con este nuevo préstamo comprara: arena, cemento, hierro, bloques, piedra, clavos, reglones de madera para la construcción de un muro que separe su propiedad de otra, obteniendo seguridad para su hogar.
texts.en:
Teresa is a single mother; she’s an honest and hard working woman.  Her goal is that her children prepare themselves professionally and that she attains a better standard of living.

She works as a domestic employee and hopes to get a better job this New Year.  Her plans are to continue improving her house’s infrastructure.

Through the loans granted by the institution she has managed to improve her house bit by bit.  With this new loan she will buy: sand, cement, iron rods, concrete blocks, gravel, nails and wood beams to build a wall that will separate her property from the neighboring one thus obtaining security for her home.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen J. is 37 years old and married to Lucas Kibwamboe who is 41 years old and a farmer.  They are blessed with two children sharon Jerop aged 16 years and Gloria Jepngetich who is eight years old.  

Hellen owns a shop in Ndurio trading centre, she has been operating this business for a period of nine years and she is doing well and her monthly profits is Ksh.6300. She has borrowed a loan of Ksh. 20,000 from KADET this being her first loan.  Hellen intends to use this loan to purchase soap, sugar, tealeaves and salt for her shop.  

Hellen says that the profits plowed back from her business will be used as savings for her two school going children and also she hopes to open a supermarket in the near future.

loans.use: Purchase more stock bread, rice ,flour e.t.c  for sale

loans.name: Las Rositas De Novillero Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en casa D. L. señora Celia, una integrante del grupo Rositas D. Novillero,que está ubicado en novillero chico,colonia del estado D. veraC., L. señora Celia tiene una panadería que inicio hace 4 años,solicita el prestamo para L. compra D. materia prima para su negocio,sus compañeras y vecinas L. catalogan como una persona emprendedora,al momento D. solicitar este prestamo se siente muy contenta,tiene 35 años,estudio hasta L. primaria,vive en unión libre y tiene 2 hijos un hombre y una mujer,tambien espera que su negocio crezca mas asi como su clienteL.. El grupo esta conformado por 11 integrantes.
texts.en: This photo was taken at the home of Sra. Celia, a member of the group “Rositas D. Novillero”, which is located in Novillero Chico, a subdivision in the State of VeraC..  She has a bakery that she started four years ago.  Celia is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her business.  Her colleagues and neighbors consider her to be an enterprising individual.  Upon apply for her loan, Celia felt very happy.  She is 35 years old and has an elementary school education.  Celia is in a common law marriage and has two children, a son and a daughter.  She hopes that her business will grow as well as her customer base.  The group consists of eleven members.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en: Jonathan is a 31-year-old, hard-working man looking after 2 dependents living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. For 5 years he has been riding a motorcycle (taxi) and operating a retail shop. With the income generated, he has been able to support the family. He started with riding customers and later bought a motorcycle. His future plan is to own a wholesale business. Jonathan needs the loan to buy sugar, soap and salt for his shop.

loans.use: To buy sugar, soap and salt to sell

loans.name: César

texts.es:
Cesar es un padre de familia de 33 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a su  hijo en el caserío Wiracocha - Valle Los Incas ubicado en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

El cuenta con un terreno agrícola en donde suele sembrar mango y limón, el ya tiene varios años de experiencia en esta actividad y durante este tiempo ha llegado a conocer mucho sobre el manejo de cultivos. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades los utiliza para solventar la economía diaria de su familia.

Cesar desea comprar fertilizantes para así brindar mantenimiento a su terreno de cultivo para instalar una nueva plantación de limón. De esta manera obtendrá una buena cosecha. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Cesar is a 33 year-old father who lives together with his wife and child in the village of Wiracocha - Valley of the Incas, in Tambogrande district, an agricultural area of Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Cesar has a plot of land where he grows mangos and lemons.  He has several years experience in this activity and, over the years, he has learned a lot about managing his crops.  He uses the income that he makes from these activities to cover his family's daily financial needs.

Cesar would like to buy fertilizers so that he can maintain his land in order to set up a new lemon orchard.  This will enable him to obtain a good harvest.  In order to achieve his goal, Cesar is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To acquire fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Malyn

texts.en:
Malyn E. is from the village of Bolihon, Taglimao, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 32 years old. Malyn is married and has two children. To make a living, Malyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods, instant noodles & beverages in the local community. Malyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities. In the picture are Malyn & her younger son.

In 2008, Malyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Malyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 23,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Malyn is requesting a new loan of 26,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods & beverages. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Malyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods & beverages.

location.town: Bolihon, Taglimao, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Orienta

loans.name: Maria Riselda

texts.en:
Maria Riselda works hard to support her family. Maria Riselda is married and has a ready to wear (clothing) business in the Philippines.

Maria Riselda requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more products.

Maria Riselda has been in this business for three years now and also earns additional income from her sari-sari store.

In the future, Maria Riselda would like to send her kids to school and have her house repaired.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Reina Isaura

texts.es: Reina Isaura G. C. de 38 años de edad, vive  en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos. Doña Reina vive en condiciones muy humildes y durante mucho tiempo a trabajado duro para poder ayudar  a sus hijos a que sigan estudiando. Tiene un  puesto de tortillas dentro de su casa ubicado en el Municipio de Nuevo Cuscatlán Departamento de La Libertad. Durante años ha trabajado en este negocio ya que siempre tiene muchos clientes que la buscan debido a  que sus tortillas siempre están a la hora. Doña Reina quiere mejorar la calidad de su servicio, ofreciendo más tortillas para así poder satisfacer a más personas y lograr a traer a más clientes ya que se encuentra ubicada en una zona muy estratégica y transitada. Solicita este crédito a INTEGRAL para poder invertir en la materia prima como: maíz, agua, gas propano y darle mantenimiento a su plancha para que siempre este en buenas condiciones y se pueda ofrecer un mejor servicio a los clientes y lograr obtener mayores ingresos con los cuales pueda seguir ayudando a sus hijos para que sigan estudiando.
texts.en:
Reina Isaura Guzman C. is 38 years old, and she lives at home with her four children. Reina lives in very humble conditions, and she has worked hard for a long time to help her children continue with their studies. She has a tortilla stall in her house, located in the Nuevo Cusclatan Municipality in the La Libertad Department. Reina has worked at her tortilla stall for years, and she always has a lot of customers, since her tortillas are always ready on time. She hopes to improve the quality of her service, offering more tortillas to be able to satisfy more people, attracting more customers as she is located in a heavily trafficked and very strategic area.

Reina is applying for a loan from INTEGRAL to invest in primary materials, such as corn, water, and propane gas, as well as to do some maintenance on her grill so that it is always in good condition. This investment will help her offer a better service to her clients, and get more income, with which she can continue to finance children's studies.

loans.use: to buy primary materials, such as corn, water and propane gas, as well as to do maintenance work on her grill.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Sem V., 28, is married and resides in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-angkorean temples. V. is a worker in Thailand, earning an income of about USD 5 per day. His wife is employed at the garment factory, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 11 on food and USD 30 on the other necessary expenses. V. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a new motorbike for the family use. This will be his second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike for the family use

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to take a shop for rent in a fair place

loans.name: Sebastián

texts.es:
El Sr. Sebastián es casado, tiene 66 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pilar, en el Barrio Obrero, tiene casa propia, donde posee las condiciones básicas para desarrollar sus actividades dentro del seno familar y movilidad propia (moto).
El se dedica a la venta de mercaderías de primera necesidad, gaseosas y otras mercaderías. Desarrolla esta actividad hace como 4 años, posee la insfraestructura necesaria para el desarrollo de esta actividad y su local es muy reconocido en la vecindad.
Solicita el crédito para invertir en la compra de materia prima para mejorar sus ingresos con el aumento del negocio, como gaseosas, golosinas, artículos de limpieza para el hogar, detergentes, desodorantes de ambiente, lavandina, entre otros.
texts.en:
Mr. Sebastián is married, 66 years old and lives in the city of Pilar in the Barrio Obrero area. He has his own home and has all of the basics to develop his work in his own home and transport (a motorcycle).

Mr. Sebastián sells basic household goods including refreshments and other merchandize. He has worked in this field for some 4 years, he has the infrastructure necessary to do his work and his stall is very well known in the neighborhood.

Mr. Sebastián needs the loan to buy raw materials and refreshments, candy, household cleaning products, detergents, and air fresheners to improve his earnings by increasing his business sales.

loans.use: buy basic household goods like refreshments, household cleaning products, candy, etc.

loans.name: Joyline

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Joyline works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from meat vending. Joyline has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF.

Joyline is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell for her vegetable vending business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Fotemogoban  A Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe FOTEMOGOBAN A sont tous des femmes mariées, elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 32  ans, ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivent avec leurs maries et enfants à KAPALA, un village situé à environ 17 km de la ville de SIKASSO 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur premier cycle de prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire leurs besoins en moyen de production et en intrant agricole. 
Ce groupe de femme fait la culture du pois sucré, du maïs, d’arachide etc.
FARIMA, qui est assise l’enfant en main, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 3 sacs d’urée, 2 sacs de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage. Après les récoltes les produits sont stockés pendant une certaine période avant d’être vendus à des clients venant un peu de partout de la région de Sikasso. Le pois est surtout vendu à des industrielles qui le transforme en jus pour la vente sur place et pour l’exportation. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 35.000 à 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Les 10 membres du groupe FOTEMOGOBAN A sont tous des femmes mariées, elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 32  ans, ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivent avec leurs maries et enfants à KAPALA, un village situé à environ 17 km de la ville de SIKASSO 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur premier cycle de prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire leurs besoins en moyen de production et en intrant agricole. 
Ce groupe de femme fait la culture du pois sucré, du maïs, d’arachide etc.
FARIMA, qui est assise l’enfant en main, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 3 sacs d’urée, 2 sacs de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage. Après les récoltes les produits sont stockés pendant une certaine période avant d’être vendus à des clients venant un peu de partout de la région de Sikasso. Le pois est surtout vendu à des industrielles qui le transforme en jus pour la vente sur place et pour l’exportation. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 35.000 à 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants et payer les frais de labours

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie works hard to support her family. She is single and has a candle-making business in the Philippines.

Margie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy wax, coloring materials, wicks and a variety of containers for her candle-making. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Margie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy wax, coloring materials, wicks and a variety of containers for her candle-making.

loans.name: Soeum

texts.en: To earn a living, Mrs. Soeum sells some study materials and other merchandise to students who attend her local school. She shares responsibility with Mr. Soeun, her husband, who always goes to the river to catch fresh fish using a variety of fishing tools. Mrs. Soeum has been running her retail business since 2010, earning  around $4 each day to cover expenses for the family. Mrs. Soeum now has four young children; all of them are students in the local school. Mrs. Soeum would like to request a loan to buy more merchandise to sell. With the rest of funding, she will buy some fishing equipment for her husband to catch more fish.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell and to buy some fishing equipment for her husband to catch more fish.

loans.name: Aliou

texts.fr:
Aliou est agé de 37 ans. C'est un homme marié avec 5 enfants. Il est boutiquier, métier auquel il associe à l'activité d'embauche bovine. Il a d'abord exercé dans la boutique de son oncle avant de s'associer avec son grand frèrepour mettre en place leur propre boutique d'alimentatio générale.
Pour L'élevage, Aliou est un habitué car grandissant dans une zone où  l'elevage est prédominant. Ainsi il souhaitait un prêt de 300 000 FCFA pour préparer une opération Tabaski (fête musulmane appelée fête du sacrifice) où les moutons font bon marché.
texts.en:
Aliou is 37. He is a married man with five children. He runs a small shop, and he also raises livestock. He worked first in his uncle's shop before getting together with his older brother to start up their own general store. 

As for tending livestock, Aliou is experienced since he grew up in an area where livestock raising predominates. Thus he is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs CFA to get ready for Tabaski (a Muslim feast day called "feast of the sacrifice") where sheep are sold in great numbers.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Kodjo Tonton

texts.fr:
Kodjo  est un homme âgé de 45 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse. Il a 02 enfants. 
Kodjo  travaille comme revendeur des chaussures, des ordinateurs des quincailleries depuis 2004. Il vend à ses clients à HEDZRANAWOE. Il achète les produits à Lomé. 
Kodjo  a requis son troisième cycle de prêt crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter des chaussures femmes, des ordinateurs, des quincailleries.
texts.en: Kodjo is 45 years old and the father of two children. He is married to a retailer. He has been selling shoes, computers and hardware since 2004. He buys his products in Lomé and sells them to his customers in Hedzranawoè. Kodjo came to the microfinance institution WAGES and applied for his third loan to buy women's shoes, computers and hardware.

loans.use: to buy hardware and shoes.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is a 66-year-old widow with three children. She has been running a sari-sari (variety) store for eight years. She also earns an income from a food and coffee shop.

Fely works hard to provide for her family. She has borrowed and paid off thirteen loans from NWTF before this loan. She is now requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to purchase additional inventory to sell in her store.

Fely aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory to sell in her store.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 30 years old and married with three children.  Two of which are in school.  He does mixed farming such as rearing sheep and goats as well as growing wheat.  John has been successful in growing wheat for the past eight years.

He learned about KADET LTD through a KADET staff member.  He is a good client and has applied for his first loan which he plans to spend part in farming and the remaining amount to purchase more animals.

He hopes to make a profit and educate his children.  He also dreams and hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more farming supplies and animals.

loans.name: Jursun's Group

texts.en:
Jursun is the treasurer of this group. She is 59, and unfortunately she is a widow. She is bringing up a fourteen year old, who studies at school. Jursun cultivates agricultural products, and by selling some part of the harvest she earns money to meet their daily needs. 

At the moment, Jursun’s son works in Russia in Sochi. Two years ago he transferred his mom 15,000 soms, and with that amount Jursun started to breed livestock.  She applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase hay for her livestock. In the future Jursun wants to provide her daughter with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase hay for livestock.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Provincia  do mesmo nome, sul  de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 6 filhos todos maiores de idade. Frequenta o 2º ano do Instituto Comercial. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

É  comerciante ha mais de 15 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 2.000.00mt e uma pensão militar de 8.924.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Já teve emprestimos noutros bancos (BIM) e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção DE capoeiras para producao de frangos de corte (ferro, areia, pedra, cimento e outros) para garantir o crescimento do seu negocio.  
Compromete-se a pagar sem problemas e no futuro pretende solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku para ampliar a sua actividade comercial e obter maiores rendimentos.
texts.en:
Cristina was born in the city of Maputo in the Province of the same name in the south of Mozambique, is married and the mother of 6 children, all adults. She attends 2nd year of the Commercial Institute. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else.

She has been a trader for more than 15 years and has a monthly income of around 2,000.00 meticals (MZN) and a military pension of 8,924.00 MZN which she uses on household expenditures and saves in her bank account (BIM).

She has had loans from other banks (BIM) and managed to pay those off without difficulty. She came to know Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her second loan with Hluvuku for the value of 20,000.00 MZN, with which she intends to purchase materials for the construction of chicken coops for the production of chickens for slaughter (iron, sand, rock, cement and others) to guarantee the growth of her business.

She commits to paying off the loan without problems and in the future intends to solicit more loans from Hluvuku to increase her commercial activity and obtain a greater income.

loans.use: purchase materials for the construction of chicken coops (iron, sand, rock, cement and others)

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en: Ashraf has almost seven years of experience working as a car mechanic. He is a 22-year-old Lebanese single man living with one parent and a sibling. He is specialized in car electric repairs. His shop is situated in his town, where he is known for his good business reputation and great customer service. Today, he is asking to borrow $1200 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new electric tools and supplies [to replace] the used ones. He states that with the new equipment he will be able to better serve his customers.

loans.use: to purchase new electric tools and supplies

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
Luz es una madre de familia de 31 años, vive con su hija en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Bambamarca que pertenece al departamento de Cajamarca.  Esta zona tiene como actividad la agricultura y ganadería.

Desde hace algunos años Luz se dedica a la venta diaria de menestras y granos cocidos en el interior del mercado de la ciudad donde vive, tiene su propia clientela a quien ofrece sus productos.  Ha creído conveniente en solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de  3000 nuevos soles para comprar más menestras y granos para seguir cocinando y luego venderlas, también para realizar algunos arreglos en su vivienda y con los ingresos que obtenga con las ventas de sus productos podrá cubrir su crédito y tener más comodidades en su casa para su hija.

Luz es una mujer responsable, trabajadora y honesta que lo único que quiere es sacar a su hija adelante brindándole otras oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
Luz is a 31 year-old housewife. She lives with her daughter in their own house, which has water and electricity service. It is located in Bambamarca district, which is part of Cajamarca department. People in this area make their living from farming and livestock-raising.

For a few years now, Luz has sold cooked legumes and grains daily, inside the market of the city where she lives.  She has her own clientele, to whom she sells her products.  

She decided to apply to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles, in order to buy more legumes and grains, so that she can continue cooking and selling them. She will also carry out a few home repairs. With the income she gets from selling her products, she will be able to pay off the loan, and have more home comforts for her daughter.

Luz is a responsible, hard-working, and honest woman.  All she wants is to help her daughter get ahead in life, by offering her other opportunities in life.

loans.use: To buy more legumes and grains in order to continue cooking and selling them, and also carry out a few home repairs.

loans.name: Grecia

texts.es: La socia actualmente sigue con el negocio familiar de la venta de materiales de construcción, la socia vende por ejemplo, arena, ormigon, grama, cemento, ladrillos, fierros, bloqueta entre otros materiales, la socia también aprovecha de su poder de convencimiento y se esta dedicando a la venta de productos de belleza a sus amistades y en general por catalogos, ella trabaja con dos lineas muy conocidas en el país y reparte sus catalogos le piden los productos y ella les da los productos a sus amistades, la socia es aún estudiante de la carrera de Psicología en la misma universidad y esta avanzando mucho y pronto obtendra su grado. La socia en esta ocasión también requiere el prestamo para invertir en la compra de materiales como arena, cemento, grama para implementar el negocio familiar.
texts.en:
The member (Grecia) continues working in the family business of selling building materials. She sells for examples, sand, concrete, grass, cement bricks, iron, blocks and other items.
