The member also takes advantage of her power of persuasion by selling beauty products to her friends from catalogs, working with two well known brands in her country. She passes out her catalogs and they order the goods and she gives her friends the products. 

The member is still at the same university as a Psychology student and is making good progress and will soon attain her degree. 

She is asking for a loan in order to buy materials such as sand, cement, and grass in order to carry out the family business.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, and grass in order to carry out the family business.

loans.name: Lubov

texts.ru:
Любовь занимается сельским хозяйством в селе Великая Знаменка. Она замужем, воспитала двух сыновей и дочь, которые уже взрослые и живут самостоятельно. Любовь выращивает ранние помидоры вот уже 27 лет. У нее есть 2 большие теплицы, два участка земли. Овощами торгует прямо из дома, который расположен прямо на трассе. В хозяйство у нее вложено 40 000 гривен. Ежегодно затраты на семена и пленку составляют 12 000 гривен. 

Любовь необходим кредит в 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы построить новую теплицу для выращивания помидор. Постройка дополнительной теплицы позволит увеличить прибыль. Любовь – пенсионерка, ей очень нравится заниматься фермерством, это то, к чему у нее лежит душа. Она планирует и дальше развивать свой бизнес, который является очень перспективным для данного региона.  
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Lubov is involved in agriculture in the Velikaya Znamenka village.  She is married and raised two sons and a daughter, who are already adults and live independently.  Lubov has been growing early tomatoes for 27 years.  She has two large greenhouses and two plots of land.  She sells vegetables right from her house that is located by a highway.  Lubov has 40,000 hryvnia invested into her business.  Annual expenses for seeds and plastic add up to 12,000 hryvnia.  Lubov needs a loan in the sum of 10,000 hryvnia to build a new greenhouse for growing tomatoes.  Construction of a new greenhouse will allow her to increase her profit.  Lubov is a retiree and likes to be involved in farming very much, as it is something that she has a calling for.  She plans to continue growing her business, which is very promising for this region.

loans.use: to build a new greenhouse for growing tomatoes

loans.name: Lelis

texts.es: El señor Lelis es cliente antiguo de la institución desde el año 2007, el es carpintero, casado su familia la integra  cuatro hijos, tres en edad escolar y un niño de cuatro años, el señor Lelis y su esposa trabajan como carpinteros desde mas  de 25 años, es excelente en el trabajo que realiza, elaboran todo tipo de muebles, sus dos hijos mayores y su esposa le ayudan en todo el trabajo y su hijo mayor de 18 años ya elabora muebles. Ellos tienen un taller en la casa de su suegra ubicada en la zona Nuevo Amanecer y ellos vive en la Cota Cota  en la casa de sus parientes donde construyo su departamento, el en este momento tiene un trabajo para en acabado fino de muebles, donde necesita material para tal trabajo como ser la compra de madera, barniz, laca mate, gasolina, etc. razón por que solicita el crédito.
texts.en: Lelis has been a longstanding client of the institution since 2007.  He’s a carpenter.  He’s married and his family is composed of four children, three of them are school aged and one is a four-year-old.  Lelis and his wife have worked as carpenters for over 25 years.  He is excellent in the work he does.  They make all kinds of furniture.  His two oldest children and his wife help him in all the work and his 18-year-old son is already manufacturing furniture.  They have a workshop located at his mother-in-law’s house located in the Nuevo Amanecer zone; they live in Cota Cota in a family member’s house where he built his apartment.  At the moment, he has a job that needs its final fine finishing touches.  He needs materials for this job such as lumber, varnish, matte lacquer, gasoline, etc. and this is the reason for the loan request.

loans.use: to buy lumber, varnish, matte lacquer, gasoline, etc.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.es:
Teresita vive en un hermoso lugar de Costa Rica llamado las Nubes de Coronado, su casa es tipica de la zona rural costarricense,ahí vive con uno de sus hermanos. Hace algunos años dejo el trabajo que tenia y decidió montar un negocio en uno de los aposentos de su casa,ahi tiene todo tipo de regalos, adornos cosmeticos y articulos de libreria que ofrece a los vecinos del lugar brindandoles la oportunidad de conseguir lo que necesitan sin tener que trasladarse al área mas comercial, lo que les demanda mucho tiempo, pues el autobus no pasa con frecuencia.
Al acercarse la época navideña Teresita quiere abastecer su local con artículos que sean de conveniencia para sus vecinos y clientes, y es por eso que  ha acudido a buscar un nuevo  crédito en procura de aumentar sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos en esta navidad que se avecina.
texts.en:
Teresita lives in a beautiful place in Costa Rica called las Nubes de Coronado. Her home is typical of the rural Costa Rican area, and she lives here with one of her brothers.  A few years ago, she left the job that she had and decided to open a business in one of the rooms of her house. Here she has all type of gifts, cosmetics, and stationary items which she offers to neighbors, providing them with the opportunity to obtain what they need without traveling to a more commercial area. This trip takes a good deal of time since the bus does not run frequently.

As the Christmas season approaches, Teresita would like to stock her store with items that will be of interest to her neighbors and customers. For this reason, she has requested a new loan in hopes of increasing her sales, and in turn, her income during the approaching Christmas season.

loans.use: To purchase inventory such as clothing, cleaners and books

loans.name: Chem's Group

texts.en:
Chem is 46 years old, married and has three children. His children work at the Thai border. To earn a living, he farms on his two-hectare plot of farmland in a village of the Moung Russey district, which he has been doing for more than 35 years.

Chem leads a group of two members. He has been with VisionFund for five years, while his fellow group member began with VisionFund for this loan term. The previous loans have provided him with sufficient capital to operate his business and to generate regular income. He is now applying for another loan to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for his farmland. With the loan proceeds, he hopes to increase his crop yield and to thereby improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase rice seeds and fertilizer for his farmland

loans.name: Julia Teresa

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Florón de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Renacer.

En este lugar vive la señora  Julia, ella tiene 43 años y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual  tiene dos hijos de  19 y 18 años de edad,  los mismos  aun viven con ella y estudian en la universidad. Está desde hace 7 ciclos  en el Banco Comunal y nos cuenta que le agrada por la forma como trabaja la institución, ya con los créditos se ha ayudado a muchas personas como a su esposo y a su familia.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que realiza el crédito para su esposo el cual se  dedica al comercio, tiene una carnicería en el centro de la ciudad  en el cual vende carne , más que todo carne de chancho, su esposo trabaja todos los días desde las 5h00 hasta las 15h00, en las mañanas vende en su local y luego en las tardes el se deslaza al campo a compra los chanchos para luego llevarlos a los centros de faenamiento y así tiene carne para la venta del próximo dia.  El lleva más de 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien.
 
Este crédito es para comprar chanchos para la venta de la semana que va a ser muy buena.
 
Su sueño es comprar un carro ya que para comprar los chanchos fletan transporte.
texts.en:
In the fortress El Florón of the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí known for many years ago as the city of the real tamarinds, the associates of the "Reborn" communal bank gather every fifteen days.  

In this place lives señora Julia.  She is 43 years old and she has two children ages 19 and 18 who live with her and study in the university.  She has had 7 loan cycles with the Communal Bank and she tells us that she is pleased with the way that the institution works.  The loans have helped many people like her husband and family.

She is a great housewife who requests the loan for her husband who is in commerce.  He has a meat market in the center of the city in which he sells meat, especially pork.  Her husband works every day from 5AM to 3PM.  In the mornings he sells in his market and in the afternoon he goes to the field to buy pigs in order to take them to the slaughter house and thus have meat for sale the next day.  He has carried out this business for more than 8 years and it goes very well.  This loan will be used to buy pigs to sell in the week when sales are very good. It is his dream to buy a car so that he does not have to pay for transporting the pigs.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Elfrida

texts.es: Elfrida tiene 34 años, está divorciada, pero tiene 02 hijos, con quienes vive en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Elfrida es una mujer de buenos principios, y nos comenta que desde que separó de su esposo tuvo que afrontar sola los gastos de la casa. Es así que emprendió un negocio que es una Jugueria, ahí preprara jugos de diversas y ricas frutas y esto le ha dado mucha rentabilidad. Sin embargo para conseguir frutas le es dificila, pues alguno son escasos y otros sus precios son elevados. Generalmente trabaja con el apoyo de un ayudante, quien la facilita en pelar las frutas, mientras que ella prepara los jugos. En un futuro desea abrir una fuente de soda y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos. Este será su segundo credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 soles lo invertirá en la compra de una licuadora, frutas y materiales para ambientar su puesto.
texts.en:
Elfrida is 34 and divorced, but has two children, with whom she lives in her own house, located in Pichari district. 

Elfrida is a woman with good principles, and tells us that since she separated from her husband, she has had to cope with the household expenses on her own. This is why she launched a business, which is a juice stand. There she prepares juices from various delicious fruits, and this has provided her with good earnings.

However, it is difficult for her to get fruit, as some are scarce, and the prices of others are high. 

Normally, she works with the support of a helper, who makes the work easier for her by peeling the fruit, while she prepares the juices. In the future, she wishes to open a soda fountain, and so be able to have better income. This will be her second loan with MFP, so she promises to make her instalment payments on time. 

She will use the 1,500 soles for the purchase of a blender, as well as fruit, and materials for running her stand.

loans.use: To buy a blender, fruit, and materials for running her stand.

loans.name: Aissatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe crée depuis Mai 2011,est constitué de 5 membres qui habitent tous dans la même localité.Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Assatel,se trouvant debout a droite de la photo et levant le bras, est notre emprunteuse vedette.Elle est mariée et mére de cinq enfants dont quatre garçons et une fille.Elle effectue le commerce de détail comme activité principale.

Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 03 sacs de 100kg de fonio dont 750f le kg, 30 sacs de pain de singe dont 3500f le sac de 50kg,40l d'huile de palme a 30000f le total,40l de miel d'une valeur de 60000f, 02sacs d'arachide décortiqué a 30000f le sac et un sac d'arachide non décortiqué a 8000f.Le reste constitue a payer le transport.

Pour son bénéfice,elle compte renforcer son épargne,payer les études de son fils qui fait une formation a Dakar et finaliser les travaux de sa maison.

loans.use: acheter des marchandises

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa P. was born in Bolivar, Ecuador, but she moved to Guayaquil roughly fifteen years ago. She is married with two children, and she sells fresh ice cream to the community via her mobile cart, as well as the various stationary locations she has opened. She started this business because she thought she could be successful. Her husband has worked at an ice cream factory as a distributor for the last several years. Ninfa now earns more than her husband. Working every day of the week, Ms. P. has been successful so far. Located near a major street, “Helados Ninfa” receives a lot of traffic. She is asking for this loan to be able to buy another freezer and to increase production of ice cream.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about Ecuadorian businesses and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: buy another freezer and to increase production of ice cream.

loans.name: Yagut

texts.en: Yagut is a resident of Beylagan region. In 2002 she applied to Normicro Beylagan branch and borrowed $400. For this loan she rented a building and started sales of pharmaceutical goods. Subsequent loans in amount of $600$ and $800 were used for the same purpose. She needs new loans to increase the variety of goods.

loans.use: To increase the stock

loans.name: Laki

texts.en: Laki is a 40-year-old mother of four children. Laki works hard to support her family by selling coconut water (locally referred to as a Niu drink). In Samoa, cracking a coconut and sticking a straw in it to drink the water is a favorite refreshment. Laki buys fresh coconuts from local villagers, and then she transports the coconut supply across the Samoan countryside to sell to hotels and in the larger Samoan markets. Laki is anxious to continue to offer the best service possible and ensure a consistent supply, so she is applying for a small loan to help her do this. Laki knows that with the South Pacific Games coming to Samoa later in the year, coconuts at hotels and markets will be in even larger demand.  So she is anxious to keep investing in her business so that she can meet this large demand later in the year.

loans.use: Financing for purchasing coconut inventory

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en: Memuna S. is married with six children.  She sells cotton clothes in the Magburaka town of Sierra Leone.  In Sierra Leone, women play a vital role in earning income for the families through running various small businesses but always lack capital to start, expand or build small shop and stalls. Memuna would like to improve her business stall and diversify her business with other types of clothes.  Therefore she is seeking a second loan of $200 from SMT.

loans.use: Diversify her stock of clothes and renovate her market stall

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
TRANSLATED BY MATT FLANNERY

Mrs. Julia, is 59 years of age, is unmarried and has three children; two twins of 29 years of age, both educated, are married and independent, and the son of 26 years lives with her. 

Julia is dedicated to the sale of artisan crafts by traveling, crossing house tp house, mainly  table cloths of ao poi (woven typical Paraguayan.  She has been at it 10 years and learned from her mother. Soon with time they have profit and have independence thanks to effort and sacrifice.

Nowadays, thanks to their  figting spirit they have a beautiful house with all the comforts, fulfilled their dream to educate their children and give a roof where they live. The success can be attributed to perserverance, and also the good administration that she herself lends to her business. 

They need the loan to construct a room next to the house to be able to bring their mother to live with them so they can work together in the making of the crafts because she is living now 20 km from the city of Carapeguá.



ORIGINAL SPANISH
La señora Julia, tiene 59 años de edad, es soltera y tiene tres hijos; dos de ellas mellizas que tienen 29 años de edad, ambas son docentes, casadas e independientes, y el varón de 26 años vive con ella.

Julia se dedica a la venta de artículos artesanales a crédito de forma ambulante, recorriendo casa por casa,  principalmente sobrecamas y manteles de ao poi (tejido típico paraguayo) 
Se había iniciado como tejedora de sobrecamas desde los 10 años que lo aprendió de su madre con quien trabajo realizando esta actividad durante varios años. Luego con el tiempo logro su independencia gracias a su esfuerzo y sacrificio, saliendo ella misma a vender lo que producían obteniendo mayores utilidades.

Hoy día gracias a su espíritu de lucha tiene una hermosa casa con todas las comodidades, cumplió con su sueño de hacer estudiar a sus hijos y darle un techo en donde vivir. Su éxito atribuye a la perseverancia, y también la buena administración que ella misma le da a  su negocio.
Necesita el crédito para construir una habitación al lado de su vivienda para así poder traer a su madre a vivir con ella y de esa forma volver a trabajar juntas en la elaboración de las artesanías ya que ella está viviendo actualmente en una compañía a 20 Km. de la ciudad de Carapeguá.

loans.use: Construcción de una habitación adicional en su casa.

loans.name: Dulce Maria

texts.es:
Hello. My name is Dulce and I am an entrepreneur. I own and operate a small business selling toys and plastic products. I also design and create jewelry. I have dedicated myself to my businesses for several years and they help provide income that allows me to help cover my family’s expenses. With the holiday season fast approaching and being that this is the time of year in which I experience an increase in sales, I would like to increase my inventory. Currently, I am in negotiations to purchase the building in which my store is located from the current owner.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Dulce mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un pequeño negocio de venta de Juguetes, productos plasticos y tambien a la elaboración de joyas, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia, tomando en cuenta que se aproxima la epoca de navidad necesito surtir mas mi negocio ya que es la espoca de mayor venta, actualmente estoy en planes de comprar este local donde tengo mi negocio ya que la dueña lo esta vendiendo.

loans.use:
Purchase of toys, home appliances, plastic goods, and material for making jewelry

Compra de juguetes, electrodomesticos, produstos plasticos y material para elaborar joyas.

loans.name: Ni Made Sekar

texts.id:
At harvest time, Ni Made Sekar starts to get busy in his rice fields. Besides looking after her children, she also needs to look after their workers to harvest their rice. Rice harvest is once a year. Loan from Dinari is used to buy fertilizers so that the rice could grow better and well at harvest time to receive maximal results. Income received of Rp4000,000 (about US$420) not yet subtracted by fertilizer cost anf worker's salary. After calculated the nett profit is Rp 2000,000 (about US$210). This profit is used as addition to houshold expenses, since only these rice fields are the main income of Ni Made Sekar , and her husband I Ketut Sudamia. The upcoming loan will be used to buy superior rice seeds, so that the results are more maximal.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Bila masa panen tiba, Ni Made Sekar mulai sibuk disawah. Selain mengurus anak-anaknya, Ni Made Sekar juga mengawasi pekerja atau buruh yang dibayar untuk memanen padinya. Panen padi terjadi 1 tahun sekali. Modal pinjaman yang didapat dari Dinari digunakan untuk membeli pupuk, agar padi yang dipelihara bisa tumbuh dengan baik dan subur sehingga pada saat panen Ni Made Sekar bisa menerima hasil yang maksimal. Keuntungan yang diterima sebesar Rp. 4.000.000.- belum dikurangi pembelian pupuk dan ongkos pekerja. Setelah dihitung keuntungan bersih Rp.2.000.000,-. Keuntungan ini digunakan untuk tambahan dalam memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya, karena hanya sawah yang menjadi mata pencaharian Ni Made Sekar dan suaminya, I Ketut Sudamia. Pinjaman yang akan datang akan digunakan untuk membeli bibit padi unggul, agar hasilnya lebih maksimal.

loans.use:
To buy fertilizer

Membeli pupuk

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Shahnaz B. is married to Muhammad Waris. She is a resident of Lahore and a mother of eight children. Shahnaz currently needs a loan of US$350 to purchase both old and new shoes for sale in a shoes store which her husband operates in an old and used items market. Shahnaz and her husband's business is very small, and they need to expand it to increase their income.

loans.use: Purchase of old and new shoes for sale in a store

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Phạm Thị Hải is 51 years old. She lives in Kim Động, Hưng Yên with her husband and their 30 years old son. Her main occupation is raising calves and piglets. Usually she buys calves and piglets, stocks them then resells after a couple of months. Each year, she sells about 4 batches. and makes a profit of 500 USD each round. Her husband and son help her out with everything. She wishes to obtain a loan of 950 USD this time to expand her animal husbandry business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Phạm Thị Hải, 51 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 1 con trai năm nay 30 tuổi. Gia đình chị sống tại Kim Động, Hưng Yên. Công việc chính của chị là chăn nuôi lợn, bò. Thường chị Hải đi mua lợn con và bê về nuôi, sau đó vài tháng bán lại khi được giá. Một năm trung bình chị bán ra 4 lứa, mỗi lần thu về khoảng 500USD. Chồng và con trai chị luôn giúp đỡ chị đắc lực trong mọi công việc gia đình. Chị mong muốn tiếp tục được vay 950USD để mua bò và lợn con nhằm mở rộng dự án chăn nuôi.

loans.use: Buy calves and pigs

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.fr:
Mrs. Madeleine A. was born in 1968 in COTONOU, she is married and the mother of 6 children.  She is a big retailer of smoked shrimps; a product that is quite expensive and is in high demand among the population of BENIN and that of the countries of the West African sub-region. Mrs. Madeleine A., whose activity is booming, is a big supplier of shrimps both inside and outside the country. She is requesting a loan to finance her activity in order to satisfy her customers domestically as well as outside the country, notably the giant neighbor NIGERIA- high consumer of smoked shrimps. 
Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Née vers 1968 à COTONOU, Dame A. Madeleine est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle est une grande revendeuse des crevettes fumées; un produit qui coûte assez chère et très recherché par la population du BENIN et celle des pays de la sous région ouest africaine. Grande fournisseur des crevettes à l’intérieur du pays comme à l’extérieur, Dame A. Madeleine dont l'activité est en plein essor sollicite ce prêt pour financer son activité afin de satisfaire la demande tant à l’intérieur qu’à l’extérieur du pays notamment celle du géant voisin le NIGERIA, grand demandeur de crevettes fumées.

loans.use: Purchase of 10 bowls  of fresh shrimps

loans.name: Yenediet De Los Ange

texts.es:
This young 22-year-old woman is married and lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood with her husband and one-year-old son. Her husband works selling tomatoes at the market, and she sells clothing. They live with her mother while they work to buy their own home in which to raise their daughter and have more children. She began her business 3 years ago and is currently requesting this loan to buy a batch of clothes from a pawn shop that sells them at a good price. She will only have to invest in cleaning the cleans in order to earn 100% from their resell, a good investment for her.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Esta joven de 22 años de edad, es casada y habita en el Barrio de Laureles Sur junto a su esposo y un pequeño de 1 año de edad, su marido vende tomates en el mercado y ella vende prendas al crédito de oro y plata. Viven en casa de su madre mientras consiguen comprarse su propia casita en la que puedan criar a su hija y hacer crecer a la familia. Hace 3 años empezó este negocio y ahora solicita un crédito para comprar un lote de prendas a la venta en un negocio de empeño, las cuales son vendidas en un buen precio y solo invierte en limpiarlas, ha esto le gana el 100% y representa una buen inversion para ella.

loans.use: To buy a batch of clothes for her business

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia considers herself a hardworking, responsible and happy person. She started her business as a means to make a living, given the present very difficult financial situation. In this way, she can support her children, some of which are still in school. She started in May 2004, when a friend convinced her to start selling second-hand clothes, which are in great demand and have a good profit margin. She started at home, then, on the days when she didn’t have to work as house aid, at ambulant markets. At times, at the houses where she worked, she would be given used clothes, which she would sell, in addition to the ones she would buy wholesale.

She is requesting a $300 loan, to be repaid in six months, in order to buy lighter warm season clothes, as she wants to have a good stock to offer to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Antonia se considera una persona muy trabajadora, responsable y alegre. Inició el negocio para tener un medio de subsistir, ya que la situación económica actualmente es muy difícil y, de esta manera, puede sacar adelante a sus hijos, algunos de los cuales todavía estudian. Comenzó en Mayo de 2004, cuando una amiga la convenció de que vendiera ropa usada, ya que ésta se vende mucho y deja una buena ganancia. Se animó a comenzar en su casa y luego en los mercados ambulantes, los días que no le tocaba trabajar en casas. A veces, en las casas donde trabaja, también le regalan ropa usada en buenas condiciones, la cual aprovecha para vender, aparte de la que ella compra a mayoreo.

Solicita un préstamo por US $300, que pagará en 6 meses, para comprar ropa de temporada de calor, ya que en esta época la gente usa prendas de vestir más ligeras y quiere tener un buen surtido que ofrecerles a sus clientes.

loans.use: Buy warm season clothes.

loans.name: Octavia

texts.es:
Octavia belongs to the Communal Bank “El Progreso,” her business is selling prepared and a la carte dishes. Her business is located at Jr. 13 de diciembre, district and province of Huaraz, Ancash state

With the S/.1,700.00 nuevos soles loan, which will be repaid in 6 payments, she will buy products to replenish her stock and be able to offer good service to her customers such as: 2 sacks of rice, 1 bag of sugar, 4 bags of noodles, 2 cases of oil, 3 packages of pop in 6 packs, 3 cases of personal size pop and other products needed daily such as chicken, meat, etc.

She is 40 years old, has been separated for 20 years, she has one daughter who is an adult professional whom she has raised and educated by herself. Every day Octavia continues to work so that her business generates greater income for her.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Octavia pertenece al Banco Comunal "El Progreso", se dedica a la venta de menú y platos a la carta, su negocio esta ubicada en el Jr. 13 de diciembre, distrito y provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash, es una zona con bastante afluencia de publico.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700.00, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará productos para poder abastecer su Stock y poder brindar un buen servicio a su clientela como: 2 sacos de arroz, 1 bolsa de azúcar, 4 bolsas de fideos, 2 cajas de aceite, 3 paquetes de gaseosas de 6 unidades, 3 cajas de gaseosas personales y otros productos de necesidad diaria como pollo, carne, etc.

Ella tiene 40 años es separada hace 20 años, tiene una hija profesional que ella a educado sola y día a día sigue trabajando para que su negocio le genere mayores ingresos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell in her store.

loans.name: Sarth

texts.en: Sarth S., 36, is married and lives in the Kampong Cham with her four children. She works in the fields as a farmer, making US$3 each day, while her husband, Im Chhun, is a fisherman who typically makes US$4.50 each day. Two of their children work in the garment factories, making US$100 each per month, while the other two children are enrolled in a primary school. She has asked for a loan of US$400 to purchase some new fishing tools for her husband and to purchase fertilizer for her own business. She believes that with some new tools her husband can generate more income and the fertilizer can improve her yields. In the future, she would like to continue expanding her family’s two businesses.

loans.use: To purchase fishing tools and fertilizer

loans.name: Hortensia Estanislad

texts.es:
Hortensia started the business because of health problems that she had. She had bronchial asthma and, because of that, was under a lot of pressure. She started as a client of natural products and improved her health a lot. From there she became an independent distributor so that more people could achieve the benefits from the products. Since she is an example of what they can do to improve their health she gained many clients.

She needs a loan of $300 that will be repaid in 3 months, to be able to supply more merchandise, and to invite more people to use the products.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Hortensia inició el negocio por problemas de salud que ella tenia, tenia asma bronquial y a raíz de eso se le subía mucho la presión, empezó como cliente a consumir productos naturistas y mejoro mucho su salud, de ahí se hizo distribuidora independiente para que mas gente pueda aprovechar los beneficios de los productos y como ella es un ejemplo de lo que estos pueden hacer en pro de la salud ha logrado captar muchos clientes.

Elle necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 3 meses para poder surtir mas mercancía, e invitar a mas gente a que consuma los productos

loans.use: To buy merchandise and pay marketing expenses for her natural products business.

loans.name: Proeung

texts.en: Mrs. Proeung T., 21, is a farmer in the village of Thlork Roling in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Hoeun Kosal, is a firewood seller currently earning a small income to support his family, and since his business is going well, he wants to expand it by selling firewood door-to-door. Therefore, Mrs. Proeung T. is requesting a loan to buy a cart for that purpose.

loans.use: To buy a cart for her husband's business in order to sell firewood door-to-door.

loans.name: Virginia Florentina

texts.es: La señora Virginia, vive con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos de edad escolar. Se dedica al bordado de fundas para la protección de los elec trodomésticos del hogar. Su esposo le ayuda con los bordados, al igual que sus hijos, como este es el único medio de ingreso en el hogar, ella cubre con todos los gastos de la familia. Viaja continuamente al interior del país para vender sus productos en las ferias y mercados, tambien los vende en las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz, es una familia muy trabajadora.
texts.en:
Mrs. Virginia lives with her husband and her four school aged children. She is dedicated to embroidering cases to protect household electronics. Her husband helps her with the embroidering as well as her children, because this is the only source of income in the household, she covers all of the family's expenses. She travels the interior of the country continually to sell her products at the fairs and markets, and she also sells them in the fairs in the city of La Paz. This is a very hardwroking family.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying materials

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Phally S. is 28 years old, and she is a farmer who lives in Orsvay Commune, Kampong Cham Province. She is married to Mr. Kong Hoeun, and she has two children. Notably, her husband is also a farmer. In fact, Phally has been farming with her husband since 2000, and they typically generate a combined income of US$3.00 per day.

For another source of income, Phally is seeking a loan in the amount of US$1,100 to purchase oxen to breed and to then resell for a profit. As for her future plan, she wants to run a business of exporting oxen to other country.

loans.use: To purchase oxen for breeding purposes and to resell them for profit

loans.name: Xuan Thi

texts.vi: Chị Xuân Thị Hà 35 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003. Gia đình chị có 2 con đang tuổi đến trường. Hiện tại hàng tháng ngoài thu nhập 1.500.000đ từ việc buôn bán phế liệu của chị Hà gia đình chị còn có thêm thu nhập khoảng 1.500.000 từ lương làm thợ xây của chồng. Với mức thu nhập này  không chỉ chi tiêu và hoàn trả vốn vay theo quy định gia đình chị Hà còn có thể tiết kiệm để đầu tư cho các con ăn học ngày càng tốt hơn. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn đi buôn bán phế liệu.
texts.en:
Mrs. Xuân Thị Hà is 35 years old. She's been participating in the TYM Fund since 2003. She has two school-aged children. Her current monthly income from her scrap/waste exchange business is 1,500,000 VND. Her family also gets additional income from her husband's salary as a construction worker, which is about 1,500,000 VND. With this income level, she is able to repay her loans and cover family expenses. Mrs. Hà can also save to give her children a good education. For this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 15,000,000 VND to invest in her scrap/waste exchange business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business - Scrap/Waste Exchange

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 28 años de edad, vive junto a su conviviente y su pequeña hija a quien adora mucho. Ella se dedica desde hace 2 años atrás a la venta de productos de belleza como perfumes, shampoo, talcos, lápiz labiales, correctores para uñas, etc., ya  que es  una mujer muy activa y con deseos de superación, lo que le gusta de su trabajo es buscar la forma de convencer a sus clientes para poder vender sus productos y dar una muy buena atención es lo primordial, nos menciona. Le es muy rentable porque ella se ha ganado con este trabajo una gran gama de clientes, por lo que le va excelente. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado quiere comprar más productos de belleza, además una pequeña vitrina para ponerlos dentro y estén más seguros.
texts.en:
Maria is 28 years old and lives with her partner and their small daughter, whom she adores very much. She has been selling beauty products—perfume, shampoo, body powder, lipstick, nail polish corrector pens, etc.—for 2 years because she is a very active woman who wants to get ahead. What she likes most about her job is looking for a way to persuade her customers to buy her products, and she notes that providing excellent customer service is essential. This business is very lucrative for her because she has established a sold client-base, which is why she has prospered. This is her first loan with MFP. With the money that she is requesting, she would like to purchase more beauty products and a small glass display case in which to place her products so that they can be protected.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase beauty products

loans.name: Edem

texts.en: Edem is 39 years old and married with two children. Edem sells drinks in wholesale and retail to her customers. She loves this business because it is highly profitable. The demands for her drinks are high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She needs the loan amount of 140,000 NGN ($1,000 US) to purchase more drinks to sell. She says, "Thank you to Kiva lenders for their financial support."

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma D., is 44-years old, married and lives in Owaon, Dapitan City. She has 3 children and 2 are in school. Her husband’s income, from his motor cab driving supports their basic daily needs.
She did not want to sit all day and wait for her husband to come home, so she started a small business that would generate an income. When she went to Dipolog, she saw, by accident, the Paglaum building and the Coop buildings. She inquired what Paglaum could bring into their lives. She was interested in joining and became a member on October 16, 2007. She used her first loan of 3,000 PHP as her capital in vending bananas. She became inspired to struggle and surpass all of the competitors in this business. She buys her supplies in “tabo-tabo”, a place in the area where many types of harvested crops are sold.

Today, she is requesting additional capital for buy bananas and other fruits to sell. She applying for a loan in the amount of  7,000PHP at Paglaum. She aspires to one day, own her own stall in the market for her banana vending business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and fruit for resale

loans.name: Custodio

texts.es:
El Sr. Custodio vive desde hace 14 años en la localidad de Pampa Coscal, en las afueras del municipio de El Torno en el Departamento de Santa Cruz, en este lugar es dueño de una pequeña parcela en la cual realiza su actividad de agricultura, especializandosé en frijoles y maíz.
Cuenta con casa propia en la que vive con su esposa y sus 7 hijos. El crédito que el Sr. Solicita será justamente para aumentar su capital, y seguir con la siembra de poroto y maíz que es la fuente principal de sus ingresos con la que mantiene a toda su familia. Su objetivo es el de llegar a ser un productor de mayor capital y hacer la entrega de sus productos directamente a los mercados centrales de Santa Cruz.
texts.en:
Custodio has lived in the Pampa Coscal neighborhood for the past 14 years. His lives on the outskirts of El Torno in Santa Cruz, Bolivia. He owns a small plot of land where he works as a farmer, specializing in beans and corn. He has his own home that he shares with his wife and their 7 children. The loan he is asking for will be used to increase his capital and continue planting kidney beans and corn—this is the main source of income for his entire family. His goal is to become a farmer with more capital and deliver his products directly to the main markets in Santa Cruz.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plant corn and beans

loans.name: Tukulamba M.

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 28-year-old Tukulamba K. from Tukuyu. She is married with two children, ages 4 and 10. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one other dependent because he is an orphan.

Tukulamba has been running a crop-selling business since 2006. Her business is to purchase a variety of crops in the villages and sell them in the town for higher price. She works at the business 12 hours per day, seven days per week and is assisted by her husband.

Tukulamba currently earns about $70 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to purchase more varieties of crops in bulk. In the future, she plans to open the same business at another location. Tukulamba thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more varieties of crops in bulk

loans.name: Melea

texts.en: Melea P., 25, is married with one child.  She has two years of experience in the elei and printing businesses.  She sells to villagers and the general public five days per week.  She has one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 145 Tala.  SPBD loans are Melea’s only access to capital because she was not able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase materials, zippers, threads, needles, fabric paints, elei board for printing.

loans.name: Nesa

texts.en:
Nesa R. supports herself with her small business. She sells RTW (ready-to-wear) items to her neighbors and friends.

Nesa is a widow, 50 years old, and unfortunately doesn't have any children. She is planning to improve her existing business so as to be able to help out her sisters with school expenses and other family finances.

Nesa is now applying for a loan with HSPFI for the amount of PHP 4,000 to realize her plan.

loans.use: To purchase more ready-to-wear items for sale

location.town: Purok 5, Tambo, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase sewing machine

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr: L. Maïmouna est née vers 1976 dans la Commune de Bassila dans le Département de la Donga au Nord du Bénin. Maïmouna est mariée et mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à la charge de son mari et elle. Maïmouna vend à manger au carrefour Abattoir, un grand carrefour situé dans le quartier Akpakpa à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Maïmouna vend en effet du piron rouge (fait à base de la farine de manioc), de la pâte rouge (fait à base de la farine de maïs), de l'acassa (fait à base de l'amidon de maïs) ainsi que du riz et du haricot. Maïmouna a déjà eu deux crédits de ALIDé ; crédits qu’elle a très bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu amener son activité à un stade supérieur. Aujourd’hui encore Maïmouna sollicite un troisième crédit de ALIDé pour augmenter le volume de son activité afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle sans cesse croissante.
texts.en:
L. Maïmouna was born around 1976 in the town of Bassila, in Donga County in northern Benin. She is married and the mother of four children who are all in school and supported by her and her husband. Maïmouna sells food to eat at the Abattoir crossroad, located in the Akpakpa district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Basically, she sells red piron (a mash made with cassava flour), red mash (made with cornmeal), acassa (balls made with fermented cornstarch), as well as rice and beans. Maïmouna has already had two loans with ALIDÉ and has indeed repaid them, having used them to bring her business to a higher level. Today, she's requesting a third loan from ALIDÉ to increase her business volume in order to do better in satisfying her ever-growing customer base.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a 50-kg sack of cassava flour, three 50-kg sacks of corn, a 50-kg sack of rice, another of beans, 25 liters of peanut oil, and some sauce condiments

loans.name: Las Dorcas De Pomacocha Group

texts.en:
The members of Dorcas de Pomacocha are from the Pomacocha community in the Vischongo District of Vilcashuaman province. The principal activities of the community are agriculture, livestock, and trade. 

Zenaida is married and has five children. She sells groceries and vegetables (from her land) during fairs held throughout the region, and sells CDs that she buys in Lima with the help of her children. She would like to use the loan to buy mO. groceries and seeds. Zenaida dreams of educating her children and making them qualified professionals.

Another member, Elena, is married and has four children. She has a small shop at her house, where she buys and sells small animals and grains, which she acquires from surrounding communities. With the loan, Elena will buy mO. groceries and small animals. Elena aspires to educate her children and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, groceries and small animals

loans.name: Zubeda

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 36-year-old Zubeza B. from Mwanza, single with five children between the ages of 7 and 16. Zubeda has been running a business since 2006 selling charcoal, small black pieces of dry earth that are used by many Tanzanians as a fuel to cook their daily meals. Women cook food in small coal pots in which they arrange mkaa (charcoal) and add paper, dry grass, old plastic bags or kerosene in order to light them.

Because there is such a high demand for charcoal across the country, being a charcoal seller is quite lucrative. Working at the business for 12 hours per day, 7 days per week and assisted by two employees, Zubeda currently earns about $100 per month. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to purchase more stock in bulk and in the future plans to expand her business. Zubeda thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA! SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more stock in bulk.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa es una mujer muy emprendedora, los años de dedicación en su trabajo y en su hogar le han permitido tener buenos frutos, pues junto a su esposo se esfuerzan por satisfacer las necesidades de sus hijos dentro y fuera del hogar. Con su trabajo en diversas actividades logró ahorrar una buena cantidad de dinero que le permitió instalar una tienda de comestibles en su casa, la cual viene funcionando por más de 37 años. Sin embargo, las largas horas de atención son muy pesadas debido a que hay gran demanda por las noches y trata de aprovecharlas a pesar del cansancio, aunque en compañía de su pareja y su hijo se torna menos pesada esta labor. Ahora, Rosa tiene pensado implementar nuevos productos en su negocio y requiere del capital necesario para la inversión, es por ello que atiende todos días en su tienda, brindando el mejor trato a sus clientes, quienes todos estos años se acostumbraron visitar la tienda de doña Rosa, quien es una persona muy amable con sus vecinos. Este es su crédito 14 con MFP y lo que la ha mantenido todos estos años (casi 7) en su banco comunal es el trabajo en equipo y el empeño que ponen todas sus compañeras. Con los 2000 soles que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para surtir mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Rosa is a hard working businesswoman. Her years of dedication to her work and home have enabled her to bear good fruits; along with her husband they work to meet the needs of their children within and beyond their home. With her work in various jobs she was able to save a good quantity of money that enabled her to open a grocery store in her home, which she has been running for more than 37 years. Nevertheless, the long hours are difficult because there is a high demand for remaining open at night and she tries to provide her best service in spite of being tired; with her husband and son this work is less intense. Now Rosa is thinking about adding new products to her business and needs capital to make the investment. So she is working in her store every day, providing the best customer service possible to her customers who all these years have become accustomed to visiting Rosa’s store, as she is very friendly with her neighbors. This is her 14th loan with MFP and what has supported her all these years (almost 7) with her communal bank is the teamwork and effort all her colleagues put into the system. With these 2000 soles that she seeks she will buy a large quantity of merchandise to better stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Matalena

texts.en:
Matalena A. is a 40-year-old woman living in the town of Samalaeulu Leauvaa. She is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Matalena raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Matalena has been engaged in this business for more than three years and earns approximately 360 Samoa Tala (about $136) a month from these activities.

In 2008, Matalena joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Matalena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Matalena is now requesting a new loan of 1,500 WST, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Matalena plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About SPBD

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Tulemane Group

texts.en:
Clara C., age 38, is married with four children, ages 19, 16,12 and 8 years. She has a general store. She has had this shop for about four years now.  She works from 7am to 8pm daily and is able to earn a monthly profit of about $427. 

This will be Clara’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase the stock in her store and paid school fees for her firstborn. She has paid the loan back successfully. She now hopes for a new loan to further increase her inventory.

Clara will share this loan with the group Tulemane. The group has 22 members.  These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Clara is first on the left in the front row, wearing a blue dress.

loans.use: To further increase store inventory

loans.name: María Ofelia

texts.es:
En el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora María Ofelia C. dedica sus esfuerzos a la elaboración y venta de tortillas las cuales elabora con sus propias manos y son vendidas a sus clientes en su establecimiento.

Ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de la materia prima como lo es el maíz para elaborar las tortillas y así seguir mejorando sus ventas de tortillas.
texts.en:
María Ofelia C. makes a living preparing and selling tortillas in the Mayoreo market in the city of Managua. She makes her tortillas by hand and sells them to customers at her establishment. She has come to Kiva partner Ceprodel to request a loan so that she can purchase ingredients (such as corn) for making tortillas. This will help her to continue improving her tortilla sales.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing ingredients for tortillas

loans.name: Salema Group

texts.en:
Salema is the group leader of the Salema group. This group is made up of four female members.

Salema has a joint tailoring business with her son, which involves sewing different kinds of clothes.

Bebe Khord has a quilt-making business, and she wants to take a loan to buy necessary materials.

Homa wants to take a loan for her husband who has a general store.

Hamida would like to take a loan to buy a new engine for her husband's taxi.

They have requested a group loan of 40000 AFN. They would like to say that Kiva offers the best process for supporting people.

loans.use: To purchase materials and expand the business

loans.name: Dương's Group

texts.en: A. Dương Thị (20213010011) is a 28-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc N.. A. is the group leader of a five-member group loA. offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives A. individual loA., they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is A. N. 04 (4). A. is married and has three school-aged children. She owns and operates a business making and selling dried goods in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities. In 2008, A. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loA. of 4,704,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loA. was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. A. is now requesting a new loA. of 6,048,000 VND which will again be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. The loA. will be her 3rd loA. from SEDA. A. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. Đỗ Thị M. (20213010012) is a 26-year-old male who is requesting a 6,048,000 VND loA. to support his furniture-making business. 2. Nghiêm Thị M. (20213010014) is a 40-year-old female who is requesting a 6,048,000 VND loA. to support her business making and selling food. 3. Nguyễn Thị N. (20213010013) is a 38-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loA. to support her business raising livestock. 4. Nguyễn Thị H. (20213010015) is a 38-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loA. to support her business raising livestock. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loA. was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** A. Dương Thị (20213010011) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc N.. A. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là A. N. 04 (4). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm sấy khô trong cộng đồng địa phương. A. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, A. kiếm được khoảng 3,000,000 VND. Vào 2008, A. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. A. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4,704,000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các thành phần thô cần thiết để chế tạo sản phẩm để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,048,000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Đỗ Thị M. (20213010012) là 26 tuổi nam. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,048,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất. 2. Nghiêm Thị M. (20213010014) là 40 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,048,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. 3. Nguyễn Thị N. (20213010013) là 38 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,152,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 4. Nguyễn Thị H. (20213010015) là 38 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,152,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn B. is from the village of Colambutan Bajo, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old and married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a business planting and harvesting corn to sell. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately $150 a month from these activities.

In 2006, Evelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,500 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her seventh loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es: Don Juan E. a sus 52 años de edad, ha logrado formar una bonita familia de dos hijos los cuales estudian la primaria para poder ser unos jóvenes educados. el señor Juan trabaja como guarda de seguridad  desde dos años para poder tener un ingreso fijo para la mantención de su familia ya que anteriormente los dos se dedicaban a la pulpería pero por las ventas bajas tuvo que buscar un trabajo para poder salir adelante, su esposa es la que despacha y cuando el esta ambos venden un variedad de productos como: leche de pote, medicinas, golosinas, gaseosas granos básicos y otros. Entre las dificultades es que en tiempo de inviernos se hace mucho lodo en el barrio ya que las calles están en mal estado por las lluvias. Con este préstamo comprara granos básicos, como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, maíz, golosinas, y productos de cosméticos para mejorar las ventas y captar mas clientela ya que en un futuro desea tenerla bien surtida a si como poder dar a su familia una estabilidad y mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
At 52 years of age, Juan has raised a beautiful family of two children who are studying at primary school in order to be good kids. Juan has been working as a security guard for two years so that he can have a fixed income with which to keep his family. Before this, he and his wife ran a general store but, due to low sales, he had to find a job in order be successful. His wife still works in the store and when he is also there they both sell a variety of products like: condensed milk, medicines, candies, sodas, food grains, and others. Among the difficulties they face is that in the winter there is a lot of mud in the neighborhood and the streets are in a bad state because of the rain. With this loan he will buy dried goods such as: rice, beans, sugar, corn, sweets, plus cosmetic products in order to improve the store's sales and gain more clients. For the future he wants to be well-stocked so that he can give his family some stability and a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, sugar, condensed milk, sweets, and sodas

loans.name: Kotognontala Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kotognontala constitué de huit femmes dont 5 célibataires et 3 qui sont mariées dans des ménages  monogames. Elles ont  en moyenne  26 ans, 1 enfant et habitent dans le Camp Militaire de Ségou  (4ème Région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage (car sont soient enfants ou épouses de militaires) et font partie d’une  même association traditionnelle d’entraide.
Ce groupe de femmes fait l’achat vente d’articles divers de commerce de différentes sortes. 
Dans le souci d’augmenter le volume de leurs activités, elles ont décidé d’adhérer au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel  elles sont à leur sont à leur 1er  prêt solidaire. 
Ce  prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 80 paires de chaussures tapettes et baby, une gamme très variée de crèmes, de laits  pour le corps, de pommades pour les cheveux , 40flacons de parfums, des déodorants, 50 paquets de mèches, une ½ balle de pull-overs pour enfants, des condiments alimentaires (1 panier de tomates fraîches, 2 grandes boites de concentrée de tomate, 1sac de choux pommés, 6 paquets de divers cubes maggi : maggi poulet, jumbo, maggi oignon), 2 kg de poivre,  25kg de viande  et de foie et des ingrédients  pour la grillade de brochettes. 
Elles s’approvisionnent en chaussures à Ségou et à Bamako, en produits de beauté  au grand marché de Ségou, en mèches  à Bamako, la friperie et les condiments alimentaires à la foire hebdomadaire de Ségou, la viande, le foie et les ingrédients pour la grillade au marché château. Les articles sont revendus au marché de Ségou Coura, à domicile et en ambulant dans le quartier et  à l’intérieur du camp militaire. La vente est effectuée  au comptant, en détail  et  à crédit  à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice  moyen mensuel  de 24.500FCFA  qui servira à rembourser le prêt, à satisfaire les petits besoins familiaux à participer aux événements sociaux.
NB : Fatoumata  Diabaté absente de la photo de groupe était empêchée pour raison de funérailles.
texts.en:
The Kotognontala group consists of eight women, including five who are single and three who are married and in monogamous households. On average they are 26 years old with one child, and they live in the Military Camp of Segou (4th Administrative Region of the Republic of Mali). They came to know each other through their community ties (as they are all either children or wives of soldiers), and they are part of the same traditional association for mutual assistance.

This group of women buys and sells various types of commercial items. In hopes of increasing the volume of their business, they decided to join the credit program of Soro Yiriwaso from which they are taking first joint loan. This loan will be used to buy 80 pairs of sandals and baby shoes, a wide variety of creams, body lotions, hair pomades, 40 bottles of perfume, deodorant, 50 packets of hair extensions, a half bale of children's sweaters, food condiments (1 basket of fresh tomatoes, 2 large cans of tomato concentrate, 1 bag of cabbage, 6 packets of various Maggi cubes: Maggi chicken, jumbo, Maggi onion), 2 kg of pepper, 25 kg of meat and liver, and ingredients for shish kebabs. They purchase the shoes in Segou and Bamako, the beauty products from the general market of Segou, the hair extensions in Bamako, the second-hand clothes and condiments from the weekly fair in Segou, and the meat, liver and grilling ingredients from the "château" market. The items are resold either in the Segou Coura market, from home, or by traveling in the area and inside the military camp. The sales are made in cash, in retail, and by credit to a customer base of women and men. They hope to make an average monthly profit of 24,500 FCFA which will be used to repay the loan, to satisfy small family needs, and to participate in social events.

NB: Fatoumata Diabaté is absent from the group photo due to a funeral.


Translated from French by Jarred Taylor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying various items

loans.name: Desilyn

texts.en:
Desilyn Q. is from the village of Poblacion, Catarman Camiguin Province. She is 32 years old. Desilyn is single and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Desilyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Desilyn has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Desilyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Desilyn is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Desilyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco T. is engaged in corn and coconut farming and trading. He grows rice and sells his harvest to generate additional income for the family. He said, his harvest is what he uses to buy food and basic needs. The farm is very important to him, especially because it is the only source of income of the family.

Francisco is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. He will use the loan to buy the needed farm supplies to grow his rice well. The loan will help not just to improve his harvest but to increase the family income as well.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies for his rice farm

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa B., 44, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Fernando B., a machine operator, and they are blessed with eight children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own variety store for several years now.

Teresa has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends its weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow five times in CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to buy grocery items as added stock for her store. Her business lets her earn a profit of PHP 27,000 per month.

Now, with your help, Teresa would like to apply for a PHP 12,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying grocery items like condiments, canned goods, soft drinks and charcoal.

Teresa dreams that her store will continue to expand and become a grocery someday. She also prays that God will continue to help them surpass the different challenges in life.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for her store

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es: Ana Gloria C. C. de 46 años de edad, reside en Armenia, ubicado en el departamento de Sonsonate. Vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos los cuales se dedican a estudiar. La señora Gloria posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos comestibles y de primera necesidad para el hogar, así mismo posee una venta de antojitos. Yuca frita, empanadas, atol de elote, y otros productos más son los nombres de los platillos típicos que Ana prepara en su propia casa de habitación, y por los cuales posee muy buenas referencias, ya que es una señora muy trabajadora y emprendedora, quien elabora lo mejor posible su oficio, brindándoles el mejor servicio a sus clientes. Ana solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar materia prima para la elaboración de los alimentos, tales como yuca, maíz, elotes y otros más, todo esto con el fin de ofrecer mayor cantidad de productos y así aumentar las ganancias que tan bien le harán a su familia y su estabilidad económica, ya que dependen en gran manera de este negocio.
texts.en:
Ana Gloria Chavez C., 46, lives in Armenia, located in the Sonsonate department. She lives with her husband and her two children, who are in school. Gloria has a store where she sells food products, household necessities and home-made snacks. Fried cassava, empanadas, and "atol de elote" (a drink made of corn) are the names of some of the typical dishes that Ana prepares in her home. She has very good references, since she is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who makes the most of her business by providing the best service to her customers. Ana requests a loan that she will use to buy raw materials for the production of food, such as cassava, corn and other items, all with the aim of offering more products and increasing her earnings. These earning will support her family and provide them with economic stability, as they depend heavily on this business for their livelihood.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy raw materials for the production of food

loans.name: Naneth

texts.en:
Naneth J. is from the village of Balbagon, Mambajao Camiguin Province. She is 22 years old. Naneth is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Naneth owns & operates a specialized retail business. Her husband is a fisherman, and Naneth helps him by selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Naneth has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Naneth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Naneth is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Naneth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Monita

texts.en: Monita is a mother of three children. She is married and lives with her family in Agusan Del Sur. She joined CEVI a year ago to gain access to its program. She said that her previous loan was really helpful because she was able to supply her farm with seeds, fertilizers, and other inputs. She hopes to grow her farm so she has requested another loan. She is asking for Php 10,000, which she would use to purchase farm inputs. Hopefully, this loan will help Monita achieve her goals.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Cythia

texts.en: Cythia is 30 years old, married and has 2 children. Her husband is a farmer and he also supports their home. She is an honest and hard-working woman. She loves her business because of the profits that she makes. She sells plantain and beef to earn a living in Benin City. She has been in this business for 6 years. Cythia hopes to improve the living standard of her family. She is requesting for a loan of NGN 60,000 to purchase more plantain and beef to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more plantain and beef to sell

loans.name: Lorina

texts.en:
Lorina E. is from the village of San Simon, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 65 years old. Lorina is married. To make a living, Lorina owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Lorina earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lorina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Lorina has decided to request a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Lorina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

location.town: San Simon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Phebean

texts.en: Phebean C. is a single parent and business woman who deals in artifacts and enamels. She has three children, all of whom attend school. Being a single parent, Phebean is very determined to succeed in business. But her current capital is small and she needs a loan to expand it. If successful in acquiring a loan, she will use it to buy more local materials, produce more craft works and enamels, and care for her children.

loans.use: To buy local materials

loans.name: Moeun's Group

texts.en:
The four people who make up this loan group live in a village in Takeo province. They will each use the loan for different purposes so that it can improve their businesses in the future. 

Mr. Moeun M. is the group leader who has been selected by all the members. He is a construction worker and aside from this, he sells beds in his local village also. Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it. So to improve his business, Mr. Moeun M. is asking for a loan to buy five beds for resale. His wife, Mrs. Van Oruk, is a recycler and he is the father of five children, four of whom are studying in local public school, while the youngest one is only five years old.

loans.use: To buy five beds for resale

loans.name: Lingueres De Santhie Group

texts.fr: Le groupe lingueres de SANTHIE groupe de cinq (5) vendeuses de légumes et condiment d’un marché de quartier de la ville de Mbour. Le groupe crée depuis cinq (5) ans permette à ses membres de réunir chaque jour des cotisations de deux cent francs CFA qui sont versées chaque jour à un membre du groupe à tour de rôle. Cette somme est injectée dans le commerce pour renforcer le fonds de roulement du groupe. Face à l’insuffisance ses cotisations à régler leurs besoins en fonds de roulement, le groupe sollicite un prêt. La plus part des membres du groupe ont quitté leur village pour s’installer à la ville à fin d’avoir de quoi nourrir leur famille.
texts.en:
The “Lingueres de Santhie” group consists of five retailers of vegetables and condiments from a neighbourhood market in the town of Mbour. This group was created five years ago, requiring that daily fees of 200 CFA be collected from each member and given to one of the members on a rotating basis. This sum is then used in the commercial activities to bolster the group’s working capital. As these daily fees proved insufficient to support the working capital, the group requested a loan. Most group members have left their home village to settle in town and earn enough to feed their families.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: commercial activity

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Yorn T., age 48, is a widow with three sons and two daughters. Two of her sons are construction workers, one child is a garment factory worker and the other two are in school. Yorn sells vegetables. She lives about fifteen kilometers south of Phnom Penh. 

The wall of Yorn’s house is old and she wants to repair it, but she does not have the money. Therefore, she is applying for her first loan of $250 in order to make the repair.

loans.use: To repair the wall of her house

loans.name: Donilda Guadalupe

texts.es:
Donilda  tiene 48 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos: la niña  de 12 años de edad estudia 6to grado de primaria y el niño de 14 años estudia su segundo año de secundaria.  Donilda trabaja como docente de primaria desde hace 16 años.
