Esta solicitando refinanciamiento de su 7mo credito con el objetivo de comprar un solar y esto le vendra ayudar para asi poco a poco ir comprando algunos bienes para ir heredando a sus hijos.      

Doña Donilda se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer muy responsable, honesta, trabajadora, y con muchos deseos de superacion, pues actualmente està cursando el tercer año en la de la carrera ciencias de la Educacion en la Universidad URACCAN recinto Nueva Guinea, su mayor sueños en la vida es tener estabilidad laboral y que sus hijos estudien para que en el futuro sean excelentes profesionales.
texts.en:
Donilda is 48 years old and has two children: a 12-year-old daughter in sixth grade and a 14-year-old boy in high school. Donilda has worked as an elementary school teacher for the past 16 years. She is requesting her seventh loan in hopes of purchasing a plot of land, which will come in helpful little by little as she keeps buying goods for her children to inherit. Donilda is known for being a very responsible, honest and hard-working woman with a strong desire of moving up in life. She is currently in her third year of pursuing an educational sciences degree from the university in Nueva Guinea, and her biggest dream is to have job stability and for her children to continue their studies and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a plot of land

loans.name: Juan Simón

texts.es:
El Sr. Juan Simón R. es de la compañía Potrero de la ciudad de Carapeguá, el mismo está casado cuenta con casa propia, se dedica a la venta de leche y carne porcina hace varios años con clientela formada y buen nivel de ventas.
    
Accedió a un crédito con nuestra entidad que lo utilizó para la compra de una lechera que se le ofertó a un buen precio y de esta forma contar con una mayor producción.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan Simón R. is from the Potrero section of the city of Carapeguá. He is married and lives in his own home. Juan has been selling milk and pork for several years. He has an established customer base and generates good sales.

He has applied for a loan with Fundación Paraguaya so that he can buy a dairy cow that has been offered to him at a good price. This will allow him to increase his milk production.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married to a taxi driver; they have three children and all their children go to school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  She owns a stall in Nakulabye selling second-hand clothes.  She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. She buys bales of clothes from Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda, and uses public transport to and from shopping. 

Margaret has been in this clothing business for years.  She sells to all categories of people, both retail and wholesale. Margaret goes for shopping once a week. She works six days a week.  Her business challenges include seasonality and transportation  of bales of clothes from Owino to her stall in Nakulabye.  She is aspiring of improving her standard of living and even starting importing clothes from Dubai.  She decided to work with MCDT because she wanted additional capital.   She resides in and rents a three-roomed house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water.  Her monthly expenses includes school fees, food, and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en: Felicisima F. is from the town of Banga. She is 59 years old. Felicisima is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Felicisima raises pigs for fattening and sale. Felicisima has been engaged in her business for over seven years. She was also able to put up a small sari-sari (variety) store that she hopes to grow as well. She sells various products that most of the people in her community buy from her. Felicisima joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felicisima is requesting a new loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. She also plans to add inventory to her store. This will be the first loan taken out by Felicisima from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc., (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social-performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but sldo offers savings, insurance and training programs through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. She also plans to add inventory to her store.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas C. C. tiene 56 anos. Es casado y vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia Bolívar de Ecuador. Tiene 6 hijos.  

Tomas es un socio de la ventanilla rural Gradas Chico, que está ubicada a quince minutos en carro de la ciudad de Guaranda. Son 20 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz, trigo, papas, y la cría de animales.  Este es el tercer préstamo que sacan con la cooperativa.

Tomas se dedica a la agricultura. Tiene un invernadero donde crecen legumbres y tomate. Realiza las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el mercado de Guaranda. 

Solicita el préstamo para cultivar plantas en su invernadero. El apoyo del préstamo lo ayudara en ganar la vida. Su meta para los próximos anos es darles educación a sus hijos para que puedan conseguir algún trabajo bueno. Se enfrentan los precios bajos este ano para la venta de sus cultivos, especialmente el maíz y el trigo. Por eso es difícil ganar mucho por las ventas de sus productos. 

Se enfoca en su trabaja siete días a la semana, así que no tiene mucho tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Tomas C. C. is 56 years old. He is married and lives in the village of Guaranda, in the province of Bolivar in Ecuador. He has 6 children. Tomas lives in the rural village of Gradas Chico, about a fifteen minute drive from the city of Guaranda. The group is made up of 20 members and the majority of them cultivate corn, wheat, and potatoes and raise livestock. This is the third loan they have requested. Tomas is an agriculturist. He has a greenhouse where he grows vegetables and tomatoes. He makes his purchases and sells his products in the market of Guaranda. He requests a loan to cultivate plants in his greenhouse. The loan will help him find success in life. His goal over the next few years will be to provide his kids with an education so that they will be able to get good jobs. The price of his products has been driven down this year, especially for his corn and wheat harvests. It is very difficult to have an income from sales of his products. He focuses on his work seven days a week, so he doesn't have much spare time.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To cultivate plants in his greenhouse.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita D. is a married woman who lives in Paglaum, Brgy. Tabu, Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  Fish vending and a general store. Her husband Atilano, who is 63 years old, works as a fish vendor to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have six children who are 20 to 32 years old. 

Teresita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 19 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Teresita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 26,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15000,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 20th loan, she is borrowing PHP 26,000, which she intends to use to buy fish stock for her fish vending business as well as more merchandise for her general store so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs and future savings. Teresita D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at Kiva.org.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Mario Jose

texts.es: El señor Mario se dedica al transporte de material de construcción. Con vehículo propio, es una volqueta de doce cubos, hace de dos a tres viajes por día, desde hace dos años se dedica a esta actividad, es un cliente que ya trabajo con la institución ,  el señor vive en casa familiar, en la casa  de sus padres, tiene tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar y su esposa es la que se encarga del cuidado de sus hijos y de los suegros, que también viven con ellos, el dinero del crédito lo necesita para comprar material de construcción como ser cemento, calaminas, clavos, etc. Para la refacción de 2 ambientes en la casa de sus papas, para así poder brindar mayor comodidad a sus hijos.
texts.en: Mario makes a living transporting construction materials.  He has his own vehicle, a twelve-wheeler dump truck, and makes two to three trips each day.  He has made a living this way for two years.  Mario has already worked with the Emprender organization.  He lives in his parents’ house along with his three school-age children and his wife, who takes care of the children and her in-laws.  Mario will use the money from the loan to purchase construction materials such as cement, corrugated metal, nails, etc.  These materials are for renovating two rooms in his parents’ home, and will allow him to provide more space for his children.

loans.use: Purchasing construction materials for renovating his home

loans.name: Isaac Murugu

texts.en:
Isaac, 40 years old, has operated his butcher shop, specializing in goat meat, in Naivasha town for the last five years.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his third loan.  He has paid all his previous loans well and on time.  He plans to use this cash to add more goats to slaughter and sell the meat.

In the future, Isaac hopes to become a supplier of goat meat to other butcher shops.

loans.use: To buy goats for slaughtering

loans.name: José Agapito

texts.es:
José D. 33 años, el recorre las calles en un triciclo vendiendo pescados, vive con su esposa y dos hijos en el Suburbio D. Guayaquil(zona urbana, L. mayoría D. habitantes son comerciantes informales). 

José viene D. una familia D. pescadores, su papa lo aprendió D. su abuelo y el D. su padre. Al el casarse continuo con el negocio familiar pescando y vendiendo mariscos en diferentes lugares. Trabaja desD. las 06h00am hasta las 13h00pm todos los días  recorriendo las calles del suburbio en un triciclo y pescados.  

El espera en el futuro tener su propio local D. mariscos, pero por ahora quiere comprar con el préstamo cemento, bloques, pintura para readecuar su casa y asi darle una mejor vida a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
José is 33 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the suburb of Guayaquil (an urban area where the majority of the residents are informal merchants). He goes through the streets on a tricycle selling fish.

José comes from a family of fishermen – his father learned from his grandfather, who learned from his father. When he got married, he continued with the family business, fishing and selling seafood at different places. He works every day from 6am to 1pm going through the streets on a tricycle with fish.

In the future, he hopes to have his own seafood place. However, for now, he wants to use the loan to buy cement, blocks and paint to do housing improvements and that way, proviD. a better life for his two children.

loans.use: Cement, blocks, paint

loans.name: Pedro Angel

texts.es: El Sr. Pedro   tiene 42 años de edad es separado tienen tres hijos ya mayores de edad  de 20, 18 y 16 años de edad, no viven con el ellos estan en la ciudad de Lima juntamente con su madre. El vive en la casa de su madre hace 5 años desde que se separo de su familia. El vive en barrio los acuaches en casa de material noble de un piso,  el se dedica  a prestar servico de trasnporte en vehiculo alquilado. El Sr. pedro aun tiene sueños que cumplir uno de ellos es poder tener su vehiculo propio. Con el dinero que solicita invertira en la renovacion de su licencia de conducir y otros gastos personales del mejoramiento de vivienda de su madre.
texts.en: Pedro is 42 years old.  He is separated and has three grown-up children aged 20, 18 and 16.  They do not live with him.  They live with their mother in the city of Lima.  He has lived in his mother's house for the last 5 years since he separated from his family.  He lives in Los Acuaches neighborhood in a one-level house made of solid construction materials.  He works providing transport services in a rented vehicle.  Pedro still has dreams he would like to fulfil.  One is to have his own vehicle.  With the money he is requesting, he will invest in renewing his drivers' license and cover other personal expenses incurred in improving his mother's home.

loans.use: To renew his drivers' license

loans.name: Robert Ntinai

texts.en:
Robert Ntinai S. is 25 years old. He married to Leitato Sopia and a father of two children aged four and three years. Robert is a wheat farmer and he has been doing this for the last eight years.

Robert learned about KADET from other members in a group already registered with KADET in his area of residence. This will be his second loan which he is planning to use to prepare land for wheat planting. Wheat does well in his area due to good climatic conditions. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

Robert’s dream is do large scale farming and start dairy farming. He is a hard working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: to prepare land for wheat planting

loans.name: Anjeline

texts.en: Anjeline is a businesswoman who operates a retail shop and a grocery.  She has been in this business for a decade, and hopes eventually to expand it to include a wholesale operation. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for helping her to become self-reliant, and has applied for a loan for 50,000 Kes to buy flour made of maize, beans, vegetables, sugar, wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.use: To buy flour, beans, vegetables, sugar, wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es: Felicita, D. 56 años, está casada con Zenón, D. 54 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero solo viven con 3 D. ellos: Lourdes, D. 32, Gina, de28 y Dennis, D. 22 años D. edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en Playa Hermosa-San Ramón (selva central peruana). A pesar D. que hace poco, se restableció D. una enfermedad, está valerosa mujer continua dedicándose a la venta D. comida como: chupete D. frutas, yuca rellena y demás platos exquisitos que solo Felicita sabe preparar. En la catarata del “Tirol”, cada fin D. semana, donD. los pobladores peruanos tienen acostumbrado viajar y divertirse; ella sale a comercializar desD. muy tempranas horas del día. Pero como sabe que no todos los días visitan el lugar turístico, Felicita, en la puerta D. su casa coloca sillas y mesas para vender el plato típico “patasca”, conocido también como ¡mondongo!, que se realiza a base D. maíz y carne D. res. Por su excelente sazón, ella está pensando abrir un restaurante turístico, donD. pueda cocinar los platos típicos a base D. gallina, cuyes, y demás. Ya ella misma los cría con mucho cuidado, para que como ella dice “tengan una buena carne”. Es el décimo crédito con MFP, y como socia D. activa D. su banco comunal, está agradecida por el desarrollo constante que está obteniendo. Con el crédito solicitado, ha pensado comprar insumos como sacos D. fideos, azúcar y demás comestibles; para el preparado D. comida.
texts.en:
Felicita, 56, is married to Zenón, 54.  They have five children but only three still live with them: Lourdes, 32, Gina, 28 and Dennis, 22.  They live together as a family in their own house located in Playa Hermosa-San Ramón (Peruvian Central Jungle).  

Despite just recently recovering from an illness, this brave woman continues to dedicate herself to prepare food for sale like: chupete D. frutas (frozen fruit treats), yucca rellena (stuffed manioc) and other delicious dishes that only Felicita knows how to make.

She goes out starting very early in the morning to sell her items at the Catarata del Tirol (waterfall) which is a popular destination Peruvians like to visit for weekend vacations.  However, since she knows that they don’t travel to this tourist destination every day, Felicita sets up tables and chairs in her front yard to sell the typical dish known as “patasca” or “mondongo” (thick stew with a corn and beef base).  

Because of her tasty preparations she is thinking about opening a tourist restaurant where she can cook dishes based on chicken, guinea pigs and others.  She herself raises the animals very carefully so that, as she says “they will have excellent meat.” 

This is her 10th loan with MFP and as an active member of her communal bank she is grateful for the constant development she’s getting.

She plans to use the requested loan to buy ingredients like sacks of noodles, sugar and other foodstuffs to prepare her dishes.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare her meals.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Cattle farming is an economic activity dedicated to the raising of animals in order to generate revenue from the animals and the products they provide. Husein has earned a living from raising cattle since he was young. He's married and has a small child that, according to Husein’s words, he is his reason for living. It should be said that the low incomes available to people in this rural aren't enough to maintain a family and for this reason, Husein works enormously hard to provide a better standard of living for his family. Husein urgently needs to buy animals such as cows and calves. He's applied for a loan of $1500 USD. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of cattle

loans.name: Sarantuya

texts.en:
Sarantuya, 33, is married and lives with her husband, father-in-law and two children in their own ger, a traditional nomadic housing tent, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband works as a mechanic for the military base, her children attend a kindergarten, and her father-in-law helps to take care of the children. 

She began her clothing business in 2008 from a rented stall in a crowded shopping center. As her business expanded, she opened a second stall at another location in the same shopping center. Her daily average sales are between $41 and $82, and her working capital is now 1,000,000 MNT. Sarantuya is an open-minded and hardworking businesswoman. She is planning to buy a car that would be helpful in her business. 

She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase a wider variety of goods in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase a wider variety of goods

loans.name: Sum

texts.en:
Mr. Sum S. was born in 1954, and he is a villager who lives in Lvea Sa Kandal village in Kandal province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land which he uses to grow rice. He faces a problem because the rice field is far from the irrigation system. Thus, he would like to ask for loan to dig a well for his crop. Beside being a farmer, he is also a fisherman while his wife, Mrs. Chhoem Sophy, is a Khmer noodle seller. With their various jobs, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. 

This couple has five children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory, and the others are construction workers. His wife is in the picture with him.

loans.use: To dig a well for crops

loans.name: Navilles Caribe

texts.es:
Navilles R.  de 31 años, empezó este negocio de arroz, colas y legumbres ya que sus padres tenían una despensa, así que su sueño era tener una igual a la de sus padres. Empezó con muy  poco inventario, y desde que hizo crédito en D-miro ha incrementado su negocio. Elabora desde las 7:00am hasta las 22:30pm. Ella atiende siempre su tienda, pero en caso de tener que salir los hijos le ayudan, ya que su esposo trabaja.

No tiene ninguna  dificultad pero siempre tiene cuidado ya que en todos lados hay delincuencia. Su encuentra en unión libre. El conyugue Villamar Peñafiel Erwin  Ivan  Labora como oficial albañil desde hace 11 años y tiene 4 hijos (12, 3, 5, 4 años) estudiando escuelas fiscales.

Con el préstamo va a comprar víveres como aroz, ebidas, enlatados. Aspira en un futuro tener una despensa grande y con muchos clientes. Tener su cosa propia con cuarto para todos sus hijos.
texts.en:
Navilles Rodríguez, 31, started this rice, soft drink and vegetable business because her parents had a grocery store and her dream was to have one just like her parents.  She started out with just a little bit of inventory and when she got a loan from D-miro her business started growing.  She works from 7am until 10:30pm.  She always tends to the store herself but if she has to go out occasionally her children help out because her husband is employed. She does not have any difficulties but she’s always very careful because there is lawlessness everywhere. 

She is in a common law relationship with her spouse, Erwin Ivan Villamar Peñafiel, who has worked as a bricklayer for the last 11 years.  They have four children who are 12, 3, 4, and 5 years of age and going to public school.

She will use the loan to buy foodstuffs like rice, beverages and canned goods.  She hopes to have a large store with lots of customers in the future as well as a large house of her own with a bedroom for each one of her children.

loans.use: For rice, beverages and canned goods.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua N. is street vendor at Jukwa near Abura which lies close to Cape Coast. She is married to a farmer and she assists him in the payment of school fees and expenses for their five children as well as utility bills. 

Ekua went to senior high school and has been doing her job for 25 years now. Besides the locally-produced doughnuts you can see in the picture, she also sells meat pies and bread. 

Ekua would like to use the money from the loan to invest into her business and see it grow. The newly-earned profit will be used to further boost the business and also to provide learning materials for the children.

loans.use: Ekua would like to use the money of the loan to invest into her business and see it grow.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en: Eufemia is a 48-year-old married woman with 4 children, whose ages range from 19 to 25 years old. Eufemia is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato. She grows rice and corn to sell to her community. Eufemia works hard to provide for her family. She also wants to make improvements to their house. This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm materials

loans.name: Delphine

texts.en: Delphine Abong is 23 years old, lives in Kisumu city, is married and has a two-year-old child. For the last two years, she has made a living by selling second-hand clothes and is now applying for her first loan, which she plans to use to buy more clothing to sell to her customers. She is confident that she can make good use of this loan because she currently earns enough money to meet her family's needs and prepare to pay her child's school fees. In the future, she hopes to provide her family with a better life by continuing to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Yomema

texts.en: Yomema is currently in a business of selling sugar and salt. She is 39 years old and married, with 6 children, all of whom go to school. Yomema requested a loan to stock more sugar and salt to sell. She hopes to expand in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina T. is from the village of Mitugas, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 62 years old. Saturnina is widowed and has five adult children. Saturnina owns and operates a retail business, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Saturnina has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2006, Saturnina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Saturnina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Saturnina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase rice and corn grits to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Saturnina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase rice and corn grits to sell

loans.name: Etelvina

texts.es: Etelvina tiene 30 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 queridos hijos Fredy de 6 y Leyla de 3 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Junto a su inseparable carretilla de anticuchos, Etelvina sale todos los días rumbo a su puesto de venta, ella vende en un paradero muy concurrido del Asentamiento Humano Pachacutec. Su venta diaria es de casi 150 anticuchos diarios, lo que le da los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite cuidar a su pequeña hija mientras sale a vender. Lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto en espera de los clientes. En adelante, desea poner otro puesto de comida, en otra zona concurrida de dicho Asentamiento Humano. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, se siente en la capacidad de pagarlo a tiempo, ya que confía en su negocio. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevos ingredientes para preparar sus deliciosos anticuhos.
texts.en:
Etelvina is 30 years old.  She is a very simple and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her two beloved children, 6 year-old Fredy and 3 year-old Leyla, who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.

Together with her inseparable kebab cart, Etelvina goes out every day to her sales location.  She makes her sales from a very busy bus stop in Pachacutec settlement.  She sells almost 150 kebabs every day which provides her with the income she needs to support her family.  What Etelvina most enjoys about her work is that she is able to look after her young daughter while she is making her sales.  She has been in this business for three years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be having to stay on her stall all day waiting for customers.  In the future, she would like to set up another food sales location in another busy area of the same settlement.

This is Etelvina's fourth loan from MFP.  She feels able to make her repayments on time since she has faith in her business.  Etelvina will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy ingredients with which to make her delicious kebabs.

loans.use: to buy meat and supplies for preparing kebabs

loans.name: Sinuon

texts.en:
Sinuon (pictured here) is 38 years old, has just been married with her second husband for six months. She has one son and two daughters. Two of the children are garment factory workers and another one is in school. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh.

Sinuon is a garment factory worker, while her husband is a soldier. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to buy a motorbike for her children to drive to work.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her children to drive to work

loans.name: Fakhriddin

texts.ru: Фахриддин проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 31 год. Он женат. У него трое детей. Его жена, домохозяйка. Сам Фахриддин занимается торговлей на рынке. У него имеется магазин, где он продает стройматериалы. В этой области он работает уже три года. Кредит берет для приобретения новых материалов. Он хочет увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en: Fakhriddin lives in Vahdat.  He is 31 years old, married, and has three children,  His wife is a housewife,  Fakhriddin trades at the market.  He has a shop where he sells construction materials.  He has been doing this work for three years.  He is taking out a loan to acquire new materials.  He wants to increase the variety of his wares.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 41 years old. She is a married woman with 5 children. Her husband is a farmer. 

Leonida is in the business of food vending. She makes rice cakes, banana cue (deep fried banana), and other delicacies that she sells to the people in her community. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, sugar and flour. She hopes to have a stable business in the future to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, aged 48, is an enterprising business-lady. She is married to John and they are blessed with two children aged 32 and 24 years.  She has been selling fish for the past three years earning monthly income of KES 20,000 which she uses to support her family.

Mary is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. She will use the loan to boost her business by buying a fridge to store her fish.

With the anticipated profit she will open a greengrocery. Her hope is to prosper more in business.

loans.use: To boost her business by buying a fridge to store her fish

loans.name: Solidario Flores De Cruz Blanca Group

texts.es: Solidario Flores D. Cruz Blanca,Este Grupo esta Formado Por Felisa Esperanza que es la presidenta D. este grupo ella se dedica a la venta y crianza D. pollos ella nos cuenta que esta muy contenta porque esta actividad que realiza le gusta mucho porque le gustan los animales ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. pollos para crianza ya que nos cuenta que nececita mas capital para trabajar y asi tener mejores ingresos,al igual que las otras socias esta solicitando este credito porque nececitan mas capital para trabaja.
texts.en:
Felisa Esperanza is the president of the solidarity group “Flores D. Cruz Blanca” (Flowers of the White Cross). She earns her livelihood by raising and selling chickens. Felisa says that she is very pleased because she enjoys her business and likes working with animals.

She is requesting a loan to buy chickens to raise. Felisa says she needs more operating capital so that she can improve her earnings. In addition, the other members are seeking loans because they need more capital for their work.

loans.use: to purchase chickens to raise.

loans.name: Heremakono Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe HEREMAKONO III sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 27 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Nogonlon, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce premier prêt, FANTA, la deuxième debout à droite, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 55 000F CFA en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the HEREMAKONO III group are married women who have an average age of 27 and on average three children. They mostly live in polygamous families in Nogonlon, one of the villages of the rural commune of Banco, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, second administrative region of Mali. 

They collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops they cultivate are, among others, rice and peanuts. They are on their first loan with Soro Yiriwaso.

With this first loan, FANTA, standing second from the right, intends to buy farm inputs and small equipment, and pay the fees for plowing and weeding to maintain 0.5 hectares of rice and peanuts. 

The crops are sold at the markets of Baou, Koula, Banco and N’Golobougou, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. Fanta expects to make an average profit of 55,000 F CFA at the end of the crop season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding and small equipment.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is married and has bought and sold used clothing in the Philippines for twelve years now.

Gina works hard to support her family. She is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell.

Gina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rev Roseline

texts.en: Roseline is a very hard-working woman who practices mixed farming. She has been farming for the past seven years. She is 26 years old and married with two children. She is applying for her third loan. She plans to the loan amount to buy farm inputs. She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to buy cattle for fattening and to pay her children school fees. She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Dilmurod

texts.ru: Дилмурод умный и целеустремленный человек. Он женат и любящий отец 3 детей. Дилмурод занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Он любить свой бизнес и с удовольствием занимается этим бизнесом. Его жена также помогает мужу и она занимается выращиванием и продажей сельхоз культур.  В бизнесе также помогает ему его старший брат. Дилмурод хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хороший прибыль для улучшения своего жилищное условие. Дилмурод хотел бы получить займ для покупки минеральных удобрений и семена.
texts.en: Dilmurod is a smart and purposeful man. He is married and is a loving father of three children. Dilmurod grows agriculture crops. He loves his business and does it with pleasure. His wife also helps him to grow and sell the crops. His older brother also helps him with the business. Dilmurod wants to expand his business and get more profit to improve his living conditions. Dilmurod wants to get a loan to buy mineral fertilizer and seeds.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking fat and maize flour

loans.name: Pao

texts.en: Mrs. Pao is 40 years old and married with three children. Mrs. Pao and her husband are in the business of farming. Besides agriculture, they operate another business. She buys and resells recycled items, especially structures or broken parts of wooden houses that can be used again by poor families to rebuild their houses. These items include zinc, house columns, wooden boards and other housing structures. From this business, they typically earn around $10 USD per day to support their living and family’s needs. Currently, Mrs. Pao has lacked capital for her business. Therefore, Mrs. Pao would like to ask for a loan from Kiva’s lenders in the sum of $1,000 to buy her products. In the future, she plans to buy a plowing machine for growing crops and she hopes that she can expand her existing business more successfully.

loans.use: to buy items such as zinc, house columns, wooden boards and other housing structures to resell.

loans.name: Rudik

texts.en:
Rudik is 35 years old. He lives with his wife and 2 pupil daughters in Ijevan city. His wife does not work and takes care of their children. Since 1995 till 2003 Rudik used to work in the Ijevan trade market as a scrutineer (market inspector).

Rudik decided to run his own business, and since 2003 he has engaged in a coffee business. He buys coffee from wholesale markets in Yerevan and resells it in a rented place in Ijevan market. He also offers to grind his clients' coffee for free. This proposal helped him to increase the number of customers so now he needs to add to the volume of his coffee.

Thanks to his business, Rudik is solving his family's needs and helping his pensioner parents. He has received loans from Nor Horizon 4 times and has never delayed his repayments. Rudik needs an 800,000 AMD loan to buy a lot of new varieties of coffee for his business.

loans.use: To buy new varieties of coffee.

loans.name: 06.07.10 Đông Vệ Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Oanh is 42 years old and married with 2 children. She lives with 2 dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a semi-urban town in the Thanh Hoa province. Mrs Oanh works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. Oanh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Oanh faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise to sell in the future. With her business profit, Oanh hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and to remodel her house.
Oanh is the group leader of the 10 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. In 2010, Oanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Oanh has successfully repaid 2 loans from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise to sell in the future.

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
Ana tiene 25 años es divorciada y tiene un hijo de cuatro años, vive en Atuntaqui en la provincia de Imbabura en el Norte de Ecuador. Ana es una mujer muy trabajadora, organizada y no le gusta las injusticias.

Ana trabaja en la confección de ropita para muñecas otavaleñas, solicita el primer crédito a Fodemi ya que necesita invertir en tela salmón para confeccionar la ropa de muñecas ya que se viene una buena temporada para la venta de las muñecas y tiene que tener muy buena producción para que pueda obtener buenos ingresos y así poder mantener a su hijo y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Su sueño es seguir trabajando para incrementar su negocio y en un futuro cuando tenga muy buenos ingresos comprarse un terreno y contruir su casa.
texts.en:
Ana is 25 years old, divorced, and has a four-year-old son. She lives in Atuntaqui in the province of Imbabura in northern Ecuador. Ana is a hardworking and organized woman who dislikes injustice.

Ana makes clothing for Otavaleño dolls. She is requesting a loan from FODEMI because she needs to invest in salmon-colored fabric for making doll clothes. The season is approaching when the sales of these dolls are good. By maintaining a high level of production, Ana is able to generate a good income so that she can support her son and improve their quality of life.

Her dream is to continue working so that she can increase her business. In the future when she has good income, Ana will buy a plot of land and build a house.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making doll clothes.

loans.name: Marina Natividad

texts.es:
La señora Marina Natividad es casada, tiene 52 años D. edad, cursó los 6 años D. educación primaria, tiene 3 hijas las cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la confección D. delantales típicas, inició este trabajo como operadora, lleva 10 años D. experiencia, cuenta con e apoyo D. su esposo quien la apoya económicamente.

Solicita un préstamo para utilizarlo en la compra D. telas típicas, e incrementar su producción, espera ver que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Marina Natividad is married, 52 years old, has a sixth graD. education, and has three daughters who are in school.  She makes traditional aprons for a living.  She started out as a machine operator and she now has ten years of experience.  She has the support of her husband who helps her economically.

She is asking for a loan to use to buy traditional fabrics and to increase her production.  She hopes to see her business grow.

loans.use: to buy materials to make aprons

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La señora rosario es una mujer joven pero muy emprendedora, cuenta con 19 años de edad y está casada con el señor Reynaldo quien es campesino tienen un pequeño hijo, que se llama ángel apenas tiene 1 año de edad, tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes con la cual lleva  apenas 1 año.
Ella dice que decidió iniciar con este pequeño negocio, ya que quería buscar la manera de apoyar a su esposo, con los gastos de la casa y para ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas mercancía como son: leche, huevos, refrescos, agua, galletas, azúcar, frijol, papel higiénico, jabón, etc. para así tener un poco más surtido su negocio.
Doña rosa (así es como le dicen en su familia) dice que uno de los sueños que tiene, es el de hacer crecer aun mas su pequeño negocio, puesto que quiere construir un local, para poner su tienda y así tener un amplio surtido y variedad de productos, puesto que así obtendrá mejores ingresos, para poder asegurar la educación de su hijo.
Está muy contenta por esta gran ayuda que FRAC y los prestatarios de kiva le están brindando, ya que gracias a eso, ahora gozara de un mejor nivel de vida y un buen negocio.
texts.en:
Rosario is a young woman, but she is very enterprising.  She is 19 years old and married to Reynaldo, who is a farmer.  They have a young son named Angel, who is just one year old.  She has had a small grocery store for about one year.

She said that she decided to start this small business because she wanted to find a way to help her husband with the household expenses and to give her son a better quality of life.  She will invest this loan in more merchandise, such as milk, eggs, sodas, water, cookies, sugar, beans, toilet paper, soap, and other items so that her store will be well stocked.

Rosa (as she is called by her family) says that one of her dreams is to grow her business.  She would like to have a shop to put her store and have it well stocked with a variety of products so that she can earn a better income and ensure that her son will get a good education.

She is very happy with the help that FRAC and Kiva lenders have given her and thanks to that help, she will enjoy a better quality of life and a good business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as milk, eggs, sodas, water, cookies, sugar, beans, toilet paper, soap, and other items.

loans.name: Neang's Group

texts.en:
A 57-year-old married mother, Neang is a farmer who has five children. Two of them are dependents working in Thailand. To make a living, she plants her rice paddy twice per year. She has been in this business for more than 40 years. 

Neang leads a group of three female members. She has been with VisionFund since 2008 while her group members have been with VisionFund from one to four years. Her previous loans have made her living better. Now she is applying for another loan. She will use the entire loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yield and save some money to expand her farming business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetables or to work the farm where she grows her vegetables.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is applying for another loan to expand her current business. She will use this 50,000 Kes loan to purchase two sacks of rice, a bundle of wheat flour, a sack of beans and also renovate her café. In the future, Mwanamisi aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Mwanamisi has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of rice, a bundle of wheat flour, a sack of beans and also renovate her café.

loans.name: Mahfouth

texts.en:
Mahfouth is a 46-year-old man who has three sons and a daughter. He doesn’t like his photo to be taken for personal reasons, so his son took his place in the photo. 

Mahfouth owns a shop for making and shaping aluminum. One of his sons, Obada, who is appearing in the photo, works with him in the shop.

Now Mahfouth has applied for this loan to buy new machines for the shops and do some maintenance on the ones he has.

loans.use: to buy new machines for the shops.

loans.name: Yola

texts.es: Yola es una mujer muy trabajadora vive sola dentro de un colegio  ya que a la vez desempeña funciones de portera de dicho colegio en la zona Las Lomas ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.  Se dedica principalmente a la venta de calzados para dama y para niños que los compra al por mayor, ella vende todos los dias por la noche a partir de las 8 de la noche en una feria en la zona central de la ciudad de La Paz. La Sra. Yola quiere un credito para hacer un cambio de mercaderia por la temporada de fin de año, de esa manera obtendra nuevos modelos de zapatos para damas y niños y de esta manera poder tener mayores ingresos y asi poder hacer frente a los gastos que tiene en su hogar.
texts.en:
Yola is a very hardworking woman. She lives alone at a school where she also works as a porter. The school is located in the Las Lomas section of La Paz. She make her living primarily by selling shoes for women and children, which she buys at wholesale. She sells every day starting at 8 p.m. at a market in the center of La Paz. 

Yola wants the loan so she can buy merchandise for the end-of-year season and have new styles of shoes for women and children. This will allow her to increase her income and to take care of her household expenses.

loans.use: to buy new seasonal merchandise (shoes).

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret was born 53 years ago. She is married and has children. Margaret is very hard working and this has enabled her to get various ways of educating her children. She is a member of Mothers Union affiliated to Anglican Church of Kenya. This association helps members in solving various problems that affect them and the community they live. Margaret runs a small Retail business in Muhuti, Kangema Kenya. She sells gallons and house hold products. She is currently making a profit of about $71 per month and this is what she survives on. Once she gets this loan, she is planning to be selling in other market centre of Kangema and Kiriaini. This will increase her sales volume and profits too.

loans.use: Margaret would like to build a semi-permanent house for the family

loans.name: Safura

texts.en: Safura is an IDP from Kelbajar district of Azerbaijan. She came to Baku in 1993 and started her business in 1998 with her own money. She is married, has a child. In 2001-2006 she borrowed four loans from Normicro Baku branch totaling $2500 and increased her running capital. Now she plans to borrow $1200.

loans.use: To expand the volume of the business

loans.name: Pupa

texts.en: Cracking a coconut and sticking a straw in it to drink the coconut water is a favorite refreshment in Samoa.  Pupa and her husband harvest coconuts and sell them cracked and ready for drinking.  They set up a small stand by the road in their village and sell them to passers-by during the heat of the day.  They sell small drinking coconuts for ST 1 (USD 0.40) and large drinking coconuts for ST 2 (USD 0.80).  They have to sell a lot of coconuts to make enough money to live on and support their small child.  Pupa is thus applying for a loan to purchase some basic tools that will enable them to harvest more coconuts more quickly.

loans.use: Buy machetes and tools for harvesting and cracking coconuts

loans.name: Paraska

texts.en: Paraska runs a little business selling shoes and clothing at the popular Image shopping center in Beregovo, Ukraine. She has been in business for about four years, has worked hard to develop and improve her company, and recently made a large investment in it by moving into retail space she purchased in the Image center. Paraska once ran a small grocery, but decided to switch to clothing because it generates higher returns. Lending services from Nadiya Ukraine have been instrumental in helping Paraska develop her business. She has proven to be a wise steward with her funds and has repaid every loan on time. Now she has come to us for a loan for $750 to use as working capital to purchase additional sportswear and shoes to sell. She hopes that this summer will be profitable, and she will be able to generate enough sales and income to meet her needs.

loans.use: Purchase inventory of sportswear and shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy her merchandise wholesale

loans.name: Lusia

texts.en: Lusia F. is 50 years old, married with 6 children. She had been running her canteen for almost two years. Lusia's canteen sells donuts, drinks, German buns, etc., in her village’s primary school. Lusia is a new member for Saleilua Centre. Over the years Lusia always wanted to have a proper place for her canteen. She decided to join SPBD so that she could get some money to do this.  Lusia is planning to build a proper place for her canteen and to be able to sell other varieties of food.

loans.use: To buy supplies and inventory for her canteen business

loans.name: Seang

texts.en: Mrs. Seang D., age 29, works selling bread at a market, making $5 per day. Her husband is a soldier making $2 per day. They have two children who are students. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase more bread for her inventory to meet growing customer demand.

loans.use: To purchase bread.

loans.name: Nizoramoh

texts.ru:
Nizoramoh N. is 48 years old, has completed high school education, is married and has three children. Her main occupation is raising and fattening of cattle. She has 15 years of experience with raising cattle. Mrs N. is planning to use this loan to purchase several young calves for fattening and sale. She will sell them every 40-45 days. The money earned form the sales will be used to purchase more animals, and the left overs will be used to support the family. The client is planning to return the loan within the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Носирова Низорамох, возраст – 48 лет, образование среднее, замужем, имеет 3-х детей. Основным видом деятельности, которым занимается Низорамох это купля, откорм и продажа крупного рогатого скота. Она имеет 15-ти летний опыт в разведение домашнего скота. На полученный кредит она планирует приобрести несколько молодых бычков для откормки и продажи. Она будет их продавать через каждые 40-45 дней. Вырученные деньги она будет использовать на приобретение молодняка, а оставшуюся часть денежной суммы будет использовать на содержание семьи. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: purchase of cattle and feed for fattening

loans.name: Ivonne

texts.es:
Ivonne is a member of the local bank Las Mercedes. She works selling shoes, sneakers, and jewelry that she buys wholesale in Lima. She runs her business out of her home, in the district and province of Carhuaz, in the Ancash department. With a loan in the amount of 2,000 Peruvian sols, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy 2 dozen shoes, a dozen boots, and a variety of jewelry. Ivonne is 45 years old, married to a police officer, and mother of 3. She and her husband both work to provide their children with an education.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

L. señora Ivonne pertenece al banco comunal Las Mercedes. Se dedica a L. venta de zapatos, zapatillas y joyas que compra al por mayor en L. ciudad de Lima. El negocio está ubicado en su domicilio, distrito y provincia de Carhuaz, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará 2 docenas de zapatos y una docena de botas, además de una variedad de joyas. Ivonne tiene 45 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos y su esposo es policía. Ambos trabajan para educar a sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy shoes, boots, and jewelry

loans.name: Monica Isabel

texts.es:
Señora Mónica is a member of the communal Corazón de Jesús ("Heart of Jesus"), located at Jr. Las Palmas Mz C Lt. 13 in the district of Calleria in the province of Ucayali. She is 25 years old, has two kids, and her husband is a businessman. With the first loan of 300 Soles from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in selling boards of bolaina (a lightweight type of wood).

Presently she is dedicated to buying this wood in bulk and selling it in smaller quantities. Mónica has to go very early to the sawmill to cut the wood, and afterwards she brings it home to sell to her clients.

With the loan of 1000 Soles, which she will pay back in four months, she will invest in purchasing a large quantity of bolaina logs to increase her sales since the demand for her business has increased.

Mónica says that the business is going very well for her. It is growing and with the income obtained she plans to invest in a business of buying and selling plastics and aluminum sheets.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La señora Mónica pertenece al banco comunal Corazón de Jesús, ubicado en el Jr. Las Palmas Mz. C Lt. 13, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 25 años, dos hijos y su esposo es comerciante. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300 decide invertir en la venta de tablas de bolaina.

En la actualidad se dedica a la compra y venta de bolaina al por mayor y menor, Mónica tiene que ir muy temprano a los aserraderos para cortar la madera, luego la lleva a su casa para venderlas a sus clientes.

Con el préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual pagará en 4 meses, invertirá en la compra de mayor cantidad de trozas de bolaina para poder aumentar sus ventas ya que la demanda de su negocio esta aumentando.

Mónica manifiesta que le esta yendo muy bien en el negocio, que está creciendo y con los ingresos obtenidos piensa invertirlos en el negocio de compra y venta de plásticos y fierro de aluminio.

loans.use: bolaina logs

loans.name: Mercedes' Group

texts.es:
Mercedes, Paulina and Eugenia have belonged to the communal bank "Los Claveles" for 4, 2, and 4 years respectively.

Mercedes lives with her partner, is 24 years old, and has two children. She sells clothing in the Los Incas market., and is planning on traveling to fairs to sell clothing as well. Also, Mercedes will begin to make adobe-style bricks.

On the other hand, Paulina is married, is 48 years old, and has seven children, four of whom live with her. Paulina crafts bricks in her community of Huayllapampa. In addition, she sells food in the afternoons.

Meanwhile, Eugenia is married, is 36 years old, and has six children. Eugenia and her husband dedicate themselves to crafting adobe-style bricks for their community of Huayllapampa. Eugenia also raises native trees, tara, and piglets.

Mercedes, Paulina, and Eugenia need loans for 600 soles, 400 soles, and 600 soles, $575 total, money that they will invest in buying sand, meat, potatoes, condiments and in paying her laborers.

Mercedes, Paulina, and Eugenia dream of buying more land for making their bricks, of running a restaurant, and of their children having stable jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Mercedes, Paulina y Eugenia pertenecen al Banco Comunal Los Claveles hace 4, 2, 4 años respectivamente.

Mercedes es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 2 hijos, Mercedes vende ropa en el mercado Los Incas, Mercedes tiene proyectado viajar a las ferias para vender ropa. Además Mercedes comenzará a fabricar ladrillos.

Por otro lado Paulina es casada, tiene 48 años y 7 hijos de los cuales 4 viven con ella, Paulina fabrica ladrillos artesanales en su comunidad de Huayllapampa. Además Paulina vende comida por las tardes.

Mientras que Eugenia es casada, tiene 36 años y 6 hijos, Eugenia junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales en su comunidad de Huayllapampa. Además Eugenia tiene cultivos de tara y cochinilla.

Mercedes, Paulina y Eugenia necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arena, carne, papa, condimentos y para el pago de los peones.

Los sueños de Mercedes, Paulina y Eugenia son comprar más terrenos para elaborar ladrillos, tener su restaurante y que sus hijos tengan trabajo estable.

loans.use: Mercedes, Paulina and Eugenia need loans to invest in brick making, running a restaurant, and paying employees.

loans.name: Diana Marcela

texts.es:
Diana began her business because she needed extra income. She's a single mother and she was looking for a way to pay everyday expenses as well as for the house where she was living, a heavy expense that left her with little extra income. That's why she started the business, selling shoes from catalogs, 2 years ago.

She's asking for a loan of US$250, to be repaid in 3 months, so that she can buy merchandise and sponsor showings. With your help, she'll succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Diana inició su negocio por la necesidad de tener ingresos extras dado que es madre soltera entonces busco la oportunidad de trabajar por su cuenta ya que además estaba pagando la casa donde vivía y esto le representaba un gasto fuerte ya que le dejaba muy pocos ingresos, por lo que emprendió una actividad extra a su trabajo hace 2 años con la venta de zapatos por catalogo.

Solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía y poder realizar demostraciones. Con tu apoyo ella saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia F., wife of Mr. F., is a mother of three children: two daughters and one son. Their eldest daughter, Sehar, 12 years old, is in fifth grade. Their second daughter, Maryam is 10 years old and she is in fourth grade. Their son is nine months old. Safia has a dream to see her children secure their future goals. Her husband has a motorbike rental business. Her daily income is $6 to $7. She applies would like to apply for a loan to buy a motorbike to increase the rental business.

Her loan group members include: Zubaida B., who wants to expand her bakery business; Rehana B. who wants to expand her milk business; Mafia B. who wants to expand her tape recorder business; and Noor B. who wants to expand her motorbike rental business. This is loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Expand their businesses on large scale

loans.name: Luchando Por El Por Venir Group

texts.en:
Rosa M. is one of the members of the 10-person micro-bank, Luchando Por El Por Venir, which means Fighting for His Return. This small bank is composed of all Haitian immigrants who live in a small community just outside of Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic.

Each of these unique Haitian entrepreneurs unite in solidarity, allowing them to access funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own. The concept of this group bank paying their loan together is to reduce the risk of one person defaulting, as the others members gladly help cover one another’s payments in order to receive their next loan together.

Rosa M. intends to use this loan to purchase pants, blouses, women’s shoes, and perfume from the nearby city of Santiago. She will sell her inventory both on the streets of her community and from within her small home. She has established a reputation in her community for providing good quality clothing and has a small group of clients who come to her house regularly. Her business allows her to feed her three children and purchase school uniforms for them, a responsibility that she must face on her own as her husband has left her to provide for their children alone.

On behalf of Rosa, the entire Luchando group, and the team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support and awareness of the global issue of poverty, in which your efforts are helping to make a difference.

loans.use: To purchase pants, blouses, women's shoes, perfumes, and more for resale in the streets of Puerto Plata.

loans.name: Ms. Thu's Group

texts.vi:
Ms. N. Thi Thu (ID: 09050034) is 33 years old. She works for an organization in her neighborhood. In the past, Ms. Thu had to request loans from many different sources. But when she learned about SEDA and its saving method to pay back the loans, Ms. Thu has decided to participate in the program. In the first round of loan, Ms. Thu asked for a loan of 2.006.000 VND to breed pigs; the profit helped her renovate the toilet facilities. In the next round of loan, Ms. Thu wishes to borrow 3.360.000 VND to purchase food for her poultries.

Other members of the group include:

- Ms. N. Thi Binh (ID: 09050027) would like to borrow 3.186.000 VND to invest in her pigs and silkworms.

- Ms. N. Thi Bac (ID: 09050089) would like to borrow 3.186.000 VND to invest in her business.

- Ms. N. Thi Giang (ID: 09050039) would like to borrow 3.360.000 VND to invest in her pigs and making tofu.

- Ms. C. Thi Giai (ID: 09050037) would like to borrow 3.360.000 to invest in breeding silkworms.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Ngô Thị Thư (MS: 09050034), năm nay 33 tuổi. Chị là cán bộ phụ nữ trong thôn. Để phát triển kinh tế gia đình chị đã từng phải vay từ nhiều nguồn vốn khác nhau như Ngân hàng Nhà Nước, Ngân hàng Chính Sách Xã Hội. Nhưng khi được biết đến nguồn vốn của chương trinh, với hình thức tiết kiệm để hoàn trả. Chị đã tham gia vay C. kỳ một với mức 2.006.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn. Nhờ đó sau khi bán lợn gia đình chị đã sửa sang được công trình phụ. Nay chị tiếp tục vay 3.360.000 VND ở C. kỳ II để đầu tư mua cám lợn.

Các thành viên khác trong nhóm:

  • Chị Ngô Thị Bình (MS: 09050027), vay 3.186.000 VND để bổ sung vốn nuôi lợn, nuôi tằm.
  • Chị Ngô Thi Bắc (MS:09050089), vay 3.186.000 VND để bổ sung vốn đi chợ.
  • Chị Ngô Thị Giang (MS: 09050039), vay 3.360.000 VND để bổ sung vốn nuôi lợn làm đậu.
  • Chị C. Thị Giao (MS: 09050037), vay 3.360.000 VND để bổ sung vốn nuôi tằm làm tơ.

loans.use: Chăn nuôi và buôn bán

loans.name: Abida's Group

texts.en:
Abida baji is the wife of M. and the mother of three children: two sons and one daughter.  She belongs to a small city named Chichawatni, Pakistan.  She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the last 30 years.  Her sons are drivers by profession.  Her daughter is 16 years old and reads in 10th standard.  Abida baji's husband sells Punjabi snacks called "PAPAD".  He has been making the snacks for the past 15 years.  

Abida baji is a housewife, but she helps her husband by making the snacks.  Nowadays, her husband is out of stock.  Therefore, Abida baji is applying for a loan to buy materials (flour, cooking oil) to expand her husband's business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members.  Zuhra baji wants a loan to buy fruits to resell.  Parveen baji wants a loan to buy cloth to resell.  Khalida baji wants a loan to buy a lathe machine.  Sugran baji wants a loan to buy wood to resell.

This is a group loan.  The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business.  The members mutually guarantee one another's loans.  If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy materials for making snacks

loans.name: La Prosperidad Group

texts.es:
María M. madre D. tres hijos ha sido compradora D. pacas desD. hace un tiempo y ha trabajado una parte D. su vida en la venta D. ropas nuevas y usadas. María tomó la decisión D. solicitar un préstamo a través D. un BD. al cual se le llama actualmente Prosperidad donD. está operando nuestra oficina en Samaná. María decidió invertir su dinero en su negocio, esperando sea prosperado por medio D. este, esta es una Sra. La cual como toda dominicana le encanta la carne y su pasatiempo favorito es leer libros y le piD. a Dios por un futuro mejor para su familia el cual sabemos el nuestro Señor se lo concederá.

Maria is part of a larger group of 35 men and women.  Only 20 are taking out new loans right now, her loan represents the other 19 individuals in her Bank of Hope.  Her group members have businesses in everything ranging from small grocery stores, to fried fish stands, to clothing and  shoe sales.

On behalf of Maria, her group, and everyone here at Esperanza International-- we thank you for your support!
texts.en:
María M. is a mother of three children. She has been a buyer of bulk clothing for some time and has worked part of her life in the selling of new and used clothing. María maD. the decision to ask for a loan through a BD. called “Prosperidad”\ in Samana, where our office is operating. María decided to invest her money in her business, hoping that it is successful. As all Dominican women, she enjoys meat and her favorite hobby is reading books and asking God for a better future for her family which we know our Lord with grant her. Maria is part of a larger group of 35 men and women. Only 20 are taking out new loans right now, her loan represents the other 19 individuals in her Bank of Hope. Her group members have businesses in everything ranging from small grocery stores, to fried fish stands, to clothing and shoe sales. On behalf of Maria, her group, and everyone here at Esperanza International-- we thank you for your support!

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more used clothing to re-sell to her community members.

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Ibrahima  B. est un pere de famille. Il a comme  activité le commerce de detail  qu'il exerce dans un quartier appelé Grand Mbour. Il a une bonne experience  de cinq ans dans le domaine du commerce de Détail.  Avec le pret ibrahima envisage d'augmenter ses stocks de marchandises pour accroitre son chiffre d' affaire et améliorer ainsi sa condition de vie et celle de sa petite famille. iL est trés dynamique et est membre de l'IMCEC depuis quelques mois.
texts.en:
Commerce is an activity that occupies a good number of Senegalese. Ibrahima for one retails foodstuffs, i.e. has a general store, in Senegal. Shops like hers are found in all the neighborhoods of Mbour. With her loan, Ibrahima wants to expand her inventory so as to increase her turnover.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Được 34 tuổi tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương năm 1997. Trước khi chưa tham gia Qũy Tình Thương kinh tế  gia đình chị còn gặp nhiều khó khăn do thiếu vốn để kinh doanh, được sự giúp đỡ của chị em trong xóm giới thiệu chị đã tham gia Quỹ, nhờ đồng vốn vay của Quỹ chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn để mở rộng kinh doanh mua thêm hàng về bán như quạt điện, máy say sinh tố, từ đó kinh tế gia đình chị ngày càng phát triển. Thu nhập bình quân từ bán hàng mỗi ngày 200.000đ. Chồng chị làm nghề xe ôm thu nhâp 60.000đ/ ngày, chị có 2 con hiện các con chị đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 15.000.000đ đầu tư vào kinh doanh hàng tạp hóa.
texts.en:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Được is 34 years old. She is a TYM fund member since 1997. Before joining TYM she and her family were facing difficult time due to lack of money to start a business. With the help and support from her friends from the neighbourhood, she joined TYM fund to get a loan. She bought and sold electric goods like fans, electric blender ... .Since then her family's finance has improved. On average she makes 200.000 VND. Her husband is a motorbike taxi driver making 60.000 VND a day. She has 2 school aged children. This time she is requesting a loan of 15.000.000 to buy grocery to sell.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invets in her grocery store

loans.name: David

texts.fr: Né vers 1975 dans l’arrondissement de KESSOUNOU de la commune de DANGBO, monsieur   D. Y. David est marié et père de 2 enfants dont 0 scolarisé. Il est un cultivateur dans le village de GLAHOUNSA de la vallée de l’Ouémé et est membre du groupement  GH MISSIMAHOU DE GLAHOUNSA. Les habitants de ce village font les travaux champêtres à la décrue du fleuve ouémé. Leurs terres sont riches et les offrent un bon rendement.  Leurs spéculations principales sont la culture du maïs, du piment, des légumes, du gombo, de la tomate et du manioc. Le problème de ces habitants riverains du fleuve est que, en période de crue, ils n’ont plus d’activité et dépensent tout le revenu issu de la campagne écoulée à la consommation. A la décrue ils n’ont plus d’argent pour payer la main d’œuvre indispensable pour emblaver la superficie à eux disponible.  La pratique dans le milieu qui consiste au bradage des récoltes ne les sécurise pas et les runes d’avantage. Cette pratique est la vente à un prix dérisoire de la récolte future a un nantis pour disposer de la somme nécessaire aux travaux champêtres. Fatigués de cette pratique il a sollicité un prêt de 140 000 FCFA pour l’exploitation d’environ 1,5hectares des spéculations susse indiquées.
texts.en:
Mr. David D. Y. was born around 1975 in the KESSOUNOU district of DANGBO village. He is married and the father of two children, none of them attend school. He is a farmer in GLAHOUNSA village in the Ouémé valley and is a member of the HOUEDOME group GH MISSIMAHOU DE GLAHOUNSA. The inhabitants of this village work the land after the fall of the level of the Ouémé river. Their land is rich and offers a high yield. Their main activity is growing corn, peppers, vegetables, okra, tomatoes and manioc. The problem for these riverside residents is that, during the flood period, they no longer have anything to do and spend all the income generated from the sale of their harvested produce. When the river level drops they do not have any money left to pay for the workforce essential for sowing the available land. The local practice of selling cheaply the harvest does not provide them with financial security and further bankrupts them. This practice involves selling the future harvest at a rock-bottom price to an affluent person in order to have the required money to continue farming. Tired of this practice, they are requesting a loan of 140 000 FCFA (USD 275) to farm about 1.5 hectares of the aforementioned land.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Farming of 1.5 hectares of corn and peppers

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia is a member of the Señor D. Luren Village Bank. She is 54 years old and has eight children. Claudia has a store in her home in the San Melchor neighborhood, where she sells dry goods, vegetables, meat and sodas seven days a week. Claudia also owns a car, which her son drives as a taxi. Claudia needs a loan of 900 soles to buy sugar, rice and milk. Claudia dreams of putting the finishing touches on her home.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Claudia es socia del Banco Comunal Señor D. Luren. Claudia es casada, tiene 54 años y 8 hijos, Claudia tiene una tienda en su casa ubicada en el barrio D. San Melchor en donD. venD. abarrotes, verduras, carnes, gaseosas, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Claudia tiene un carro con el cual trabaja su hijo haciendo transporte publico. Claudia necesita un préstamo D. 900 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. azúcar, arroz, leche. Claudia sueña con hacer todos los acabados a su casa.

loans.use: Buy sugar, rice and milk

loans.name: Sothanak

texts.en: Mr. Sothanak C. is a villager in Trapaing Sam village in Takeo province. He is a rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock and re-sell later at a better price. His wife, Mrs. Hing Koy, is a farmer who cultivates rice on a small plot of land. Mr. Sothanak C. is 39 years old and the father of three children who are all attending the local school. His wife is presented in the picture with him. Mr. C. would like to expand his successful rice-selling business and is requesting a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To puchase more rice and expand rice business

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is a simple entrepreneur selling vegetables and poultry animals such as chickens and ducks.  She also raises hogs and she personally feed them and clean their pig pen.  

Beatriz shared all her sacrifices in the business for the welfare of her family.  Due to lack of capital, she wants to avail loan amounting to PHP6,000 to further improve her business so that she can support her family and send her children to school since there were times when her income is not enough to provide them with their educational needs. She intends to use the loan to buy another piglet that she can sell afterwards.  She is hoping that she can sustain all her ventures by simply working hard and managing her time wisely so she will never waste every opportunity that comes. 

She was married to Allan, a farmer and they are blessed with four children: Divina-15 years old, high school student; Bernadeth-14 years old, also in high school; Jonathan - 12 years old, elementary student and Adrian, 3 years old. Through their small enterprise, Beatriz and her husband are helping each another to somehow uplift their poor living condition.

loans.use: To buy additional piglets for fattening

loans.name: Eng's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of four members. Its leader, K., 28, is single and lives with her sister who helps K. with her business. K. owns a general store in front of her house and sells plastic, charcoal, small tools and cooking ingredients, among other items, and she has been in this business since 2000. She buys her products from the province's market in bulk and sells at a reasonable retail price to the community. She sells all of her products from the store. She wants to renovate the store to increase the size of her business. To do that, K. is asking for a loan to buy more products for her general store. 

The other group members are: H., 53, who works as a dish seller in a private sector, and is taking a loan to buy more poles for her house; Kimchhhom, 22, who is a local construction worker, and is taking a loan to build a house for his family; and K., 48, who serves as a local police officer, and is taking a loan to buy more cooking ingredients for her daughter. They all live in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To buy more products for her general store

loans.name: Dionesio

texts.en:
Dionesio R. is managing an RTW business. RTW or ready-to-wear business is common in their place. He is 38 years old and looks after the needs of his only child. His wife, Marcela R., is helping him in their business. He started his RTW store in 2000 and since then he was able to sustain his business. He wished to make it grow. 

He is asking for a loan of Php 18,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy additional merchandise. He believes that displaying more items will attract more customers and definitely sales and income.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that helps people, especially the poor, to start and have their own business. CEVI reached out to more people to have their own livelihood. CEVI gives not only credit to their clients but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.en:
