Demetrio H. is a man full of determination. He is 46 years old. He is married and a responsible father to his six children. His wife is taking good care of him and their children. Demetrio goes into farming and at the same time he does pamiling (traditional gold mining) in their place. This is Demetrio's way of looking for extra income.

On the other hand, Demetrio also owns a mini grocery store, where he sells basic goods. Demetrio wants to extend his heartfelt gratitude to the lenders who gave the opportunity to him for such a loan. Demetrio now is applying for a loan amounting to PHP 11,000.00. He is optimistic that his request will be realized.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for his store

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is thirty-one years old. She is married with three kids who are currently in school. Mary sells electrical appliances like rice cookers, fans, televisions, irons, etc. She buys her supplies from importers at wholesale prices and sells to her customers at retail prices. She is requesting this loan to enable her to procure increased stocks of electrical appliances.

Mary hopes the loan would enable her to increase savings to expand her shop to include refrigerators and parts. She belongs to the community group called "Joyful Family" Trust Group. In this group, members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To procure increased stock of electrical appliances

loans.name: Kigongo Teopista ‘S Group

texts.en:
Teopista is the leader of a loan group with five members. She is widowed with four children aged between 21and 30 years. None of her children go to school .She resides in and owns a six-room house which houses six people. Teopista also takes care of additional family members. The family has access to piped water and eats three meals a day Teopista sells sweet bananas in the Nakawa market and she sells to an average of 20 customers a day. She has been in this business for fourteen years.and works six days a week. Teopista has been with MCDT for six years with the same group mates  She is requesting her 12th loan to buy more bananas and she hopes to begin to buy them directly from farmers and increase her profit by reducing her purchase costs.
  

 


  

4-Najiba Damalie 
5- N. Mary

loans.use: To buy more bananas for resale

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 34 años, vive en la casa de su tía con su esposo y sus 5 hijos de 12,10,8,6 y 2 años. Desde hace más de 5 años, junto a su esposo, se dedica al cultivo de la papa, la cual cosechan  y procesan, sancochando en grandes cantidades, sacando la cáscara y posteriormente haciéndola secar al sol; luego la venden en el principal mercado de su ciudad. Por la gran demanda de papa, Gloria y su esposo optaron por darle un valor agregado a su producto, vendiéndola como “papa seca” la cual es usada para varios platos regionales y así es más rentable para ellos. Para un futuro cercano esperan sembrar en más extensiones de terreno para que su producción sea en mayores cantidades. Este es el primer  préstamo que tiene con MFP, Gloria está muy entusiasmada por el trabajo que va a realizar en su banco comunal, por lo que se compromete a ser muy puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de costales y de más papa de otros agricultores para procesar en mayores cantidades.
texts.en:
Gloria is 34-years-old and lives in her aunt's house with her husband and five children, who are 12, 10, 8, 6, and 2. For more than 5 years she and her husband have earned their living growing potatoes, which they harvest and process; they parboil them in large quantities to remove the skin, and let them dry in the sun. Then they sell them in their city's main market. To increase profitability, and because potatoes are in such high demand, Gloria and her husband have opted to provide some added value by selling their product as "dried potatoes", which are used in a variety of regional dishes. In the near future, they want to plant on more plots of their land to increase production. This will be Gloria's first loan with MFP. She is very excited about the work she'll be doing with her village bank, so she is committed to making prompt payments. She intends to use her loan to buy sacks, and more potatoes from other farmers so she can increase production.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks and potatoes

loans.name: Sao's Group

texts.en: This small loan is being requested by two borrowers. Its leader, Mr. Sao P., 49, has a job driving a motorcycle taxi for a profit. He is married with four children: two are married and have ready started new family homes, while the others are employed as garment workers. His wife is a fresh fish seller. Sao P. will be using this loan to improve his wife’s investment by buying additional fish to sell. The other borrower is Mrs. Heng N., 29, who works in the garment industry, and is asking for a loan to buy a motorbike for riding to work.

loans.use: To buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: María Angelina

texts.es:
La señora María Angélica C., está muy agradecida por el gran ayuda que le brindaron para invertir en su negocio el cual le está generando ingresos.
Nueva mente está solicitando su cooperación para un crédito, ya que tiene la necesidad de reparar el techo de su casa ya que el actual está en muy malas condiciones y teme que le pueda pasar un accidente. 
Planea pagar el préstamo con los ingreso de su esposa el señor Juan Francisco Mendoza quien trabaja en el ferrocarril en el aria de obrero.
texts.en:
María Angélica C. is very grateful for the great help that you have given her by investing in her business, which is generating income.

Now she is requesting your help in providing another loan, which she needs to repair the roof of her house. It is in bad shape, and she is afraid it could cause an accident.

She plans to repay the loan with the income of her husband, Juan Francisco Mendoza, who works for the railroad as a laborer.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairing her roof

loans.name: Savalia

texts.en:
Savalia F. (0) is a 33 year-old woman living in the town of Mulivai Leauvaa.  She is married and has 3 infant-aged children.  To make a living, Savalia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale.  Savalia has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 600 WST a month from these activities.

In 2006, Savalia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Savalia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.  Savalia is now requesting a new loan of 1,200 WST which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.  The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by her from SPBD.  Savalia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
“Persevere for the success of life” says Cecilia. She is a responsible housewife of Bruno and they live in the rural community of Barangay Salvacion, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. Despite of her low educational attainment, she has the strong determination to improve their status of living and give their four children a better future. Their primary source of income is through charcoal retailing business. Her husband makes charcoal out from his cut woods in the forest while Cecilia is the one who retails the product in the market. 

She wanted to borrow loan from Kiva amounting to PHP5, 000 for the maintenance of their charcoal making business and somehow will enable her to expand into selling other vending products like vegetables. Her income in the business daily helps her provide for the needs of her children who were enrolled in high school and elementary.

loans.use: additional capital
